<Author>vinnychase
<Content>Good Hotel Stayed at the Caribe Hilton in late July 2008. In my stay I was able to experience two towers of the hotel. First they put me in the Main Tower. This part of the hotel was just ok. It was older, but the rooms looked renovated with new furniture  large bathrooms with two sinks  an overhead rain shower. The bad part of the room was my view looked at a construction site,  the noise woke me up every morning. After 2 nights of my air conditioning breaking down  the staff trying to fix it, I asked for a room change. The Hilton staff was somewhat unwilling to do this (said the hotel was booked  could not change rooms), but after talking to a manager I was able to be moved into the Executive Tower. This part of the hotel is much nicer. The rooms are newer, although bathrooms are smaller (no rain shower) than the older tower. I had an awesome view of the beach  ocean. This tower also has the executive lounge where they have breakfast every morning (bagels, fruit, pastries, cereal, coffee)  hors devours after 5pm. In both towers the rooms I had featured safes  small fridges. The resort part of the hotel is nice. They have a 2 tiered pool, hammocks, a gym  tennis courts. The private beach is a little small,  the water was somewhat choppy. Old San Juan is around 15 min by bus  the bus stop is a 2 min walk from the hotel. Condado is about a 15-20 min walk from the hotel. If you take a cab its about $15 to each destination.One of the problems with the hotel is the area. Besides the resort  neighboring Normandie hotel, there is not much around. If you want to eat quick, the only options to eat close to the hotel besides the overpriced hotel restaurants is Subway Sandwich across the street.After visiting Condado, I wished I stayed there because of proximity to restaurants  nightlife. There are many nice Casino/Resort Hotels there, and a ton of restaurants on that strip within walking distance. So, if you're a person who doesn want to walk, take a cab, or bus every time you want to eat stay in Condado.Overall, my stay at the Caribe Hilton was decent. Although, I'm not sure if it would have been as good had I not been able to switch rooms  have access to the breakfast lounge. Like I said, if I was to stay in around the San Juan area again, I would probably stay in Condado. Extra Info: You will be charged a resort fee every day of your stay. Also, had some good pizza at Via Appia in Condado  if you're looking for close nightlife to the hotel the La Concha in Condado is nice. The lobby  pool of this hotel have a Miami nightlife feel. Good looking crowd, good music. Must do tours:The Rainforest TourThe Biobay Tour (watch your hand glow in the water!)  
<Date>Jul 26, 2008

<Author>eatlocal
<Content>Wonderful Experience We were a bit apprehensive after reading some of the negative reviews on this site. However, we noticed that the majority of reviews were positive and went in to the stay hoping for the best. We wouldn't be disappointed! The hotel grounds, gardens, pools, beach, and overall scenery and views were spectacular! The staff was all very friendly, helpful, and always willing to go out of their way to make the stay more enjoyable. The staff at the pool bar was wonderful - especially Hiram who always remembered our names and what we wanted to order (we usually ended our days at the pool bar). We stayed in the HHonors tower on the 19th floor and our room was very nice with a great ocean view. The mini fridge in the room was nice to have and the remodeled bathroom with the tavertine shower and double sink was beautiful as well. The executive lounge was nice to get the evenings started with light snacks and cheap drinks. The breakfast in the lounge was very adequate and the free soda and water was great during the day. We did a lot of our eating at local restaurants (highly recommend the Parrot Club and Raices) but did eat at Morton's at the hotel. It was expensive but one of the best overall meals we've ever had! We did use the spa for massages and were pleased with those services as well. Overall, we had a great experience at the Caribe Hilton and would not hesitate to return or to recommend to others!  
<Date>Jul 22, 2008

<Author>cmego
<Content>Ok - Great Potential We stayed four nights at Caribe Hilton. Checking in was easy. The resort looks nice on the outside, clean grounds, well lighted in the evenings. Being a diamond member I expected a nicer room then we got. Didn't seem like an upgrade to any standards. The lobby was nice. Our floor needed a nice new fresh coat of paint. Our room was ok - STANDARD small balcony to sit out and enjoy a nice cup of coffee. The bathroom was the best part of the room, larger then most standard rooms travertine shower double sinks. There is a mini refrig. in the room.Executive lounge is nice we used it several times. They charge for your alcohol in this exec. lounge, most others do not. They do however have a great set up for breakfast, snacks and light dinner items. We were impressed. The staff is very kind.The pools are nice there are several. Beach is ok - very kid friendly. They have activities going on every hour (I liked that). Food is expensive, but you expect that at a resort.We toured Old Puerto Rico and found it to be interesting, fun, and safe. I would visit again and stay at this resort.  
<Date>Jul 14, 2008

<Author>NJFrequentTraveler
<Content>Perfect weekend getaway I spend three nights with my partner at the Caribe Hilton in June and had a perfect weekend. Yes, it's pricey to eat and drink in the hotel, but you know that before you get there! I'm a Hilton HHonors gold member and we got an executive floor room in the main building. Despite being the oldest part of the property, the room was modern, clean and attractively decorated. We also had access to the Executive Lounge with free breakfast, soft drinks all day and evening cocktails and food. (The cocktails aren't free, but at only $3-4 each they are a third of the price of downstairs!)We spent much of our time relaxing on the beach and by the pools and although the hotel was busy, the area was never overcrowded. The main downstairs bar had a lively atmosphere every night, with great rum punch and mojitos. We also ate at Morton's, which was elegant and excellent as always - and it has windows overlooking the ocean - the only Morton's I've been in with windows!A 10 min walk takes you over the bridge to Condado for many casinos, restaurants etc. and a short cab ride takes you to Old San Juan.I would definately go back to the Caribe for a relaxing weekend again!  
<Date>Jun 20, 2008

<Author>bluesalley
<Content>inconsistent room quality and overall horrible experience I was booked for four nights and five days for a fairly expensive conference rate (close to 200/night) and was very disappointed. I stayed in the lagoon villa section. The room overlooked an active construction site with a polluted lagoon. Several others in our group have commented similiarly about the run-down condition of this hotel. When I asked for a room change, information was recorded, but then I never heard from anyone. When I checked they pretended like they had never heard the complaint before.Last but not least, the internet connection was slow and very spotty....

<Author>bahstengirl
<Content>Service was terrible, room was ok, food was expensive We stayed here for a romantic getaway. When we arrived we could tell the service was going to be an issue. The valet/check-in stations were not well organized. We went to valet the car and told a guy we wanted to park. He told us to leave the car and then he forgot about it. We went to check in (which took 30 mins!...no one is in a rush here) and they still had not moved it. We walked over to the car and told them we wanted it parked and then they took care of it. Once we got checked in we asked to have our bags delivered to the room. After waiting 45 minutes, we called and they said they would send them up. After 15 more minutes we went downstairs to find them still sitting where we left them. We ended up taking them up ourselves.We ate by the pool and ended up spending $100 on 2 drinks each and sandwiches! We ate at most of the restaurants and found the food and service to be average with the exception of Lemongrass. While this was our most expensive meal (we ate just apps and drinks and it was still $150!) it was by far the best meal of the trip. I found the pools to be a bit chilly, crowded and noisy with lots of kids. We actually rented a car and drove to Ponce for the day. We stumbled across a place called Copamarina and will stay there next time. The pools were perfect, spread out and they had more activities on the beach (parasaling, snorkeling etc. right outside the room door!)  
<Date>Jun 13, 2008

<Content>Nice surpirse My family and i stayed at the hilton caribe in Arpil for 2 nights. I always love a nice bathroom. One other thing i really liked was the mini refrigerator in the room. What a nice thing to have with 2 little ones. The hotel also has some toys for little kids which was a big plus for us. My kids really loved it. They also have nice shops. The only thing i can say bad was the pools. When we were there, the pool water looked very green. It did not look fresh and clean. No one was using the pools. I think they were aware of this and cleaning the pools. Nice little beach there too. Over all I had a plesant time and I would for sure go back to this hotel if i ever go to puerto rico again.

<Author>greenmountainguava
<Content>Fabulous Old School Glam Beach Hotel We had an altogether too brief day and a half at the Caribe, and a fabulous dinner at the very romantic Lemongrass there. The beach is small, but the water and views are perfect. We stayed at Copamarina earlier in the week and I preferred the beach at the Caribe. The open air lobby, the hammocks by the beach, and the view of the old city wall are a few of the many nice details to the architecture and landscaping. It was old-school, 1950s hotel glamour. I really enjoyed it. One caveat--we splurged on a villa and really, the hotel grounds are so nice its not worth the money to be in a plush but surprisingly small room.

<Author>Jeff74
<Content>Nice hotel We stayed at the Caribe Hilton from 5/14-5/18 and loved our time here. We usually take a nice vacation once a year, and since we let our passports expire, we thought we should try Puerto Rico. The location of the resort was ok, right in the middle of everything, and an easy cab ride to Old San Juan, and Isla Verde. I would have to say that is the only downside of the property, is that you have to take a bus or cab and can't really walk to anywhere that is close. I highly recommend the Condado Area.. lots of places to eat outside the hotel (Danny's Pizza was awesome) and it's close to a couple of casino's. We ate at Morton's one night, great food, nice atmosphere, what you would expect from a nice steakhouse. We did however eat at the Parrot Club in old San Juan two nights. It was one the best places I have ever eaten, hands down. I recommend getting only appetizers and ordering a few, they were all outstanding! Don't forget desert also, the banana spring rolls were amazing! OK, be sure to see the forts. Both are really awesome if you like history. As for the rest of the hotel, lobby, pool, restaraunts were all first class and we enjoyed the pool bar immensly. Hiram and Jose will take good care of you if you take care of them. The room was a little Dumpy for being a Hilton, but I know the place is old. All in all, I would defintely recommend the hotel. Everything people said about prices are true, but if you are prepared, it's no big deal. It's not Mexico. Enjoy!  
<Date>May 27, 2008

<Author>JohnroFlorida
<Content>Loved the Caribe Hilton Stayed this past weekend at the Caribe Hilton and absolutely loved it. Arrived around 2 PM but was advised that the room wasn't ready yet. The woman at the front desk advised that the standard check-in time is 4 PM but gave me a card with a phone number to call to find out if the room may be ready sooner. Sat down in the lobby and within 10 minutes one of the managers came over, saw the card, took it, said he would check for other available rooms, and came back with 2 card keys and directions on how to get to the room. That is what I call service and paying attention to detail as well as to your customer. Was placed in the Main Hotel. The room and the hallway had been renovated but could tell there had been some water damage in the room. No mold or stale smells though. Bathroom had some upgrades but could use some more work to give it a more polished modern look. However, it was clean and nice size and after a day some of the older features had developed a certain charm. No complaints on the room, everything up to date (minus the LCD TV), extremely comfortable bed, balcony with table and two chairs, and refrigerator (a microwave would have been nice too). Ate at Palmeras twice and had the buffet. The restaurants like most hotel restaurants are pricey but the food was good. For those without a rental car, there is a subway and a ice cream shop at the end of the block. Went there a couple of times to help offset the more costly meals. Also, took a cab to San Juan ($22 round trip) for sightseeing and to try some other restaurants (about a 10 minute ride there and 15 minute ride back due to the increased traffic). The recreational areas of the hotel were truly spectacular. From the tranquil garden area to the pool and beach areas. The hammocks and the fish feeding pier were nice extras. Always plenty of staff in the pool area adding chairs as needed and keeping things maintained. I will definitely be back!  
<Date>May 20, 2008

<Author>missmybid
<Content>Overall a Great Resort Just returned from a three night stay at the Caribe Hilton. This is a great resort, we had a wonderful time. The open air lobby is very nice and all of the staff we dealt with were excellent. The pool and beach areas are both very nice. You can rent kayaks and pool/beach toys at the hut which is located in between the beach and the pool area. There were waiters on the beach on the weekend, but not the weekday I was there. Also, on the weekend, there is yoga on the beach at 9:00 a.m. which was very good.Not to be overlooked is the small cafe in the spa building which is located at the end of the beach, in a seperate building from the hotel. They make wonderful fresh, made-to-order wraps here which we got for lunch everyday and took out onto the beach with us. They also have breakfast items and smoothies. The wraps were only about $10 each and much healthier than the menu at the pool bar.The store just across the street is a great place to go to stock up on water, beverages, and snacks. The rooms do have a refrigerator so you can keep your snacks cold. The rooms were very nice, the beds were great. The balconies are big enough to enjoy a cup of coffee on and feature a small table and two chairs.Having a Starbucks in the lobby was great. A coffee and a bagel in the morning will run you about $5.My only negative remark would be not necessarily about the resort but about Puerto Rico itself. The shoreline is very built up, one high rise hotel or condo building after another. The buildings just seem to be on top of each other near the water. It is not a deterrent once you familiarize yourself with the resort, but when I first arrived I was a bit disappointed with how congested the area was.  
<Date>May 20, 2008

<Author>chsmith
<Content>Better than I Expected But There's Room for Improvement I stayed at the Caribe Hilton from May 5th - May 8th. I liked a lot of things about the hotel (the open-air lobby, the Starbucks, the cleanliness of the rooms and the tropical garden) but there were a few issues:1) There was no one at the check-in desk when I arrived. If you were Hilton Honors or a VIP your line was staffed but there was no one there for normal check-ins. Not the best first impression.2) Room service trays and garbage were not picked up promptly from the hallways. When my next door neighbor had dinner his tray of half-eaten food remained outside the room until lunchtime the next day. This happened more than once.3) Beach service was spotty. One day there was someone taking orders but the next day there was no one to be seen. I don't mind getting up to get my drinks and food but sometimes you just want to veg out and not move.4) Food and drink prices are extraordinarily high. $10 for a Bud Light! That's ridiculous. 5) There needs to be a higher level of attentiveness to guests from some of the staff. One evening when I tried to get a cab to take me to the casino at the El San Juan Hotel, it took 5 minutes of standing around before the staff stopped chatting with each other to ask if they could help. All in all, I had a great trip because the weather in PR was wonderful and the beach at the hotel was really all I needed for a relaxing stay. Would I stay here again? Maybe if I found a really great rate but it wouldn't be my first choice.  
<Date>May 15, 2008

<Author>Maridol
<Content>Wedding Anniversary  Stayed at the Caribe Hilton from April 17-21  LOVED IT! We got room 824 (original bldg)  don understand what another reviewer is talking about when they say there is smell  noise from the extractors belonging to the restaurant below. Maybe we were lucky (it was breeze the whole time), but never heard or smell anything  we sat on the balcony multiple times every day, at all hours. Service was great  very friendly. The room was a good size (junior exec rm-1 king bed) very clean  in good condition; the beds, pillows  linens were so fluffy, soft  comfortable. Normal size bathroom, especially compare to most European ones. We stayed on one of the executive floors, worth the extra money. Those floors are elevator key access only, good for extra privacy  security. They also give access to the lounge which has a wonderful buffet type cold breakfast, in the late afternoon-early night they have free appetizers  drink for half of what the hotel bars charge, during the day they have free sodas, water, cookies, fruit, nuts, etc. Didn try any of the restaurant, but the menus looked VERY pricey?The pools  grounds (not as expansive as when I was a child) still wonderful. The small private cove-beach is perfect, no waves to knock you off your feet, crystal clear water  the peace of mind that we could snooze off without being concern with our belongings. My only complaint is that the hotel didn have enough large beach umbrellas  the ther?ones they were giving us (2-3 to cover two chaise lounges) were this $9.99 pieces of garbage way below the stature of a Hilton. We are a couple with no children but the hotel is perfect for families?w/children. And last but not least, don miss feeding the fish (even if you are not a kid)?/p>

<Author>enderart
<Content>Loved the Hilton, Hate the Hampton Inn After my first trip to Puerto Rico and staying at the one star hotel called the Hampton Inn priced at $179 a night, for only only an additional $16 I booked the week at the Hilton Caribe Hotel. What a difference, first of all the people are so friendly and tell you the reality of the island. I wanted to go Scuba Diving, they informed me what was the best way and to avoid any of the locals because everyone comes back disappointed; which I followed and it was awesome! The property itself was very cool, great pool scene, cool restaurants, awesome gym and private beach area. The room was great, cold a/c, the scene from the room you looked over some restaurants, but when you come in at around midnight you only see stars and hear the beach. The executive center is not as nice as others I have been to, like in Ecuador or Argentina; but the staff was very accomodating. All in all, this is where I am staying from now on, when I go to Puerto Rico.

<Author>firemanAlbany_NY
<Content>Loved the Caribe Hilton We went for my son's 4 year old birthday and the hotel was excellent. Since I am a Diamond Hilton Honors member, we were upgraded to the Condado Suite, which is 2 bedrooms, 2 1/2 baths. The views from the 20th floor were excellent.The Executive lounge had a continetal breakfast, snacks all day and drinks from 5:30-8pm. The happy hour drink prices were $3-$4 a drink, very reasonable.My wife didn't care for the breakfast too much since there wasn't much protein on the breakfast bar but alot of carbs. Since it was part of the room charge, the lounge served its purpose since my son could eat alot of fruit and cheese.The onsite hotel restaurants were ok and we ate at the pool restaurant everyday. Kids under 5 eat free if there is an adult meal purchased.We would recommend this hotel to all families with children. The pools are excellent and the beach is protected with no waves to knock the children over.

<Author>RedCarnationReady
<Content>Heaven!!! A+++ Best Hotel Stay Ever!!! Where do I begin, from the moment I stepped foot out of the taxi to The Caribe Hilton's dramatic and expansive open-air entrance...I was met with the warmest of welcomes! First of all, this self-described NYC Sex and The City gal is not used to Taxi drivers jumping out and opening the door for her but in PR, that's how it goes and it was...LOVELY!Where do I being...Israel, the Bellman that helped me when I arrived was eager to grab my belongings and help me settle in, you can tell that the entire Bellman team enjoys their positions and that they are a happy team. Miss Maity (the Pre-Arrivals Manager) made sure that I had accomodations on the Exec Level floor and was as lovely in person as she was on the phone. That Front Desk area is quite the pressure cooker but she and the rest of the Front Desk team handle things well and really try to make the guests' experience the BEST it can be.The Executive Lounge was the BEST, BEST, BEST!!! Mr. Omar helps keep things as smooth as possible and besides being extremely easy on the eyes , he is a very good manager... if you go to the Execd Lounge and see a man that looks like a Latin movie star in a custom-made Armani suit - THAT'S OMAR! Omar helped make it possible for me to extend my stay another two days and treated me like a VIP. Another Exec Lounge associate worth mentioning is Miss Annia who is both super-professional and sweet as sugar and is a real asset. The lounge is just a great place to enjoy a delicioso cafe con leche and meet other nice travelers in a calm setting. The Continental breakfast is lovely and the servers are quick to keep things tidy; there's a certain code of conduct you see up there from the staff and they are all lovely people con clase.The best part for me outdoors is the hammock area; imagine swinging in between two huge Palm Trees for hours - it's this sort of experience that blew me away because despite the grand size of the hotel, there are still...quiet...places...for...simple...solitude.Chef Pagan at Lemongrass (on premise) is a big star; a likeable guy that has created the most beautiful Asian fusion restaurant overlooking the Hilton's Tropical Gardens. Try his Cardomon Ice Cream - fantastico! Sit in the open air sofa area and have a Mango Martini and some appetizers (blue fin tuna on top of plaintains served maki-style). Just wonderful.Also, the Housekeeping Staff is lovely and get ready for the BEST BED OF YOUR LIFE!!! These beds are UNREAL. I even went on [--] to buy the pillows!!!One last note, my friend and I found beautiful branches on the beach that we wanted to bring home but someone suggested that we have them lacquered - well, I asked a bellman about this and within 5 minutes, someone from Engineering came to my room to do this for me! Can you say SERVICE! I stayed here after a 4 day stay at Las Casitas at the El Conquistador and I can say without hesitation the the Caribe Hilton and its' pride-filled staff will exceed your expectations to the point that you will invariably R=E-L-A-X like never before. It's private beach, close proximity to Old San Juan and EXCELLENT Customer Service make this the best hotel experiernce I have EVER had (and I've stayed at The Breakers in Palm Beach, The Williamsburgh Inn. etc)I am going back in a few weeks and taking my best friend - it was THAT GOOD!Two more things: There is a bus near the hotel that'll take you to Old San Juan for 75 cents, it takes 8 minutes and it is 100% safe. FYI, stores in Old San Juan basically close at 6PM. Restaurants close by 8:30 or 9PM. Have a cup of coffee at La Bombanera during the day!!! HILTON BED = LA BOMBANERA COFFEE!!!ENJOY YOUR MAGICAL STAY!!!  
<Date>May 4, 2008

<Author>BeachBoy123
<Content>Great Hotel Great Location Our family of 4 (2 adults, 2 children ages 4 and 8) spent 6 nights at the Caribe Hilton. Our review is as follows:Check In: Not so great, we arrived at 2PM and didn't get a room until after 4PM. Granted the check in time is 4PM, but the wait was longer than I expected.Room: Bedroom was well maintained with a very comfortable bed, we didn't have the flat panel TV, but other rooms in the tower and executive floors did have them. The carpets are clean and well maintained as was the furniture. There was a lot of storage space which is a plus.Bathroom: Was well maintained but there was a tile missing in the shower. The sink faucet and countertop were in good condition.Grounds: The grounds of the hotel were well maintained. The pools are large and accommodated the people using it very well.On Saturday and Sunday, chairs weren't available around 2PM all other times, chairs were available.The beach was great and shallow. It was never crowded and only had some leaves floating on the water. Others: The gardens and lobby are well maintained.Restaurants: I didn't eat anywhere expect for Atlantico for lunch and the food was OK, It was expensive but the kids ate for free or half price. Good drinks but expensive. Starbucks was good.Executive Lounge: Very nice with good selection for breakfast. They have an espresso machine that made fresh cappuccino, I was in heaven. They also have cookies at night and drinks at 5 (at $3 a drink they are a bargain).Location: Great location with a private beach, close to Condado and Old San Juan. We drove to Old San Juan every night and had dinner there.Overall: The hotel was great for families and you could enjoy yourself without feeling crowded. Remember the hotel has over 800 rooms.Puerto Rico Itself: Awesome island, great people and great food in old San Juan. Try Raeces, Sofia and Il Trammerli they were great.  
<Date>Apr 29, 2008

<Author>ERM10
<Content>Blah This is a very old property and no matter how much they renovate it still shows it's age. New carpet, furniture and paint cannot hide the fact that the moldings are rotted and warped, the doors are thin as cardboard and everything is just old and tired looking. The bathroom is small and the balconies are tiny.Apart from the bartenders at the swim up bar (they are great) the service was mediocre. It took me literally 30 minutes to check in and get clarification that I was supposed to be on a Club level floor. Restaurant service was ok, not bad. Food was expensive (like everywhere else) and mediocre.The Pool was dirty in spots and tired, hot tubs were not hot in the least. They do have a nice little protected beach for kids to swim but the water is like the beaches back here in New England (except warmer of course) and not the nice Carribean blue that you hope for.I wouldn't think of staying here again. I guess we got what we paid for as this was a last minute trip and the Hilton was cheaper than other places in the area that we were looking at.  
<Date>Apr 28, 2008

<Author>Debbie66MonroeCT
<Content>Great place to stay The Caribe Hilton is classy and EXTREMELY clean. I didn't even see a single bug in my room the whole stay. We loved the reception we received upon arrival. And in our room, there was a slight problem with the toilet that they took care of immediately once I called about it. The beds were very comfortable  the room had a nice amount of dressers, desk space  closet space. The restaurants are so expensive! The breakfast buffet was $24 per person, with no lower price for kids - and dinner buffet was $30 per person. Ridiculous! We quickly learned to favor the Starbucks for our breakfasts  snacks, and the staff there was the friendliest. Some of the hotel staff were a little snobby, like a few of the valet parking people - esp. over the phone. I hadn't planned to use the valet parking (an extra $5 per day on top of the $15 per day to park) - but otherwise I would have had to schlep across the street to a parking garage with construction all around. I felt maybe a bit of resentment of the guests from some of the staff, and I thought I was a pretty great tipper....It was a little boring at night - we were only there Monday-Friday, and apparently there is no entertainment until the weekend. Basically, you are faced with added costs every way you turn - but otherwise, it's a great, comfortable, beautiful hotel, with several different eating options, nice pools, nice beach area,  some other nice amenities.  
<Date>Apr 27, 2008

<Content>Overpriced hotel My family stayed here post cruise for one night. This was a very nice, clean hotel but not worth the money. It is considered a resort which is why it probably costs more. <Author>vinnyjake
<Content>One of best in San Juan I go to PR 3-4 times per year on business and have stayed at all the larger San Juan hotels over the years. When I bring my wife , I stay at the Hilton. Rooms are generally good but try to stay in main buildings as outlying buildings are a bit of a walk from the lobby and some have bad views (of construction sites and the back side of the lagoon). The grounds are among the very best and cover the largest area of all San Juan hotels. Never a problem getting a good chair around the pools and the grounds are very well maintained. Beach has a breakwater so there are no waves, great for less aventuresome waders and swimmers. Closer to Old San Juan than other larger hotels but a car or taxi is needed to get to Old San Jaun or to the Condado for the best San Juan restaurants.  
<Date>Apr 15, 2008

<Author>Sparty92
<Content>Stay Elsewhere! Stayed here last week and will not be staying again despite that I'll have to travel to San Juan quite often for work.I checked in after a long, crappy day trying to get to San Juan and was looking forward to konking out in my room. The check-in was easy, however, only one of the two keys I was given worked. Additionally, there were several other pieces of paper in my folio which were not described. Still have no clue what they were for. Got to my room  expected a bit nicer being a Hilton Honors member. The room smelled musty  gross and it was very chilly. Tried turning up the temperature to no avail. Called Guest Services who advised Engineering would be on their way. Called Guest Services again 30 minutes later to see if they were coming that evening or when. The engineer tinkered with the unit and advised it was fixed. Unfortunately, it never did warm up, but I was too tired to deal with it and went to bed.Arrived back in the room after a day long meeting to find it freezing yet again and really, really smelly - like sewage. Had received a voicemail from the Hotel hoping my stay was going well and if there were any issues, to call the Manager on Duty. I tried calling the MOD, but no answer so I called Guest Services again. They sent up another engineer and housekeeping. This guy at least tried longer to fix the unit  housekeeping sprayed the room with some stench cover-up. Neither worked. I was checking out the following morning  didn't feel like dealing with the lack of service that was evident throughout the hotel, so I just went to dinner and then came back to the hotel to sleep. Had I been staying any more time, I would have complained to the front desk  to the Management. Not sure what good it would've done, though.Considering the Caribe Hilton? I would highly recommend you stay someplace else.  
<Date>Apr 13, 2008

<Author>Cumminghome
<Content>Great vacation at the Caribe Hilton! Had a wonderful spring vacation at the Caribe Hilton. I was very apprehensive on booking this hotel because the reviews were either great or horrible, however, I could not of been more pleased. I was traveling with my wife and two children ages 7 and 11. The hotel pool and beach area were perfect for them. My son loved snorkling so much that it was hard to get him out of the water. Plenty of fish to look at along the rock wall they constructed to make their lagoon. The pool was clean and inviting with plenty of chairs. We mostly sat at the beach and had the attendant put up an umbrella, always tipped a couple of dollars and they remembered for the next day. Service was excellent at the towel hut and a couple of dollars tip goes a long way in getting good service. There was bingo and pina colada tasting every day, the rest of the advertised activities did not always appear to go off. There was always day old bread available to feed the fish off their pier which went into the Atlantic. The hotel lobby was open air and reminded me a hotels in Hawaii. For a hotel nearly 60 years old this hotel was renovated to stay up with the times. Got my room on Priceline for $110 a night so I was sure I would get a room on the first floor looking at the AC units or dumpsters. Was pleasantly surprised to get a room in the HHonor Tower (I am only a HH blue) room 766 looking out at the Atlantic. The room was modern and the bathroom was luxury. The shower was a huge walking in shower with two shower heads including a rainfall shower head which was great for a tall person as myself. Never had any problems with hot water as some had mentioned, but I am not up before 6am. I believe all rooms are non-smoking as they mentioned this at check-in was the Puerto Rican law, which was perfect as I hate smoking rooms. They had very comfortable beds which had down feather pillows and comforter which my wife is allergic to, so I had housekeeping come make up new beds, which actually took three seperate trips. However, my wife gave the housekeeper a $20 tip and she was more than happy to get it taken care of. Must of had the same housekeeper take care of our room a couple of days later as we got extra towels, soap, and toiletries. It is amazing what a few kind words and a couple of dollars can do to improve the attitude of the workers around you. Breakfast a Palmeras was excellent and the kids eat for free. Dinner was good at the hotel, but we eat most of the meals outside of breakfast away from the hotel or at the beach. $10 - $12 cab ride got you into Old San Juan which is a beautiful old city. $22 - $25 cab ride to the airport. Rented a car to go the El Yunque rainforest. Easy to drive around Puerto Rico and was not as dangerous as travel books had indicated.Overall we had a great time. My wife and kids said it was one of the best vacations that they ever had. We typically stay at Hyatt or Marriott's and I would rate the Hilton at the same standard as these type of establishments.Enjoy your trip to Puerto Rico.  
<Date>Apr 13, 2008

<Author>DandDPennsylvania
<Content>Beautiful Resort We enjoyed our one week stay at the Caribe Hilton from April 2 thru 9, 2008. This resort property is wonderful. Beautiful grounds, great food, and friendly service. We booked an executive floor room to get the breakfast and evening snacks. Our room overlooked the pool and beach. The cost of meals and drinks here are very expensive, but we expected that. The weather for our stay wasn't great. We had a few days of rain and it was very windy everyday. We understand that strong winds are common here. We only took one tour - the city tour. Our advice is to take a cab ($10) on your own and make your own tour. The guided tour is not worth the money as most of the time you are on your own anyway.  
<Date>Apr 13, 2008

<Author>richshill
<Content>Good Hotel, But.... The good things about the hotel are good: room was great (stay in the main building, not the additions); restaurants were very good (see exception) and the grounds and beach excellent. We enjoyed getting a piece of bread from the attendant and feeding the fish off the end of the pier!What wasn't good. The hotel is expensive with lots of nickel and dime items; what in the world did the maid do for a Maid Charge of 50 cents? The breakfast buffet was $17.00 without eggs, $23.00 with eggs. I didn't have eggs but was charged the $23.00 anyhow and had to complain. Plus, as is common with Puerto Rican hotels, on top of the room charge you're hit with a resort fee.So, it's a nice hotel with good, helpful staff and lots of niggling charges that add up quickly!  
<Date>Apr 12, 2008

<Author>Traveler1943
<Content>Services slipping I have stayed at this hotel since 1986 about once or twice a year for both business and pleasure. (I have also stayed at 7 other hotels in the San Juan area.) I have seen it when it was owned by the government and manged by Hilton through many changes including its current look which was put in place to accomodate large quantites of crusie ship passengers either going or coming from a cruise.Through all of the changes (5) the Caribe Hilton continues to have the best beach in the Condado area. It is worth going there for that alone. (If the beach is not important to you try El Convento). Another big plus, it is a 5 minute cab ride to Old San Juan (a real treasure).The level of service always seems to vary. At present the hotel staff is very courteous and tries to help, always with a smile. I did notice some of the more experienced older staff gone and the new people who were quite younger by comparison.The staffing at the Executive Lounge has been cut from 3 to one person. The snacks served in the Excutive Lounge were mostly bread and peanuts. Also, although they advertise being open unitl 9:30 PM for coffee and dessert. They closed all three nights that I was there (Fri, Sat, Sun) at 7:30 PMI had to help the person at the concierge desk book a golf trip with a car to take us there and back. I have been doing this trip for 3 yrs. In the past I had to only give the time to the person at the concierge desk. They arranged the rest. Again young, friendly but inexperienced. It appears that the valet staff is reduced during certain hours.Also the water in the shower was turned down to room tempertaure during the night and raised at about 6:00 AM. I called the front desk at 5:00 am and was told to take my shower after 6:00 AM.Overall occupancy appears to be down hence maybe some of the cutbacks. I subscrbe to a weekly business newspaper from Puerto Rico. All of the hotels in the San Juan area seem to be reporting a drop in occupancy this year.We did not eat meals at he hotel as we were out with local friends at some of our favorite restaurants. (this is perhaps my 80th trip to Puerto Rico). Our hotel just becomes a base of operations unless I am at a resort out on the Island. I did make it a point to eat breakfast twice at the Palmeras restaurant. Though pricey the breakfast buffet is first rate.  
<Date>Apr 8, 2008

<Author>aintlion
<Content>Great hotel, beautiful suite, few issues Nutshell:Hotel: Excellent Service, lovely groundsRoom: Fabulous but hot water is a problem. Housekeeping did a super job.Spa: Awesome service, facility and amenities need upgradingRoom Service: Perfect every timeMortons: Always a pleasure. Dropped a bundle on dinner and it was wonderful and we had a great time.Rotisserie Il Giardino: If I was the FB Manager at the Caribe Hilton I would shut it down immediately it was the worst restaurant experience I have had in years._________________________________________________My wife and I stayed several nights in a San Geronimo suite on a romantic getaway.The hotel is beautiful. The staff was very friendly. We didn't want to leave the room. In fact we wanted to stay an extra night and the staff was able to accomodate us.The San Geronimo suite is in one of the newer buildings on the hotel grounds and a short hike from the lobby. Even though the hotel was near capacity we never once had to wait for an elevator or even share an elevator. In fact, we never saw another guest in our building the entire time we were there. That was strange.The room was simply fabulous. It had a living room with a kitchenette (microwave, fridge and coffee maker) and 1/2 bath. It also had a balcony, sleeper sofa (not too comfortable to sit on, though), dining room table with 4 chairs and a 40 or so LCD TV. The bedroom had a very comfortable king size bed, another balcony, another TV, large closet, dressing area, and a surprisingly smallish bathroom. I was a little surprised that they didn't enlarge the bathroom but it was still very nicely equipped with great amenities.Problems in the room: Hot water was hard to come by. Eventually it came, however, it was quite annoying. We spent an afternoon at the Olas Spa and got some lovely treatments. The spa staff was very accomodating and they new how to give great massage and body wraps and I highly recommend them. The spa facility and amenities left a bit to be desired and felt old. They wanted us to shower twice but they only gave us one towel. All in all still very good experience.We had an amazing dinner at Mortons Steakhouse on property. We love Mortons. We drank too much, we ate too much and we laughed a lot. The wait staff was fun and we even made friends with some other guests there. It was a very inviting, warm atmosphere.Then the next night we had dinner at the italian restaurant on property, Rotiisserie Il Giardino, and it was exactly the opposite. We went in for dinner and the place was almost empty (a few tables seated). We were whisked to our table by the maitre d. The server brought us the menu and offered me the wine list (I was still nursing a hangover) which I declined and he all of a sudden got cold (since we weren't going to buy a $100 bottle of wine this night). We had some questions about the menu and he was very rude in answering. We placed our order which included 1 appetizer to share, 2 salads, 2 entrees, and 2 cokes.Throughout the entire dinner, this waiter never approached us again (until later).Another guy, a young hard worker, brought out the appetizer with my wife's salad. I very nicely requested that he bring my salad because I expected the appetizer first before the salad. Of course, the waiter didn't put in a salad order for me. So I asked for a salad so that my wife and I could have salad together.The appetizer was just a simple bruschetta. The topping on the bread seemed like it had been blended rather than chopped and it tasted funny. And I don't think the bread had been toasted.The salad dressings tasted watered down.Then our main courses (delivered by yet another guy not our waiter). I had veal marsala which was okay. The potatoes and the vegetables were absolutely delicious. The entree was just okay. Passable. I could get just as good a dinner at the corner pizza shop and pay 2/3 less.My wife got some chicken thing that was wayyyyy too salty. But she, too, loved the potatoes.We never did get our Cokes. Right after they brought our entrees we stopped a busboy (or waiter, there's no telling) and asked for our 2 Cokes. Seemed like it got turned into a much bigger deal than it should have been and even then it took like another 10 minutes for us to get something to drink. A refill would have been completely out of the question.Right after we left (it took 15 freakin minutes to get our check after we declined their coffee and nasty dessert) we walked over to Starbucks for coffee and dessert and a good laugh.Anyways, stay away from this restaurant. Eat dinner every night at Mortons.Oh yeah. Back to the hotel.All in all we had a wonderful time. The weather wasn't great all week so we didn't do much at the pool or beach. It was windy every second of every day and rained a bunch.But we ventured out quite a bit and we enjoyed being tourists in Old San Juan and elsewhere on the island. Aside from a couple of minor inconveniences and one lousy restaurant experience we would definitely recommend this hotel.  
<Date>Apr 7, 2008

<Author>jbwright1
<Content>Loved the Caribe Hilton! My wife and I anguished over reviews of this and other hotels in P. R. before settling on the Caribe Hilton. We arrived the week after the last review and missed the storm but saw some of the left over damage.We are so happy with our choice. While we can't speak for the views from other rooms, our room 538 in the Main building had a beautiful view of the Pool Area as well as the Private Beach and the Ocean. We could see the Ocean from bed. The room was very clean and nicely furnished with Tropical Colors and Wood Tones. The Room was large,Comfortable and very Clean. The Grounds were extraordinary with many Pools, Hammock Groves and the only Private Beach on the Island. The service from the staff was the best we have experienced. The Hotel is in an area by itself so there's not much to do around but it's a 75 cent 10 minute bus ride to Old San Juan. Adjacent to the Hotel is a Large Public Beach and Park which is very nice and has lot's of Palm Trees for shade. There were many choices for restaurants (6) and some were fairly expensive and others were moderate. The Buffets at the Palmeras were very good including the Friday Night Seafood Buffet. Cheap Breakfast and Lunch can be had at the Subway Restaurant across the street. All in all we are very happy with our choice and look forward to returning to the Caribe Hilton.  
<Date>Apr 3, 2008

<Author>sazcleveland
<Content>Loved the Caribe We really loved the hotel. It was perfect for a family with young kids. We were there for a week and found the staff to be more than helpful and curteous, especially Gabriel at the Concierge desk. We stayed in the Garden Wing in a 1 bedroom suite which was Huge with spectacular views of the ocean and garden.The beach was terrific and the pools were beautiful.The only downside was that the staff for the kids program was hit or miss. My kids would have loved to have the activities a llittle more organized, but it didn't effect our stay. We took a day trip to the rainforest which was great. (on our own, not thru the hotel).We did not find the hotel to be very expensive, after all, it is a resort in the Carribean. The kids ate for half price at the pool bar and the restaurants in the hotel were g reat. We had free continental breakfast on the 9th floor of the main building which was great. All in all, it was a great trip.

<Author>ccfRhodeIsland
<Content>not awful Our room was in the tower and was nice -- lovely bathroom and ocean-view balcony. Sadly, the week we were there there was an off-shore storm that created surf that Puerto Rico hadn't seen in two decades and all the beaches were closed. Then, a 25-foot wave washed over the sea wall and filled one of our pools with sand and debris. None of this was the Hilton's fault and they worked hard to get things back to normal. But it was Easter week and there were a zillion kids there. With the beach and one of the pools closed, it felt like a city pool at the remaining pool. The hot tubs were never hot, and I felt at least one of them should be reserved for adults. Kids belly flop in all of them all day. (Their parents seem oblivious.) As an adult with no young kids, I probably wouldn't go back. My adult daughter and I went to the casino at the Ritz Carlton one night and drooled with envy at the setting. I did, however, find the staff at the Hilton to be attentive and friendly, and the buffet breakfast included in our room was very nice.  
<Date>Mar 28, 2008

<Author>florida078
<Content>LOVED this hotel and the safe beach!! We really loved it here, and like the other reviewers, wish we could have stayed longer! I didn't get a chance to visit the spa or make use of their free kayak/pedal boat hours, the salsa lessons, etc. Next time hopefully!There were a lot of activities, the pools were great, sipping on the pina coloda drinks (everyday free pina coladas around 1pm for a hr at the swimup bar) in the hot tub looking out at turquoise waters and a warm breeze in the many palm trees was amazing! There is a free breakfast room on the 2nd floor in the towers(just use your regular room key), and use of their excellent espresso machine all day, as well as pops, waters, cookies etc and a happy hour from 5-8. The best part was the beach, absolutely gorgeous with the fortified city walls and san geronimo fort framing each side of it, so effectively creating a small cove. This means that the water is shallow and is safe for families to swim. As is the case in many coastal destination spots, the undertow can be dangerous and drownings can occur. THe beach here is perfect : secluded, private and safe. There was never a problem to find lounge chairs and they freely set up umbrellas wherever you wanted.FOr kids, there is a slide in the ocean at 4ft, small play structure right on the beach and another park near the tropical fish pond, a pond with swans, daily feeding of the fish at the pier, hammocks, sandcastle building competitions, infant pool, a giant chess board outside, tennis court, basketball net, an indoor games room, craft/dance activities, a beach hut that lends out pails, shovels and water wings, etc. We will definitely be returning here!! The staff were very friendly and appreciated when you tried to speak Spanish.ps. the balcony in the room is quite nice to sit out and watch the waves.

<Author>daisytcam
<Content>Wish i had stayed longer Just spent a few days there and I had a pleasant experience from the time i arrived until the time i left. Will definitetly go back if i find a good deal on rooms as the hotel can be pricey.The grounds were beautiful, the pool was immaculate, the breakfast buffet was well stocked and varied. I went to Morton's steakhouse for dinner as well and even stepped into the starbucks for breakfast on another day. I wish i had had time to try out the spa!I love the open air lobby and my only inconvenience was that my room had two double beds and the one bed closest to the mini fridge had to be moved away in order to open the fridge. My room overlooked new construction unfortunatetly, so what would have been a nice view of the water, is now a parking lot and a new tower. I got construction noise around 9am or so but nothing too bad. I'd sleep with the balcony door open and had no outside noise all night so that was great (from either the cars or the villas guests that i faced. I even got to use the business center to print my boarding pass and the guy at the desk was helpful and very courteous. There is a gelato place on the corner at the entrance of the hotel with a subways and around the corner was the bus stop heading into old san juan for just 75 cents. (exact change only).

<Author>LisaK73
<Content>It's just OK My husband and I were away for our first vacation away since our children. I did read this website and was very confused by the reviews. One of the main reasons I choose this hotel was because it was listed as 4 stars and did not have a casino (my husband likes to gamble and I don't). I will say the service checking in was fine but when I realized the first evening that they did not mention the free breakfast that was supposed to be included we went back to the front desk. They did take a few minutes but then gave us new keys that let us into the executive floor dining area. I thought we scored big but I will say it is a basic continental breakfast and from 5 - 8 pm a cocktail hour that had awful appts. and one night only had one wine choose which had to be the worst wine of ever drank.I would say that the service and people were slow and rude but it seemed to be a common theme in PR. I thought the place was fine but more of a two or three star than a four star.

<Author>theAtlantan
<Content>The Hilton was okay, PR is great! The Hilton Caribe is a nice place overall.( *I'm use to staying at really nice hotels like the J.W Marriott and Ritz, so that's my point of view).I stayed in the Villas with 3 of my friends ( 3rd floor w/ ocean view).The bedroom is an okay size- 2 queen beds, nice bathroom and nice balcony view of the condado.The kitchenette is cute, it includes a small fridge, sink, microwave, cabinets, and counter space.Bedroom Cons: not much floor space for luggage, no WIFI (which was a HUUUUGE disappointment). I couldn't believe that in 2008 Hilton didn't have WIFI in the bedrooms. But we were able to pick up the WIFI from the Condado Plaza Hotel (Mariott- i think) across the water. So make sure you know how to use your phone as a modem or bring some type of wireless card if you go. (they only have free WIFI in the lobby). Room service is really expensiveBedroom Pros: Nice clean linen, nice size bathroom, nice balcony, good service. You can also buy food and store it in the cabinets and fridge.--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------The Hilton was not as glamorous as I thought it would be, but it is nice. The lobby was clean and it's kind of cool how it's connected to the outside- meaning that when you arrive to the hotel you get out of your car and automatically step into the lobby. The pool and beach area is great, simply nice. Its not grandeur, but its very extensive- the property includes alot: gardens, pools, jacuzzis, beaches, playground area, bars, decks, ponds, exotic fish and animals and more- I was not able to fully explore this area, but my friends were able to and they LOVED it.It's a great place for couples at night.The villas has its own separate lobby which is really small, but its somewhat convenient when you need help and information. But I did NOT like all the construction being built - because of the construction going on outside the lobby of the Villas, the outside of the villa area was ugly (very gray and gloomy).Overall Hilton Pros: perfect location- the Hilton seems to be in the middle of everything (Old San Juan (5 minutes away), the Condado (5 minutes away), Isla Verde(12 minutes away), Airport (15 minutes away) plus its a low traffic area so we barely got caught in traffic (which is everywhere in PR), the Hilton pool and beach area offers the widest variety of things to do, and nice people.Overall Hilton Cons: all the Construction, no WIFI, not very glamorous, lack of floor space in rooms w/ 2 bedsMost people say the Hilton is overpriced, but I personally think you are paying for the location over anything else b/c the hotel itself is not very ritzy- it's sort of aesthetically disappointing, but you have to keep in mind that this is Hilton's first hotel in the Caribbean (they actually consider it historic)----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------I also visited The Ritz, El San Juan Hotel, and the Intercontinental. The Ritz's beach was very disappointing and dirty.The intercontinental lobby, beach, and pool area was really pretty (i visited at night), but they all seemed kind of small (and their Casino is really small, but busy). El San Juan Hotel is the hot spot- the lobby is BEAUTIFUL and very grand i felt like i was in a fashion magazine- EVERY person there was BEAUTIFUL. It is veeeerry busy, so if you want to watch alot of beautiful people-go there. If you ever visit that hotel (especially at night) be sure to have your best and most fashionable clothes on w/ makeup  hair done etc. (women should wear dresses that compliment their body types with heels and men should just look clean and smell good). If you want to live the high life you should stay at a hotel like El San Juan, but if you want to relax you should stay at a hotel like the Hilton. El San Juan Hotel is sort of a place for single people (their are too many temptations there especially for men) and other hotels are better for couples and families.-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------OVERALL Puerto Rico Advice:First off, I lost my camera in a taxi on the first night which made me really sad (b/c i lost over 200 pics) and put a little damper on my trip. So I greatly advise everyone to find one taxi driver and stick with them throughout your stay (be sure to ALWAYS get their name, number, and taxi number or license plate). But moreover to Truly experience Puerto Rico you should rent a car. After my experience I advise you to use taxi's for a day, then drive after that- you can get more done and you feel more free!Places to visit:1. Old San Juan is a must at night (eat at a great restaurant and walk around and visit a club or three)2. The rain forest (this was probably the best day we had in Puerto Rico- it was BEAUTIFUL!)- bring water and/or drinks, oh and good shoes3. Culebra, Vieques, or Gilligans Island - you MUST visit one of the three (but visiting one of those will be an all day trip because you will need to arrive early and take ferries to them (so be sure to bring snacks, drinks, snorkel equipment, and an umbrella).4. Forts in Old San Juan (Fort San Cristobal is better than el Morro)5. For young people: -Isla Verde at night is a must, definitely go to the clubs, bars, and El San Juan Hotel -Senor Frogs (old san juan), Brava (el san juan hotel), and just ask around. . . (Vibes seemed nice, but we didnt get to go)6. The Condado at night is really pretty too, when we went there were singers and performers on the big lawn/park area.7. Ponce is a nice area with many historic places, gardens, etc. . .(old french town so it looks different from old San Juan).You should plan before you get there b/c its very easy to go astray and not get as much done as you want.Remember that EVERYTHING closes early (around 6pm) so tourist activities MUST be planned early and they must be done during the day. At night Old San Juan, the Condado, and Isla Verde are the best. . .If you drive be very cautious b/c people drive very loose down there. Though Puerto Rico is an American territory - 75% of the people their speak Spanish ONLY -if not more. So you should have a basic knowledge of spanish and download some type of translation program on your phone (i just used babelfish.altavista.com- which is an online translator). Walgreens are everywhere (and that will be your grocery and everything else store during the trip (we went almost everyday:-).---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Overall I LOVED Puerto Rico and I was not ready to go back after 5 days, I felt like I needed atleast 1 or 2 more days. I loved how racism and colorism just seemed to go out the window and everyone loved/liked each other for who they were and respected everyone's individual beauty. So don't be a typical stiff American when you go- relax, have fun, talk to random people no matter their background, race, or ethnicity.Most phone companies don't charge for using your phone in Puerto Rico, but call and make sure. Okay, I think my review is long enough. . .Vive (las) Puerto Rico! lol. . . .Adios!*make sure your camera has a strap on it and put your name and number on it- I would hate for anyone else to lose their camera.* you'll easily notice that most Puerto Ricans seem to be in relationships b/c everywhere you go there will be couples*as an attractive dark-skin woman of color i felt sooo Beautiful in Puerto Rico, everywhere i went i was told how gorgeous i was, not only by Puerto Rican men (and even some women) but by many white Americans (people seem to lose their prejudices in Puerto Rico)- this made my trip even better- i felt like a Goddess there:-)  
<Date>Mar 22, 2008

<Author>logcolb
<Content>Great place for the right price This can be a great place to stay depending on what you pay. We booked this on Priceline (bidding) for $115 per night. For that price it was a steal. We booked it for before and after a cruise. It is actually a very nice hotel in a great location and has an excellent pool and beach. The hotel has a large open air lobby which is nice but not as classy as the Wyndham El San Juan but nice enough. The hotel has been built in phases over the years. We were in the original building which I prefer since all of the rooms have great water views. Some of the later buildings have sections that look out on other buildings and parking garage, etc. The rooms are a decent size with nice bathrooms and very nice beds and bedding. The furniture is a little dated. The hotel has an excellent location on a peninsula into the water on the outskirts of Old San Juan. You are only about a 10 minute ride from the cruise ships and Old San Juan. If you are looking for a lot of nightlife and shopping outside your door this is not the place for you. The nicest part of the hotel is the beach and pool area. The beach is on its own cove, not much in the way of waves, but otherwise very nice. It has a great pool area and a nice area with hammocks and palm trees for shade. We are members of the Hilton Honors and were put on the club floor. The club floors have the use of a very nice lounge with free snacks drinks, newspapers and computer. For $115 per night this was a great deal. We were originally booked at the Marriott for the stay on the return from the cruise, but at $350 a night for the Marriott and $155 for the Hilton it was a no brainer. If you are going to pay $350 a night I would consider the El San Juan or the Marriott, but with the discount rates on the Hilton it is well worth it. My only complaint was that it does not have a casino, so you need to get a cab to go to a casino or to go to other restaurants. We ate at the Morton's on a great web promotion, 2 excellent meals for $99, but the other hotel restaurants looked very overpriced. They do have a Starbucks in the lobby.  
<Date>Mar 21, 2008

<Author>beachlova2
<Content>Good for young children...BUT..... PROS: *This hotel is great for children...there are many daily activities including a play ground, basketball, tennis, feeding fish at the peir, arts and crafts, gameroom, large pool and kiddie pool with floats and noodles offered, small man-made beach with no waves, slide in beach water, paddle boats/kayaks. *There are many shops with unique clothing, art, jewlrey, gifts, etc...There is a Starbucks located in the lobby.  *Good Pina Coladas...they were actually originated there. *Located 5 minutes from Old San Juan. Taxis are always available and costs about $10 per trip. *Grounds are beautiful...large pool, pond with swans and ducks, nice ocean views and city views, small old fort located on property. *Executive levels in the main building and the towers offered a continental breakfast (which included cereal, fruit, pastries, oj, coffee). CONS: *The rooms stink...literally. We walked in and we were welcomed with a strong scent of mildew...Yuck!!! Oh, the things we can't see...scarey. *The Service is the pitts!!! When checking in the front desk told us that we were receiving a renovated room with a beautiful ocean view. Upon arriving our room, we saw that what we received was a worn stinky room facing a concrete building being constructed. When we called about it...Oops! Sorry, all the sudden there are no other ocean view rooms available. Also, when checking out, there were charges on our room that did not belong to us. The staff was kind and never rude...but they did not go out of their way to help. *Service is very SLOW! Our room was not cleaned until 5 PM! When calling downstairs, you are either put on hold indefinitely or there is never an answer at all. Also, valet took a long time retrieving car...sometimes we felt like it would have been easier/faster to just get it ourselves. One morning during breakfast, they ran out of milk at 8:30 AM and said they could not get anymore for a while. More milk appeared about 45 minutes later. (In defense to this...the hotel is very large with many people to please, so I assume that it takes longer to respond and serve.) *Parking costs $20 per day!  *There is always activity and noise going on...not a quiet place if that is what you are hoping for. Many small children running, screaming, crying...it is a positive to us to watch all the children at play, but the noise can be a bit much. *Hotel food and drinks are expensive!!All in all, our kids seemed to enjoy all the activites the hotel offered...but due to the lack of service and the rooms we would most likely not stay here again.

<Author>mzbanana13
<Content>Disappointed with the Hilton Caribe I was pretty underwhelmed with this hotel. The pictures looked gorgeous and I was expecting a certain standard from a Hilton Hotel. Unfortunately I did not get it.We arrived at to be greeted a very snotty and downright unfriendly receptionist who rambled off the instructions to our room while rolling her eyes.The room was big and much to our surprise had a cute little kitchenette. It also had construction directly across from our balcony. Although I didn't expect to spend much time in the actual room (this is a tropical paradise after all) the never-ending jackhammer noise started to get annoying. The pool was nice with plenty of pool chairs. The drinks were stiff but expensive. The food selection in the 8 restaurants on the premises was bland, boring, and over-priced.I guess the crux of my disdain for the hotel when we called THREE times for a blanket within over the course of an hour. I won't be staying at the Hilton again.

<Author>LAM4
<Content>Presidents week @ Caribe Hilton We stayed at the Caribe for our school break this year. We traveled with 3 families with kids 10-16. 10 of us all together.We have traveled every Feb break for the last 10 years. That being said my review of the Caribe Hilton is great. The biggest problem we encountered was the wind and that had nothing to do with the hotel.Our check in was quick and painless, the only glitch was that we were all not on the same floor. We did not get crazy but asked if they could move the one family and it was done the next morning. Our reservations were for the executive level. It was worth the extra money for breakfast in the morning it had something for everyone, snacks and sodas(including water) during the day and cocktail hour at night(although they now offer a cash bar where in the past it was free). We even made it a point to be back to the hotel so we could get a cookie before bed!T hey just installed a new system to get to the executive room floors(8-10) you need to slide your room key in order to push your floor button and it did not always happen on the first try and we took a few rides up and down till we heard the BEEP and knew we were going to our floor.Our rooms were fine and I thought the bed was comfy. Like I said we have been going away for the last ten years and we have slept in some really bad beds.The pool area was clean and although this was a peak break time and the hotel seemed to be busy we never seemed to have a problem getting a bunch of chairs together. It is not like we had to get out there at 6AM. We had breakfast and got out there around 9:30 The water was a bit cool for me but the kids all got in and played around.The beach area was fine. If you are looking for waves dont look here. The beach is great for little ones. Again we never had a problem getting chairs there either. Maybe we would have to walk down the beach. But we could always get a seat.They have a list of activities down by the beach they seem to have lots of things planed for the little ones. I did see a yoga class one day and a bunch of people playing bingo another.They have a volleyball net but it is in the grass( a big disappointment for our group) but like I said it was also very windy so it would not have been fun to play anyway. We never had a problem getting a towel. Sometimes they took your room number and sometimes they did not. I am not sure how they decided what system they were using. They had basketballs that you could sign out.  This trip has been planned since last june. In Jan I saw on the TA forum about a food a beverage credit through go to PR.com I called my travel agent. Our trip fit all of the criteria including the hotel. So we were given a 250.00 FB credit to each of our rooms. That took the sting out of eating at the pool bar for lunch. We just sent the kids each day over to order lunch. We ate 3 lunches and one dinner(at the restaurant near the pool) plus a few cocktails and we each only went over the 250 by 40 dollars. Not bad. One day the dads went to subway and brought it back for us. It also helped that we brought down waters with us from the executive lounge.We took the bus(.50cents) each way exact change per person to old San juan on two evenings and had dinner and a walk about. We did take cabs back. They were ten dollars each cab. I have to mention that the buses do not run like in Cancun you will have to wait up to 20 min. It was deffinaly worth it because we could move all 10 of us for 5.00 compared to the 20 or 30 dollars for the cabs each way We walked into Condado for dinner but we took a cab back.We rented a van from target(not related to the stores) and took a tour of El Yunke and then spent the day at Luguillo beach. The beach was beautiful and you can rent chairs and umbrella right there(5.00 and 10.00 respectively). We booked a snorkle adventure through the tour desk for one day.I would deffintaly reccomend this hotel to a friend and we look foward to visiting Puerto Rico again in the future.

<Author>mysister'ssister
<Content>Yikes! Very Expensive Stayed in 3 hotels during my 10 day stay in San Juan, 6 nights at the Caribe. Staff were very nice, no problem there. Pool was OK but too cold for my comfort. There were only a handful of people ever in the pool. Small beach area that I didn't swim in. Lots of lounge chairs available. Our room had a small balcony that overlooked the pool and ocean, which was nice. The room was clean, but tired. A couple mornings I couldn't get hot water for a shower, just luke warm. The walls are very thin; I could constantly hear the neighbor's TV and even their conversations. The hallways smelled musty and moldy and only one elevator was working which was a real pain. I took the stairs a couple of times and they were pretty dirty and I ended up outside where there was no re-entry. I am not a Morton's type of person but we ate there once. No one should charge that kind of money for just OK food.; any food for that matter.The Italian restaurant was OK, but pricey as well. My husband said the Tapa's restaurant was pretty bad. Drink prices at the bar were outrageous. The proximity to Old San Juan is walkable, but a long hot walk with nice sidewalks to walk on. I don't mind the walk, but I really like walking. Others may opt to take the bus for 50 cents, which we did; make sure you have exact change. Never took a cab. I was at the hotel on my husband's company's dime so it may not be fair to complain, just trying to be real. I think all the area hotels are pricey, so the Caribe is probably in line, but it seemed way over the top to me. The location is a great asset so if you want an OK place with a nice pool and easy access to Old San Juan, I'd recommend it. But bring a big fat wallet!  
<Date>Mar 11, 2008

<Author>TravelerfromCT
<Content>Great Place to Stay in San Juan This is an excellent resort. Plenty to do for everyone; great drinks in the lobby bar; interesting choice of restaurants (nothing inexpensive, though!), and a well-organized, well-managed property. Towers room we stayed in appeared to have been recently renovated. Comfortable beds, nice bathroom, appealing decor. Too bad that whole stretch of resorts in San Juan isn't on a nice, sandy beach--but lots of options for having fun.

<Author>JandPMaryland
<Content>What has happened? It's amazing that we were at the hotel the same time as a couple other reviewers. We have stayed at this hotel 4 times previously and are Hilton Honors members. Every person we met had the same bad experience we did-- I can't believe the positive reviews for the same period are true.We did get great service from the front desk and from the Hilton Honors Club staff and concierge. The rest of the staff -- and we addressed this personally with the hotel manager -- displayed an almost unbelievable lack of ambition and friendliness.We waited an hour in the bar for a drink. When the waitress came we told her there were others in the bar who also had not been served, including a handicapped patron. She said she was the only server working in the bar.In the main restaurant, we had absolutely the laziest waiter I've ever met. Our meal took two hours and there were guests at only two other tables. Everything about him was slow -- he lumbered by after an hour to take our order and then came back an hour later with the bill. We discussed this with the restaurant manager.We were at the hotel 4 days and went to the pool each day. Not once were we approached by someone asking if we'd like a drink or something to eat. Don't these people exist on tips?We reported everyday, starting the first day, that our ac did not work. The rude manager we met the last day said we shouldn't have waited until the last day to report it. Doesn't he had a record of the work requests? He was absolutely horrid -- rude and lazy.I was shocked. We had never experienced this before. A staff member did tell us management had changed. This hotel has been a favorite of ours in the past and we looked very forward to our time there.But, we stayed one night at the newly re-opened La Concha and have to say that when we return to San Juan, that will be our first choice. It's part of Marriott and we belong to that points program as well. We were so turned off by the Hilton, we will probably start staying at mostly Marriott properties.What has happened in San Juan? Don't the folks there realize US economists are projecting bad times ahead and those tourist dollars will shrink? Locals might be wishing not so long from now that they hadn't been so lazy in the past.

<Author>teachela
<Content>a beautiful location The Hilton Caribe is located along a beautiful Atlantic beach in Puerto Rico. While everything there is very nice...the hotel itself is a little older than we expected. Everyone we encountered there, the waitstaff at the restaurants, the bartenders, the tourist representatives, the desk clerks, and the valet workers, was extremely courteous, friendly and helpful. The food at each restaurant was delicious and fresh...a pleasant experience overall. If we so desired, we could have remained at the hotel the entire trip and had everything we needed or wanted. But, we ventured out to the city and the rainforest...great daytrips for the adventurous.
