<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Could Have Been Better My husband and I just got back from staying at the Caribe Hilton(april 9-14th) we were there celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary. The check in process was horrible when we arrived they upgraded us to a room in the towers and told us it was not ready it would be about 30 minutes so we went to the pool bar and had a delicious pina colda and a light lunch..food was ok. When we checked back about our room they told us it was going to be another 2o minutes..very poor service. The room was ok nothing to brag about but it served it's purpose. Several times on our trip our room key was disactivated very frustating especially after a long day you just want to relax in your room but you can't get in!!! We ate at the restaurants in the hotel our favorites were the Italian(service and food were great) and the Tapas restaurant also very good food. Breakfast was horrible from the food to the service, better off getting room service, you get your food a whole lot faster. We ate lunch a couple times at the Oasis Health Club, very good salads. The service in this hotel was very slow, we waited almost an hour for someone to take our drink order. Not all up to Hilton Hotel service at all. I don't think we would go back too many other great places to visit..not worth the money.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great Getaway! We just got back from a 6 night, 6 day vacation from the Caribe Hilton and we loved it!There were many negative reviews on this website before I left and I was freaking out thinking we were going to hate the hotel. Needless to say, alot of the reviews were true, but you are on vacation and I would not let little things get me down. The hotel entrance is beautiful! Check in was smooth, but the bell boys or whatever you want to call the guys that hang out on in front of the hotel to help, are useless! The room was okay. Does it need a fresh coat of paint, yes, but who cares. Do the hallways have that humidity stench, yes, but why let that get you down! I was never in the hotel room or the hallways all that long during my stay and to pay double the price for a fancy room was not necessary (at least in my case). The pool and the beach were magnificiant. My sister-in-law warned me about the beach before I left, because when she stayed at the El San Juan, she claimed the beach was not that nice there. The beach here was beautiful and clean, but it was only for the Hilton hotel guests, so they cleaned it every night. The pool was a bit gross at the end of the day, but that is to be expected with so many kids in it. The pool was cleaned every night and I saw it with my own eyes and in the morning it was beautiful. They are defintely a bit short hand for help and are a bit slow by my standards, but friendly. So, I did not let it aggrevate me becasue I was on vacation. Other times, the help was very quick. It varied.There is no night life really and you have to venture out to eat unless you want to eat at the Hilton every night. We went into Old San Juan for two nights, Condado one night and Isle Verde another. Basically it was the same everywhere. We ate walked around a bit, nothing was opened and then went back to the hotel. You are not in walking distance of anyhting. We went to restaurants that were recommneded by the cab drivers or Hitlon employees. They were ALWAYS GREAT restaurants and cheap because they knew the area very well. If you are looking for night life, I can't help you because we did not see much or hear about much. The hotel could have done better in regards to the nighly music. It was okay, but if you had some good dancing music, I would have went to the hotel lobby area after dinner and had some drinks.We did two excursions, the rain forest and snorkling. I would skip the rain forest, but the snorkling was a lot of fun!Bottom line I expected the worse, and had a great time. Could I have stayed in a more lavish hotel, of course, but I rather the money be spent on drinks and food. I would defintely stay here again.If you have any questions, do not hesitate to e-mail me: nettya812@aol.com  
<Date>Apr 16, 2006

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Wonderful vacation Our Caribe Hilton Vacation was just wonderful. We just got back from the best vacation ever. We went with our 10 year old son and another family. We stayed in the towers. Our room was pretty and the hallways were decorated beautifully. We loved looking out at the beach and ocean everyday. You could even see Old San Juan in the distance. The lobby was gorgeous and we loved the pools and quiet beach. The staff was the friendliest staff we have ever had anywhere.I felt like I was in heaven the whole trip. I don't have one single complaint. I just hated to leave and I can't wait to visit the Caribe Hilton again. I don't see how anyone could not like this wonderful hotel!R.B. in Doylestown,PA.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>overated and overpriced Because my company assigns the hotel's for it's employees I have no choice but to endure my brief but numerous overnights at the Caribe. My last visit featured a smoking room that I did not request, and the staff refused to change my room. Even after reporting a malfunctioning air conditioner, that did not budge from a 53 degree setting, I was forced to remain in this room. On the same floor one of my co-workers reported roaches in her room, and the staff failed to move her either. The rooms generally are mildewed, damp, and musty. You don't want to drink the water in San Juan, but if you need the bottled water in the room be ready to cough up $7.00. Need to get on the internet? That's going to cost you $14.95, excessive when you consider that many hotels are providing free WIFI/LAN as a service to their guests. For those of you that have a choice, go elsewhere.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Beautiful Caribe Hilton I've always loved the Caribe Hilton; I hadn't been there for a few years. In April I took my daughter and my two grand-daughters. They fell in love with it also. I prefer staying in the rooms in the main building because the rooms are spacious and have great views. The main building is also just steps from the beach area, main pool areas and the restaurants. We arrived late and the only rooms were in the Lagoon Villas section (has its own pool and garden area)but it's a bit of a hike to the beach and main pools so we asked to be changed to the main building. After two different rooms we were settled into the main building and had a great room and great water view. The staff was very accomadating; (I'm very picky about hotel rooms-especially when I am staying there for 6 nights!). The restaurants have wonderful food but very expensive. After the second day I discovered the bodega and deli across the street from the hotel. The $3.00 breakfasts and $4.00 lunches and sandwiches were delicious and very filling. The hotel's buffet breakfasts and dinners are exceptional if you want to pay the price. Meals at the hotel restaurant are free for young children and 50% discounted for older kids which is great. The daily activities are extensive and wonderful fun, both for children and adults. Make sure to take part in the daily free pina colada tastings that are offered at the pool bar. The hotel has become bigger and even more luscious than what it was a few years back and it's still beautifully maintained and so picturesque! My grand-daughters and daughter are already planning our trip to the Caribe for next year; we had to promise my son-in-law that he could come with us next year!  
<Date>Apr 12, 2006

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Wonderful Vacation After reading reviews of the Caribe Hilton we were prepared to have a so-so time on our vacation but were very happily surprised. Check-in was a breeze and we were quickly settled into a more than adequate room in the Towers. The room was large, modern and had a terrace with an exquisite ocean view. The bathroom had 2 sinks and a rain shower which was a wonderful experience. The king size bed was very confortable, which was a concern since my husband has back problems. The room was cleaned every day which included changing the sheets. We were more than comfortable in this room for the 6 nights we were there. We would recommend staying in the Towers rather than the Main, older building.The beach is in a cove which meant there were no waves, but waves could be seen in the distance. Umbrellas and chairs were always available even on the busy weekend. We thoroughly enjoyed the beach. We spent less time at the pool but it was very pretty with a swim-up bar and a jacuzzi, also a kiddy pool. We didn't bring children but there seemed to be lots of fun activities for them. Since we are Hilton Gold Card members we had access to the members lounge that had breakfast available in the morning and cocktails and food in the early evening, at no charge. We would also recommend the salad bar at the outdoor cafe in the lobby. There wasn't much to do outside of the hotel but an easy cab ride (about $10)could bring you into Old San Juan or to other hotels in the Condado area. All of the staff at the hotel were very courteous and polite. We truly had a wonderful time and we hope to go back again.  
<Date>Apr 12, 2006

<Author>chyna610
<Content>See for yourself I recently stayed at the Caribe from April 7th-April 11th. Before the trip we were skeptical from reading reviews on here, however after experiencing it for ourselves we are glad we decided to go. We loved this hotel. One criticism we had was at check-in. We booked a deluxe oceanview room and upon checking in we were almost given a gardenview room. Notice I said almost. When the girl at the desk said garden wing I pointed out her mistake. Next we were told that there weren't any deluxe oceanview rooms available. Lucky for us because we were upgraded to a room on the executive floor room #928. On this floor there is a lounge that serves complimentary continental breakfast in the morning, cocktails and hors d'ouevres in the evening and dessert and cordials at night. It was nice. Our room was great also. Everything was clean and everything worked. My only one complaint with the room was the shower, more specifically the water temperautre. It is either almost scalding hot or lukewarm, nothing in between. The view from our balcony was like something from a postcard. Every night we were brought mints and bottled water. The staff were helpful and attentive from the front desk to housekeeping, waitstaff to bellhops. The location of the hotel is great. From the airport it's a flat rate of $19 plus $1 per suitcase and $.50 per small bag. We paid $10 for a cab to Old San Juan and about $20 to Isla Verde. We rented a car and drove to El Yunque which took a little under an hour and it saved money. The tour is $49 per person. The rental was $57, entrance fee $3 and refilling the car about $7, so added up and divided we saved about $30 each (there were 4 of us). There are many dining choices at the Caribe. We tried the Atlantico pool bar and grill for burgers and light fare which was good. We also tried the Italian place which was good also, especially dessert.There is a Subway right outside the hotel entrance. If you want to venture out the concierge can offer suggestions and show you menus. Everyone should try the Parrot Club. The beach is ok, the sand is a bit rocky, but the pool is wonderful.It's a multi-level with waterfalls and a swim up bar. We did aqua aerobics one morning, one of the many activities offered by the hotel. One thing they don't offer is jetskiing. Overall, the trip was great. We're already plotting a return trip and the Caribe will be our 1st choice.  
<Date>Apr 12, 2006

<Author>waterfall1824
<Content>can't go wrong at this hilton ... My wife and I stayed at the Caribe Hilton from April 6th to 10th ... We booked a room on the Executive Floor of the main tower. Check in was a breeze and although we arrived earlier than check in would allow, with access to the Exec Lounge we enjoyed cool drinks and snacks until our room was ready at about 2:00 P.M.Our room was lovely ... clean, king bed, balcony overlooking the ocean - just perfect.The first night we ate at Escambron, this restuarant is two blocks from the hotel, offered local fare, and the concierge gave us a coupon for a free appetizer. With a view of the Atlantic, the food was good and reasonable.We rented a car from the desk off the lobby, I called the 800 # and got a great rate, we even got an upgrade to a larger car ...We drove all over ... we went to Camuy Caves, Luguillo Beach, and had dinner in Old San Juan two nights ... It's very easy to get around when driving, and if you do have a car and want to park in OSJ there is a parking lot that charges $1.75 for two hours ... you can't miss this parking lot ... I think it's on Tetuan Street, and there are many restaurants right across the street from the parking garage ...The Hilton is wonderful ... the grounds are well kept, the pool was clean, the service and bars are good as well ...As HH Gold members we did receive comp buffet breakfast and a daily drink ... the breakfast is good (omelets, bagels and lox, champagne, etc ... etc ...) they do get $39.00 for two for this buffett, I would'nt pay that much but as HH members and included .. I'll take it!Victor at the bar in the lobby makes a great dirty Martini (according to my wife) and was very helpful in deciding to rent a car and drive ourselves to the places we went to ...The only complaint I have is that I have to go home ...There are negative reviews and the only thing my wife and I can figure out is that there are some people that are just not happy no matter what ...If you are on the fence about this property take the leap, you will not be dissapointed!Have fun! Enjoy your vacation ...  
<Date>Apr 10, 2006

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Loved everything about the Caribe Hilton Just returned from a weeks stay at the Caribe Hilton in San Juan. I must say that I was very concerned after reading some of the reviews prior to us going. Upon check-in our room wasn't ready so we did have to wait a few hours. This was really the only unpleasant experience we had and we just ended up having a drink while we waited. We ended up with a room in the newest part of the hotel the Lagoon. It was very nice and the view was incredible. Everyone we came in contact with was very nice and friendly. The grounds are very nice and clean too. I had read that the hotel was run down and in need of repairs. From what I saw the place was fine. I would recommend this hotel to familes with children and young adults. The grounds are very safe and I never worried about my teenage daughter walking around with her friend by themselves. I look forward to going back sometime in the future.

<Author>dvar
<Content>Many positives, few negatives I stayed with my 3 children and husband in March and overall it was a good trip and the hotel was exactly what we were looking for in nearly all respects. We stayed on the executive level and the room (jr suite) was fine for us. It was definitely not as upscale as I would have wanted if I were not traveling with my children, but with them it was okay that it wasn't fabulous. The executive lounge was a big plus for us traveling as a family. Breakfast was easy and it was a good place to stop in in the afternoon and get a soda or a coffee. I would definitely recommend paying extra for the executive lounge privilege. The cocktails in the evening were also nice and a good place to stop off before dinner. The staff on the executive floor was terrific and in fact the staff everywhere was top notch -- they got busy for a few days when a convention was in town and it was clear they were strained, but other than that they were great - helpful and incredibly friendly. The cleaning staff too was wonderful - friendly to our children and did a great job. The pool and beach were beautiful and nicely situated if you were with kids or without. The proximity of the hotel location to Old San Juan was also good and we could easily take a taxi there for dinner or otherwise - we did not feel trapped at the hotel by any means which was nice. It would have been ideal to have had a few more non-hotel restaurants in walking distance though. While the hotel was great for kids and families and I never felt too restrained in that regard (one reason we chose this hotel over the Ritz which might have been too nice for kids at my kids ages (1, 3 and 5), the kids activities were not anywhere near as good as billed and the kids' club was not open in March. They did have one night of free babysitting that was great but I would have liked to have had the option to drop my kids off a few mornings in a kids' camp - it would have made my vacation! I researched this vacation extensively and the reviews on trip advisor almost convinced me to stay elsewhere - I am glad that I didn't as I think that overall based on location, pools, staff etc, this was the best choice for our family with kids this young in PR and I think we will stay there again if we take childcare with us. BUT, if it had just been me and my husband, I would probably have chosen the Ritz.  
<Date>Apr 4, 2006

<Author>Joopola
<Content>Excellent Hotel and Great Staff ! Myself and a friend are both in the travel industry. We stayed at the Hilton Laguna Villas. The Villas are new and have excellent views of the ocean and Lagoon. The seperate check in and entrance is great and the staff is wonderful. Room service is excellent but can cost $$$. The resort is beautiful offering a nice private beach, a huge main pool, and the villas have their own small pool and spa, which although the villas pool has no bar, you can order whatever you like from room service and they will deliver it. The Hilton is a great resort and we would both return any time !!

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Stay somewhere else! We used the Caribe Hilton as a stop over hotel for our vaction in the Virgin Islands, spending the first Friday and last Saturday nights at the hotel. Our experiences went from bad to worse. Both rooms were in the Executive floors. Not much to brag about since the executive floors are the same rooms on every other floor, dated and in need of an upgrade. The staff seemed uninformed about the hotel constantly asking for someone else to answer a question. Nobody seems to know anything including when hotel services and restaurants open or close. On our second visit to the hotel they made us wait over 2 hours to check into our room. At one point I needed to get the manager to actually send someone to clean the room. By the time I got my key they were still cleaning the room, making the bed and taking things outThis hotel needs an Extreme Makeover.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Ask For A Tower Room My husband and I just returned from a 5 night stay at the Caribe Hilton. We are Hilton Honors members so we were given a tower room. The first room we were given (room 1958) was horrible. It faced the construction site which was adjacent to the hotel. Though we were on the 19th floor we could hear the loud hammering and the room window vibrating due to the pounding below. All this noise started at 4:30am! We complained to the front desk and they did a good job of finding us another room which was much quieter(room 1568). If the tower rooms are suppose to be updated it scares me to think what the regular rooms look like. The pool was also dated and not kept very clean. In fact we preffered swimming with the fish in the pond instead of getting into the dirty pool. The service at the Atlantic Bar in the pool area was very good. The cheeseburgers and Caesar Salad was awesome! Try the lunch buffet at the Palmeras Restaurant. They served a lot of authentic Puerto Rican food. Overall if you are not going to spend much time in your room and you are on a budget this place is okay. If your budget allows you will have a much more enjoyable stay at the Ritz Carlton.  
<Date>Mar 26, 2006

<Author>jturner7
<Content>Condado Villa Review We selected the Condado Villas portion of the hotel even though it was quite spendy ($600 a night for the two bedroom option) because we wanted a place to accomodate two families with toddlers. The villas worked out fine...with some short comings.There is indeed a full kitchen and it is indeed fully equipped with appliances -- and nothing else. Unlike the Marriott condos, there is not a single fork, glass, dishrag, pan, or anything that might be helpful in preparing even a simple snack (a picky thing, but even the trash can was too small for kitchen purposes). This coupled with the lack of food markets within walking distance of the hotel made the kitchen pretty much useless for us. We only used the fridge for food that we we brought with us from home.The rooms are indeed nice and spacious though some things are lacking such as comfortable (and abundant) seating in the common room. Also, we had trouble with all three of the toilets even though this is a very new complex. It is a long-ish walk to the main pools and the beach though there is a small but not so fancy (it looks like a backyard pool) pool adjacent to the villas. A nice touch is the staffed towel stand at the villas pool. If we had it to do again, we would probably do a private rental of a similar unit at the Westin, some of which cost much less for similar or even nicer units. I might also consider using Priceline and getting three connecting rooms for basically the same effect -- two bedrooms and a common room.We were traveling with two two-year olds and had a grand time with the pools and the beach and the birds. The buffet breakfast was loaded with kid-friendly foods though it was a little high for the adults ($20). In Old San Juan, we had great meals at Cafe Puerto Rico and Jibarito. We liked the food at Al Dente but were put off by the fact that they only had one high chair and the somewhat high prices for decent but not spectacular food.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Overall good time Me and my girlfriend stayed at the Caribe Hilton this past weekend. We booked on expedia for $210 a night, which was a great deal given the cost of other Puerto Rican hotels. If you're looking for a weekend getaway this place will do the trick. The rooms in the tower are perfectly fine. We found the room to be completely spacious and clean, and the ocean view fantastic. The open air lobby and bar are pretty as are the hotel grounds. The beach is by far the selling point: the water is beautiful. Not a problem getting a beach chair. Ive stayed at the Water Club, the El San Juan and have been in the Intercontinental. I don't think that either of those hotels are any nicer than the Caribe Hilton although they are atleast $200 more a night. The only thing to complain about here is the service - a couple of times we sat around waiting for a waiter to come by to give us menus, to take our order, or deliver the drinks for more than 15 minutes. Management seems to be part of the problem. We noticed alot of people just standing around chatting with each other while guests clearly waited for service. The workers seemed oblivious. Of course we just (--) to ourselves, and had a laugh. We were really there for the beach and if we were paying more per night we would have been really pissed, but at $210 we overlooked the bad service. Food at the pool bar is fine grill food (burgers, etc). The prices are the same as at any hotel pool bar. I wouldn't eat at the hotel restaurants given that there are many better and cheaper restaurants on the island (in old san juan and condado). And finally, this place was completely gay friendly. My girlfriend and I held hands and kissed and didn't catch any glances or double takes. We also spotted alot of family.  
<Date>Mar 23, 2006

<Author>GatorTraveler
<Content>Not worth the $$$ We had a marvelous 14 days in Puerto Rico! We began our visit with a 3 night stay at the Hilton Ponce. While there we visited a coffee plantation, the Serrales Castle, El Yunque Rainforest, and the town of Ponce. We then rented a house near Cidra which was a beautiful rural setting in the mountains. Our last three nights were spent at the Caribe Hilton.As a Diamond member of Hilton, we have stayed at Hiltons everywhere. At $355 a night I expected a lot more for our money. The room was in the Towers but the quality was dissapointing. The toilet paper holder was broken, there were some scary stains on the walls, and the maid broke the doorhandle to the balcony when she tried to close it. While a maintenence person did come repair it, it was an obtrusion of our time and privacy. The walls in the hallway were also marred with stains. On the plus side, the bed was heavenly. My husband did have to wait ten minutes every morning for hot water in what was otherwise a beautiful shower. The beach is ideal for traveling with a family - protected from the pounding surf of the bay, the lagoon provides a gentle play area for children. The hotel provides sand toys at no cost. The pools are beautiful but there is only one hot tub. It looked like there were two but the second wasn't heated. There are additional activities posted although they don't always offer what they promise. My children were dissapointed when the posted sand castle building activity wasn't held. My biggest complaint with the hotel was the service. It seems the Caribe is catering to convention travelers. The hotel was crammed with two seperate conventions during our stay. When we made any inquiries the staff was generally rushed, haried, and even on ocasion, rude. If I were there on convention paying a reduced rate, or enjoying a stay at the cost of my company, this wouldn't be such an issue. However, as a guest paying premium rates, this level of service wasn't acceptable. Other guests I spoke to voiced the same concerns without any prompting.Don't visit the Caribe expecting to be anything more than a room number. Their size has outgrown their level of service and the maintenence of the rooms.  
<Date>Mar 17, 2006

<Author>Blue7870
<Content>A very pleasant surprise I just returned from a five night stay at the Caribe Hilton, and was dreading it after reading some of the reviews on this site. I have to say that I was very pleasantly surprised, especially since I tend to stay at high end hotels like Ritz Carlton and Four Seasons. I had to go to the Caribe Hilton for a meeting and decided to bring my family; I am very glad I did. We were given a new, immaculate room in the Condado Lagoon Villas with an ocean view and a HUGE bathroom, despite the fact that I was paying the meeting rate. (I did sign up for the free Hilton Honors the day before we checked in; I don't know if that made a difference.) Across the board, the staff was very friendly and the service was timely. (This goes for restaurants, pool, beach, housekeeping.) Even when my 5-year old daughter got sick with bronchitis, they were quick with getting us a doctor and changing the sheets that she threw up upon!! There is a lot for kids to do. The pool is beautiful, though a little chilly from the wind. The beach is small, but the water is calm and you can relax while watching the kids instead of fearing for their lives in the pounding surf elsewhere on the island. The garden area with the koi pond and strolling peacocks was great. We took the 1/2 day trip to the rainforest- well worth it. We ventured to a couple other hotels: the El San Juan in Isla Verde was spectacular (eat at La Piccola Fontana!!); the Condado Plaza across the bridge from the Caribe Hilton was not and seemed better suited for Atlantic City than San Juan. I hadn't been to the Caribe Hilton since I was six years old (I'm 35 now) and was expecting it to be a shabby shell of its former self. It most certainly is not, and though I would be interested in trying the Ritz or the El San Juan next time, I'd gladly go back.  
<Date>Mar 15, 2006

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Not Like it Used to Be We have been to this hotel twice. I can tell you that the first time i went in the 90's, I had no complaints. I just went now in 2005 and it wasnt like i remembered. It was still nice. It had parrots and starbucks and nice things in the lobby. the ocean was also very nice. there were plenty of fish to see and a cool slide in the middle of the ocean (it used to have nice tanning blocks instead of the slide). I had no complaints about the gym or the spa either. The only complaints i had was mainly the room. the room was clean but it wasnt a very welcoming room but it was comfortable and average. the food was good but VERY expensive. We traveled in a group of 8 and spent about $900.00 per dinner and $45.00 per breakfast. Make sure you go to Mortons steakhouse. it is expensive but it has pictures of many celberties who have been there before. its a nice place....the rooms might be your only problem but it was still pretty good.P.S. there were many rain showers while we were there that lasted for about 5 minutes so dont get worried about it.

<Author>LJNaser
<Content>Much nicer than I had expected We just got back on Feb. 27th from a week at the Caribe Hilton. After reading all of the reviews on this site, I was not looking forward to our trip there for a conference. But, I was pleasantly surprised. We had no problems checking in and were given a room in the Tower (Rm. 1762), which had a beautiful view of the beach and old San Juan in the distance. The bathroom was fabulous, with a marble and glass walk-in shower, with two types of showerheads -- a hand-held, and a rain-type one overhead. The room was clean and new and the only thing that had a musty smell were the pillows on one of the beds. But, our other ones were fine. We got turn-down service the first night, with a bottled water and mints left for us.During the week, the beach and pool area were relatively quiet, and we enjoyed the grounds and pool-side bar and grill. While not that big, the beach area was nice and the water was calm (although it can be quite windy by the pool). It was very family-oriented, with activites for the kids, but not overwhelming. The atmosphere did change on he weekend, when they played loud music all day and there were a lot of kids running around, as another reviewer had said. We loved the breakfast buffet. It was a bit pricey at 19.50 a person, but the food was quite good and varied, with some local specialties, too. It was nice to have a Starbucks there, too.All the staff we encountered were friendly and helpful. At night, there was live music in the bar area, and one evening the Puerto Rico Philharmonic Orchestra played there, which we could watch for free. I'm happy to say we had a great time here.  
<Date>Mar 3, 2006

<Author>rpach10115
<Content>Caribe Hilton: What have they done to this beautiful place? We went to the Caribe Hilton january 14, 2006 for 7 days.What have they done to this place?Background: I have been going to the caribe Hilton since i was a child. I loved this place. My father used to take us here every other summer. I was last here as an adult in 1999. We went back again on jan 14, 2006 for 7 days. I hate this place now. This could be any cookie-cutter hotel in south beach. Neon everywhere. What does Bright Neon have to do with a tropical resort anyway. I felt like I was on a Carnival Cruise Ship, instead of a 5 star resort.They removed the most famous lobby bar in puerto rico and replaced it with this bright neon area. Remember, This is where the Pina-Colada was invented by a bartender here in the late 50's. All of the tropical feel has been removed. The terraced tables and the orchastra area have also been removed. There is no more 30 piece orchastra anymore, just a 3 piece trio. There is no puerto rican tropical atmosphere here anymore.Rooms: We booked a 1 bedroom suite in the main bldg. This room, while it had a magnificent view, was old and not very well taken care of. Upon arrival, we had small red ants everywhere in BOTH bathrooms. They sent up a maid with a can of ant killer. This is how thay took care of this. I am paying over $ 800.00 per night for a room that has thousands of ants, and the best they can do is send up smoe poor maid with a can of Raid! I felt soooo bad for this maid having to breath in those fumes. Now the both rooms smell of ant killer spray. There were many cracks in the wood fixtures in the room. The door to the TV cabinet was falling off. The bed had a wood block under on of the legs to keep it up. Another wood block under the night table stand to keep it level. The mini bar had an 2 opened bottles in it. One was water, the other was coca-cola. Both were opened and put back into the minibar. This is a club-level room. I went to the club level receprion and very nicely and calmly complained. I was told that there was nothing they could do. Can you belive this. I have a room in this condition, and there is nothing they could do!Pools/Beach; It seems that they now sell passes to local residents for the pool/beach area. Everytime we went to the pool, we were asked to sign-in this got to be a hassel after the first few times. It is not only when you use the pool/beach, you must give your room number everytime you step out the door to the pool deck area. The pool deck area is VERY loud. There are local kids running everywhere and screaming at the top of their lungs. This is not what I paid for in a vacation. The pool/beach area is beautiful, but the atnosphere is horrible. not relaxing what so ever.Food: The food is good at every place we ate. I really do have high marks for the food/wait staff. I just wish they could be in a better hotel/resort that this newly refurbished hilton.We arrived on saturday. We spent saturday night and sunday night here. I woke up monday morning and realized I had enough of paying so much for this and not getting anywhere close to what was promised. I checked into the availability at the El Conquistodor. I was told that they had plent of rooms available. We checked out of the Hilton with 5 days left in our vacation and checked into the el conquistodor. This was the best decision we made. The el Conquistodor was beautiful. EVERYTHING was as it should have been:Beautiful hotel.beautiful roomGreat foodLots to do Not day passes for locals with screaming children.I know that this sounds snobbish, but when you are paying over $ 6,000 for a 7 day vacation, you just want it to be right, not to be disappointed at everything you thought it was going to be.Believe me, I am a person who over reasearches every place we go. I have never complained about a vacation in my life. My feeling is thatI am on vacation and I'm going to have a goo time no matter what happens. I was compleatly blindsided by the Caribe Hilton. The changes thay made must have been done by some corporate exec because they took the tropical Puerto rican feeling out of this place. It might as well be the Fontainbleu in Miami.A suggestion for anyone who is booked here: DO NOT STAY IN THE MAIN BLDG. ASK FOR A ROOM IN THE TOWER BLDG.I have stayed in the Tower before, it is MUCH better than the Main Bldg.We went to jamaica at the end of january, it was MUCH better than this.  
<Date>Feb 27, 2006

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>great trip We were at the Carribe Hilton from Feb. 18-24th and had a great time. We were on the 10th floor of the main hotel and our room was fine. We were there with our two children (6 and 8years old) and they loved it. They loved the pool, beach, the big chess set, kids activities and much more. We mainly ate away from the hotel but had breakfast at Hiltons Honors lounge which was fine for a light breakfast and saved money. I would not hesitate to go back and am not sure why there were so many bad reviews. Don't worry about it if your planning a trip there soon because I think you'll have a great time.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>What a disappointment! We stayed at this hotel right after our cruise on the Golden Princess...and what a disappointment. We had to wait 2 hrs. to be checked in, due to a holiday they were celebrating that weekend. We'd requested a queen/king bed with an ocean view, and were promised a nice room...well, we were put in the tower, susposedly the new part, which took about 7 minutes to walk to, (not good for hip or back problems due to inclines in their hallways...)and when we walked into our room, fruit flies were there to greet us due to garbage left in the bathroom garbage can, towels missing off the racks, black long hair on the floor and in the tub, kids' handprints all over the balcony windows...and the ocean view we were expecting ended up being a construction site, complete with all the noise.The carpet was dirty with black scuffs all over, and every wall had dirty hand prints and scuff marks all over them too. Are the maids forgetting what the word clean means?? The pictures even hung crooked, and there was no mirror in the room, only the one in the bathroom.When we tried to take a shower, there was NO hot water. Disgusted, after the water being colder than the ocean, we called the front desk with our complaints numerous times, and even tho they assured us someone would come to our service...no one ever showed up until the following afternoon. It was then that we discovered the hot and cold were reversed...and this is supposed to be a $400 room????? In their dreams...NEVER AGAIN!! I've stayed in nicer motel rooms! What a disappointment!ps. The beach is very small with nowhere to walk to. The restaurants are very expensive as well.My advice if you HAVE to stay here, is check the room before you take it! You are definately paying for the Hilton name and the resort grounds...not the rooms!

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Overpriced, moldy, musty hotel We were very excited to be going to Puerto Rico, durring the winter. What a disapointment when we checked into the hotel.The room was small, but had a balcony with a side view of the ocean. The first morning that we were there, we had a flood in our bathroom from the bathroom above. We called and were told that the plumbing above us, had been diverted incorectly. I don't even know what that means! Anyway, 4 hours later, they still hadn't come to fix the problem. We asked for a new room and were told that there were none available. My husband then went down to the front dest to complain. We were finaly given another room. The rest of the time we were there, they never even called to apologize, or ask if they could do anything else. It was as if they really didn't care. The floor we were on, #5 of the main building, had a distinct musty odor when the elevator doors opened. The other couple that got off when we did, noticed it too. There were small chunks of the walls that were gone on the corners in the hallways. The rest of the walls were stained and in bad need of a new paint job.There was only one working elevator for the 5 nights that we stayed there. It took 10-15 minutes to get up to your room or down to the lobby. You were allowed to use the service elevator, which leads off of the main kitchen. After seeing the kitchen, I'm glad we didn't eat at any of the facility restaurants.When we checked out, we were shocked to see the additional charges. There was a $24.00 resort fee, a $4.50 bellman fee, and a .50 maid fee. They also had blocked all of the wi fi services, and we were forced to use their internet service for $14.95/night.We will definetly never go back to that hotel. We paid $285.00/night, and it was not worth the money. Not only was this hotel in need of many repairs, but the employees were rude, and didn't seem to care one way or another about the guests. When we checked out, they didn't even ask if everything was alright. Even the Holiday Inn asks that at checkout! Oh well, live and learn.  
<Date>Feb 24, 2006

<Author>RanAndNess
<Content>Not worth the price, if you're paying full nightly rate. We stayed at the Caribe Hilton in San Juan, Puerto Rico from Feb 14th to the 16th, for our best friends' wedding. At check-in, the process was smooth and fast, but hotel did not honor our confirmed reservation for a King size bed. We stayed on the main building, and on the 4th floor; which had a terrible moldy smell throughout our entire stay. Housekeeping was very inconsistant with clean-up times, and even neglected to clean our room on Valentine's day, when we had been out all day and into late at night due to the wedding. Food choices at the main restaurant, for breakfast and lunch, were very boring and bland. The Islita Grounds is a great location for a sea-side wedding, and the hotel does offer great vendors and wedding planners. Overall, the Caribe Hilton is not worth the $340 per night full rate. Luckily, the hotel is conveniently placed between Condado and Old San Juan, so if you stay here on a cheap rate, go to either area for food. We would not stay here again, but would definitely return to Puerto Rico staying @ The Ritz Carlton or The Conquistador like we have before.  
<Date>Feb 23, 2006

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>I would totally go back I definitely worried about the Hotel after reading all the mixed reviews. I just came back and totally enjoyed my stay and experience. My 2 girlfriends and I planned a long weekend that ended up being longer due to the storm in NYC.We stayed in the newer part of the the Hotel...The Towers. Granted we paid a little extra. The bathroom was great all marble, rain shower and very clean. The staff in the hotel I felt was very nice and accomodating. Our return flight was very late at night and they let us stay until 7pm for a very reasonable fee.We loved the grounds really didn't feel the need to go anywhere else during the day. The beach is man made however very nice with a great view, the pool was fabulous. Just get down a little earlier to put a towel down on a chair in a good sun locationWe ate at the hotel 2 nights..the tapas place was great and Lemongrass was also fabulous. Great atmosphere in the tropical garden. The restaurants are expensive however coming from NYC it did not phase me and I feel well worth it.I would go back again do not listen to all the bad reviews...so overly critical.

<Author>eema22
<Content>Wonderful We just got back from a 4 day get away. What a wonderful experience. The Hilton was relaxing and easy. We found everyone to be very nice, friendly and helpful. Thanks to other reviews we had a lot of hints to help us. Although we booked through priceline I called the hotel directly and gave them our Hilton Honors number. They now have a section of the renovated tower just for Hilton Honors members. Although our room was not large,it was great. I loved the shower and the view of the pool and the fort. At night we shut off the air conditioner and slept with the balcony door wide open. We ate outside the hotel. There was a little , hole-in the wall place just outside the hotel (40 ft). We love to find little local places to eat. One of our favorites was Casita Blanca in Villa Palerma. You need a car to get there but it was very local and very good.It took us less than 10 min. to get there. We could not have found nicer people or better food. We also ate at the Ocean View, an open air local place near the El Conquestidor in Farado right across from we you meet the guides for foing to the bioluminesct bay. We also had homemade desserts after we were done kayaking. The kayaking through the mangroves and in the bay was unbeliveable. But I put on bugspray going out but forgot that it would wash off while swimming. I am still itching!!!!! for the brave - we drove through Pinyones on Sunday Afternoon - what a blast. Very local. Tons of Puerto Ricans, food, music. It is definately the place to be on Sun. Another recommendation - El Morro Fort late in the afternoon. It was so un real. In the large grassy park/knoll ther were lots of families flying kites. it was very slightly misty and we lay on the grass watching the scene as the sun set. People can't believ that I took the pictures - they look like professional pictures.We love puerto Rico and may even take the kids next time.  
<Date>Feb 8, 2006

<Content>mixed opinion this is supposed to be one of the best hotels in San Juan. This grounds are beautiful. The pools  beaches were great. The service on the grounds were great. This never happend because of the punctuality problem they have. I waited 2 days for my phone. It wasn't until I was arguing with the security manager. He said he would put a safe in the room that night. It never happened.Long story short, the service at this place is OK. Some people were extremely helpful, but the handful of people I had to deal with regarding my phone really left a bad impression.If I were to visit Puerto Rico again, I would choose another hotel.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Don't read any of the bad reviews...they are all wrong! I have traveled to many different islands in the Caribbean and stayed with many well known hotel chains! I know what I am talking about and just stayed at the Caribe Hilton for my honeymoon with my husband. All of these people with their stupid little complaints had me so scared that my honeymoon was going to be ruined!!!! Don't listen to them!We booked by an accepted offer on Priceline (paid half of what the hotel was advertising on major websites), got a beautiful room in the tower with a view of the ocean and the fort, with a balacony and chairs to sit on. Our bathroom was beautiful tan marble tile throughout and had dual sinks with a large all glass stand up shower, with two different shower heads (choose your preference) and teak/bamboo accents! Our bedlinens, curtains, and valance were all VERY up-to-date and beautiful!We got a local newspaper every morning at our door and they were even upgrading all the TVs throughout the hotel during our stay at the end of January.The grounds are beautiful. The service at all bars, restaurants, and poolside were teriffic!! If you really read some of these reviews, pay close attention to what people complain about!!! Its trivial and stupid! If they were that upset about those things to write such long and daunting reviews....imagine what they must be like to deal with in person!!!! Of course they will catch some attitude from hotel employees!!! (and in my opinion...rightfully so!!If anyone would be treated badly or have horrible accomadations it would have been me and my husband b/c of the price we paid for it!!!! We kept saying...I feel like we stole this vacation!Oh and by the way.......Apparently of all the hotels in the area, this is the only one that was good enough for JENNIFER LOPEZ and MARC ANTHONY b/c they stayed 9 floors above us the entire week we were there b/c they were shooting a movie in Old San Juan. We personally saw them a couple of times and talked with two of their assistants in casual conversation!

<Content>A little dated but great service My wife and I went to the Caribe for our 20th wedding anniversary. We found the check in efficent (although they would not allow us to check in formally until after 4:00- turned out to be 4:30)and as a HH member they upgraded us immediately to the Tower. <Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Not a good place I was at the Carribe Hilton for a business conference Jan 22-27, 2006, and it was not a good experience. When I arrived at 5:30 on a Sunday, the front desk gave me their standard check in card saying the room would be ready by 4, or perhaps earlier: they then told me it would not be ready for an hour. I finally got a room at 7:30, with no explanation, no upgrade. The room itself was on the 7th floor of the tower. It was large enough, but quite dated. The TV was small and set into a cabinet on a side wall, so you had too look sideways from the bed, and if you sat in the easy chair you were all the way on the other side of the room. There was no light by that chair, so you couldn't sit there and read in the evening. The bathroom fixtures were sort of dirty and not well made; the toilet also tended to flush itself at odd hours, quite loudly. The view was of the lagoon, which was just a small lake with construction going on. The phones in my room were faulty, as often you could not hear anything, and sometimes they would fail in the middle of a call, forcing me, once I realized that the other party hadn't heard me for awhile, to call out again. It took 2 days to get them to replace the phones, and that brought another problem. They charge $1.25 per outgoing call. I went to the front desk to ask them to take off 2 of those charges, as they resulted from the hotel's phone failing in mid-call and my having to recall; if their phones worked correctly, I wouldn't have had to recall and incur the extra expenses. The front desk woman flat refused, arguing that I had made the calls and the charges were the charges. I eventually called (after I got phones which worked) the head of communications, and after several calls and messages she agreed to deduct the unnecessary charges. At my group business meeting the lights didn't work correctly, and after several days of trying to get the hotel people to fix it, our group organizer gave up. Overall, this place may have been nice back when it opened in 1949, but it isn't now, and the front line people are rude and unhelpful.  
<Date>Jan 28, 2006

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>The Caribe Hilton is both a hit and a miss My husband and I just returned from a week long stay at the Caribe Hilton. My husband is a Diamond Member of Hilton Honors and this stay was reward travel with HHonor points. The Caribe Hilton was not our first choice, initially we booked our reservations at the Cancun Hilton Golf  Spa resort. The Cancun Hilton informed us in November that the resort would not be operational by mid-January after Hurricane Wilma had damaged the area and resort. Upon reading many of the mixed reviews here, we weren sure we had made the best decision and our expectations were not too high.We arrived mid-afternoon and were pleased to discover when we checked in that we had been upgraded to the Condado Lagoon Villas. We were told we couldn get into our room until 4:00 pm, so we checked our luggage with the bellhop, walked around the grounds a little bit and finally headed up to the HHonor Executive Floor for a snack. The concierge on the Executive Level was incredibly hospitable. She welcomed us, told us a bit about the hotel, the area, including Old San Juan and Condado and checked with housekeeping a handful of times to check the status of our room and finally advised us that our room was ready. The room itself was acceptable, there was nothing exceptional worth noting, though the king size bed and pillows were very comfortable for a hotel. The air conditioner was incredibly loud, to the point you could barely hear the TV over it and the ceiling fan was rather rickety. Both of these problems could easily be resolved with routine maintenance. The bathroom was very spacious and nicely appointed with both a decent size walk-in shower and a large soaking tub. There were double sinks and the toilet itself ( bidet) was in a separate room, which is always nice. The room featured a small balcony, large enough to stand on, but not large enough for any patio furniture, etc. but did offer a fabulous view of the water, the San Geronimo Fort and Condado. Be advised that the rooms in The Villas do adjoin and you can often hear what is happening in the room next to you, especially if there is a child that raises his or her voice or a parent correcting them.If you are a Gold or Diamond Member of HHonors I would definitely encourage you to take advantage of the Executive Lounge on the 9th Floor of the main hotel building. We aren big breakfast eaters, so we were content with the complimentary continental breakfast that was offered daily. Other offerings throughout the day include soft drinks and cookies / fruit in the afternoon, cocktails and crudits / small appetizers in the early evening and finally cordials and dessert after 8:00 pm. We found service from the staff to be exceptional. The bartenders and servers we encountered at Atlantico, the pool bar  grill where we ate most lunches, were wonderful and we had two fabulous servers when we ordered Room Service. The Housekeeping Staff was also quite accommodating. A handful of times they arrived before we had left for breakfast or the pool or we came back mid-day and they had not yet finished our room, they were always polite and happy to come back 15 or 30 minutes later to give us the time we needed. In addition, the nightly turn down service was very nice. The bellhops were always pleasant and helpful too. Again, the Concierge staff on the Executive Level was very helpful. We also visited Las Olas Spa for massages and had good service there.I wish the same could be said for Management at the Caribe Hilton. As I said, we stayed at the hotel for one week, after our first night there we awoke to find a bill and information about express check-out had been slipped under our door. The front desk staff apologized for the error and confirmed they did, in fact, have us staying for one week. Several morning we did not receive a newspaper after trying to resolve the issue with the front desk, we spoke with the Manager on Duty who was less than helpful and simply stated that he would, ook into it.?The Concierge desk in the main hotel lobby was hit or miss, twice we received excellent suggestions for restaurants off-site, but one staff member in particular was quite rude and flippant. When my husband inquired about taking a small plane or helicopter tour of the island (both of which he said were unavailable, which is odd, considering the HHonor Executive Level Concierge said they would be happy to arrange it for us, seems like the Concierge in the lobby was simply unwilling to go the extra mile) or possibly going skydiving he replied, ou can go sky diving on Fifth Avenue.?Obviously we understood that San Juan is a city and you can go skydiving in the middle of it, but his response was inappropriate rather than asking if we meant somewhere outside the city limits. One day prior to our departure we paid for the bulk of our stay (resort fee, room charges, etc.) with Traveler Check. To date, 3 days after our return home, the accounting department has yet to credit our bank account for the over $600 in erroneous authorization charges despite the fact most our bill was paid in cash. While this is already an inconvenience, it becomes even more annoying since the hotel does not offer a toll-free telephone number and we are forced to call Puerto Rico repeatedly to resolve this matter. The last night of our stay we called to arrange a late check-out for the following day. Check-out is at 12 noon, we were requesting one additional hour, we were told that they could not accommodate us. When pressed they said that our room was booked for the next day; while I understand that housekeeping needs time to clean and turn over a room, I find it hard to believe that allowing us one extra hour would create that much of an inconvenience when they are very strict with not allowing anyone to check-in until 4:00 pm. We dined at both Morton and Lemongrass onsite, neither are owned or operated by the hotel. Both meals were fantastic, but be forewarned you can not charge the meal to your room. Of course this is not a big deal, but good to know in advance. Speaking of not being able to use your room charge, you can not use it in the Sundries shop, Starbucks or the Cigar Shop, which can be a bit inconvenient if you don know ahead of time. The igar Shop?if you can call it that, was basically a hodgepodge of everything with a small humidor / cigar selection. One night my husband wanted a cigar, but discovered the Cigar Shop was closed. The Concierge informed him that Morton sold cigars and he discovered that their cigars were less expensive (by almost half!) and was pleased with their selection. Very convenient should you decide you want a cigar in the evening after dinner. Of course you can use your room charge at the restaurants operated by the Caribe Hilton. As I mentioned, we ate lunch at Atlantico almost daily. Yes, the food is a little overpriced as Ie seen people complain about here; but it goes with the territory, youe at a hotel! If youe ever traveled before and / or lived in or worked in a major metropolitan area, the prices shouldn be a surprise. One rainy afternoon we had lunch at the Oasis Bar, the same holds true. We did not dine at any of the other restaurants on premise, so I can comment on them. Also, please note that the Oasis Bar is currently being remodeled and is only partially open at this time. The grounds of the resort are well maintained and we didn have any difficulty obtaining a chaise by the beach or the pool. The pool can get a little crowded, but it was never so bad that we couldn get a seat. All in all, we would return to San Juan, but not to the Hilton. As we were staying on HHonor points and not paying for our stay it was easy to overlook some of the problems / inconveniences up to this point; however, the accounting errors are inexcusable.  
<Date>Jan 26, 2006

<Author>medley
<Content>Hilton Caribe - really recomend it. Just got back from a week at the Caribe Hilton in San Juan. We got a great deal through Priceline. Normally when we travel with Priceline, we get the worst rooms (fair enough - we're paying much less). Based on reviews I had read on here, I wrote to the hotel before we left and asked for a more modern room in the tower part of the hotel. A bit cheeky and I didn't expect them to give it to us. We arrived at about 15.30 and went to check in. We were told that check in time had been changed to 1600 and that we could either wait for the room that had been assigned to us or take another one that was already ready (but clear indication that the room that was ready was not as good). We chose to wait and had a drink by the beautiful pool. We got into our room shortly after 1600. It was fabulous!! In the tower part of the hotel with a full view of the ocean. Very clean, very modern and in excellent condition. Good balcony with seating area overlooking the beach. The best was the bathroom which was massive and had a great 'rain' shower, two sinks etc. We couldn't have been happier. Room was cleaned thoroughly every day and papers delivered in the morning. The rest of the hotel was also excellent. Pool area was great and the beach, whilst not the best by Caribbean standards, was not bad and not many people there. Gym was also really great - overlooking the sea so you feel like you are running into the ocean. Staff were all helpful thoughout. Hotel is located in an great place - between Condado and Old San Juan - within walking distance of both so you have many options for dinner.All in all, I'd recomend this place without hesitation. Whilst I am glad I didn't pay full price for the room, I suspect I would have been pleased even if I had.  
<Date>Jan 15, 2006

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Would not go back. We stayed at the Caribe Hilton from 12/24/05 through 12/31/05. The rooms were musty and smelled like cat urine (9th Floor Tower). They definitely need to be updated. It was either too hot or too cold in the room. We could NEVER get a chair by the pool no matter how early we tried. We ended up carrying our own chairs, table, etc. into the muddy grass every day. It really didn't feel like a pampered vacation at all. I must say that the staff was very nice. This is not the place for couples. It is definitely more kid and family friendly.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>I love Puerto Rico This past June my husband and sister-in-law had the pleasure of traveling to Puerto Rico. We were booked on a Carnival cruise through the Southern Caribbean and our port was San Juan. We wanted to take advantage of this beautiful port, so we flew down three days before our cruise.I had always dreamed of visiting Puerto Rico and I was not disappointed when I finally got there.I had read several reviews on Trip Advisor about the various hotels in the greater San Juan area. It took me a long time before I finally settled on the Hilton Caribe.After arriving in San Juan we quickly decided after the taxi ride from the airport to rent a van. We were given directions to the hotel and we were able to find it fairly easily.The hotel is situated in a very desirable part of the city close to Old San Juan and other attractions. I loved the open air lobby when we arrived. You had immediate views of the atrium, patios and the ocean beyond.Our check in was very painless since I had called ahead and requested a room in the new tower. We had our bags taken upstairs while we enjoyed a light dinner in the bar area.The hotel was abuzz with activity that particular evening because we kept noticing limos pulling up and the most luminous dresses I have ever seen. After inquiring about what was going on, we learned that a highschool graduation was taking place in one of the ballrooms.Our room was located on the 16th floor. We had partial city and bay views, which were quite nice. The room was spacious and clean, with plenty of closet space and a nice balcony with chairs. The bathroom was the best part I thought because of the beautiful marble in the shower. The shower itself could hold a football team it was so large!I took advantage of many of the ameneties and services on site at the hotel. I enjoyed a great workout in the gym and an emergency manicure at the spa. We ate frequently at Morton's and the lovely patio restaurant for breakfast.Since we were in Puerto Rico to explore we spent a lot of time away from the hotel. I can say however that I had no complaints. The hotel has some great jewelry boutiques where I found and purchased a one of a kind ring. They have a Starbucks on site for coffee fiends and overall we had a very enjoyable experience. I would recommend this hotel.  
<Date>Jan 12, 2006

<Author>MassTraveler
<Content>Nice hotel - Excellent service Stayed at Caribe Hilton during Christmas holiday with my family. Always crowded at resorts during this busy week, and that is exactly what we got. Having said this we were very pleased with the service of staff throughout the property. Check in was without incident. Rooms were ready and in the part of the hotel we expected. We stayed in the main building. Our room was clean and comfortable, although a bit tired. We ate at four of the hotel restaurants during out stay and they were very good. The pool area and beach were comfortable. Travelled to Old San Juan and Candado several times via a quick cab ride. Would recommend this property to others who are looking for an above average experience, close to the excitement of Old San Juan and Candado. Thank you Caribe Hilton

<Author>HH_Trav
<Content>Great Getaway Reading some of these reviews I almost feel as though I stayed at a different hotel than the other people with negative comments. I loved the Caribe Hilton, and thought the staff was extremely accommodating (even though there were huge crowds because of the Christmas holiday they made you feel as though you were the only one). I travel all over the world and this hotel truly is tops. I was upgraded to a room in the executive towers (Hilton HHonors Diamond member) and it was terrific. Great shower, spacious room and very clean. The free breakfast and appetisers were quite a treat. Not many hotels treat their loyal customers so well and I appreciate that. The beach is small but very calm. I especially liked the shady area. Having such a palm tree retreat is a rarity and allowed for my own personal getaway away from the holiday crowds. I would stay here again.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Enjoyed the stay overall We just returned from a pre-holiday visit to Puerto Rico and stayed at the Caribe Hilton and I must say I am surprised by the terrible reviews. We received an upgrade to an ocean view (even despite a 15 minute wait) and thought the room was average, not $400 a night good, but probably in the 2 star category. I suppose the view made it worth it for us. We do not have any children and I was taken aback at how many families with young children (newborn to 5) stayed at the Caribe--lots of yelling and tantrums, but you find that at a mall too. The staff was nice when we interacted with them and the room was cleaned each day--we also left tips for the maid, so maybe our experience was unique. The bar staff at Oasis was nice too. Olas spa is a bit over-priced, but a nice respite from the beach. The location of the hotel to Old San Juan was convenient as well for walking or taking a cab. Caribe Hilton offered the tours we wanted and was close enough to the airport to provide an extra hour in the sun before we departed the island. It was my first visit to Puerto Rico and I was pleased to be in a US territory without the added stress of customs, etc for a change.  
<Date>Dec 27, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Mixed experience at Caribe Hilton A foursome (me and my better half, and another couple) went down for the weekend after Thanksgiving (11/25/05-11/28/05). We'd never been to Puerto Rico or any other tropical island, and were just looking for some quick time in the sun to recover from the drama that was Thanksgiving.We made reservations on-line and paid for our room at the time of booking. Both couples upgraded to the highest room -- king deluxe.We had a really mixed experience overall. Check-in took forever. And I mean 30-45 minutes. We even joined Hilton Honors so that we could get expedited service.When we finally arrived in our room, it was immediately clear that we had not been given a 'king deluxe' room -- the furnishings looked like they were from the 1970's, the view was of the gardens (and not the ocean, as promised), and the bathroom was completely unrenovated (i.e., no rain shower). It was in the tower on the 6th floor. There was also a strong mildew odor. When loud construction started on the floor above, we immediately went back down to check-in, waited another 15-20 minutes in line, and then had to argue with the clerk about the fact that we had not been given the room we paid for. Finally a manager came over, realized the mistake, tried to upgrade us, but found there were no more upgraded rooms with king size beds. By that point we were so annoyed (and kind of hot, considering that we were still wearing our cold weather clothes) that we agreed to take two double beds, as long as the room was upgraded. And then the manager told us that it wouldn't be ready for another 60-90 minutes. So, we checked our bags and met our friends for a drink at the bar near the pool.We finally made it to our room (which was indeed a deluxe, though with two full beds) and it was a huge improvement. It was definitely worth the money to upgrade. (Incidentally, our friends were checked right into a deluxe room. But they had no hot water for the first two days -- a valve had gotten turned off -- so it all evened out in the end.)The outdoor facilities at the Hilton -- pool, pool bar, restaurant -- are top notch. The beach is small, but private, which is a big deal. (Though there are nicer stretches of beach in Condado and Isla Grande they are very, very public.) The beach at the Hilton is basically a lagoon, which makes for very peaceful swimming.The bars (one inside, one outside) were both terrific. Pina Coladas were great. We ate at Morton's and at the restaurant where breakfast/brunch is served. Both were fine, but pricey. (Though coming from NYC the prices were not such a problem.)The pool was the best part of the resort. The hot tubs (basically small pools with very hot water) were open only on and off while we were there due to some maintenance issues. Things got much quieter on Sunday and Monday -- the number of kids plummeted.If we went back to San Juan, we might consider the Caribe, but ONLY in the new villas...  
<Date>Dec 19, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Horrible Room We stayed at the Caribe and would never stay there again. Terrible experience. Room was dirty, locks did not work, tub would flood, cracks in walls, poor customer sevice, etc. The only thing that was great about the Caribe Hilton is that I complanined so much that I got a full REFUND!!! If you have a bad expereince at any hotel in P.R. you must complain and demand a full refund and you should get it.Good hotels in Puerto Rico are VERY few and far between. You must do your research. Just because the hotel in P.R. uses the famous and familiar names of hotel chains in the United States mainland, do NOT think that those same hotel chains in P.R. are the same, THEY ARE NOT!!! What ever you think of a famous hotel chain in the U.S. you must automatically downgrade the quality in P.R. The hotels there are NEVER the same as in the U.S. Quality has a different meaning in P.R. than the U.S. mainland. Thanks.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>The rudest place I have ever stayed I am a Hilton Diamond Member and I have stayed at Hilton Hotels all over the world. I cannot believe how rude the hotel staff was at the Caribe Hilton. It started at check in and continued for my entire stay. The HH check in line was unbelievably long and the other staff who serviced the non-HH patrons simply stood and watched. When it was finally my turn to check in, both of the check in staff members simply walked away and left me standing there for another eleven minutes. I timed it because I was so shocked by their behavior. I did get a room with a view but they put me in the older portion of the hotel and my sliding glass door was so rusted it took great strength for me to open it. The robes were ragged and torn. I asked for another one and it took two phone calls and two days to receive another robe. The next extremely terrible experience was that someone kept calling my room and hanging up. One night a man came and banged on my door and demanded I open it. Of course, I did not open my door. (I am a woman business traveler and I give great care to my personal security). I called security and explained that someone is calling my room and some just banged on my door. They said if they try to come in your room give us a call. I asked if they could have someone come up and check the hallway. The security office told me, point blank, we don do that!Finally after bad service and a stalker of some kind, I called the HH concierge and complained. He decided to give me a free dinner at the buffet restaurant. (Which I didn't want) He made my reservation and when I arrived the hostess looked at me and didn't say a word. So, I said I have a reservation. She then said, Youuuuu have a reservation. I am not kidding. This hotel has terrible service. I could go on and on. I will NEVER stay here again.

<Author>jljlalal
<Content>We loved the Caribe Hilton! My husband and I visited Puerto Rico for the first time this weekend. After reading some of the negative reviews posted, I hesitated to book at the Caribe Hilton. I took the advice of several friends, however, who had stayed over the past few years and loved it. We had such a fabulous four day weekend! Let me start with the few negatives, just to be honest and get them out of the way:1. When we arrived, our room was not ready. We came back 45 minutes later, and our room still was not ready, but we were given a free drink coupon for the bar for both of us. When we arrived for the third time, our promised room was still not ready, but we were offered an upgrade to the executive floor. I balked at first, because I specifically asked for a room in the new tower when I made my reservation (thanks to the advice of many who posted previously), and the upgraded room was in the main building. The woman at the front desk assured me that if we were not satisified with the room that we could come back and we would be placed in the new tower. While we were a little disappointed with this entire experience, the hotel really made every attempt resolve it. To make a long story short, while our room was not as modern as the new tower, we had the best view of the ocean that we have ever had, the room was extremely clean and modern enough, and having use of the executive lounge was so worth any sacrifice of the amenities that we may have had in the tower rooms.2. We were only given an additional hour when we requested a later check out on our last day. We felt that this was a bit unfair considering how we had been so understanding at our arrival. It was also a Monday, and many guests had checked out the day before, so there really was no issue of the hotel being booked.Now that those two small negatives are out of the way, the rest of this review will focus on what a great experience we had:1. Again, as stated previously, the ocean front rooms have some of the best views I have ever seen, and much better in the main building than the tower.2. Very, very clean and excellent maid service.3. The previous reviews about the inside bar versus the pool bar were right on the money! Manuel, who was at the bar for most of the weekend, pours strong, generous drinks and has a great sense of humor. He took excellent care of us all weekend.4. Executive lounge is the way to go! Happy hour every night from 5-8, free drinks that include good wines and top shelf liquor (okay, so maybe we like to drink a bit!)and hours douvers. Breakfast every morning and dessert and cordials every night. Having a private concierge was a plus, too.5. The beach was very clean, but very average. My husband and I are really pool people anyway, and the Caribe has a fabulous pool.6. The location of the hotel was perfect. Far enough from the hub of San Juan so that you felt that you were in the midst of this wonderful tropical island, but close enough to Old San Juan to take a 25 minute walk. The cab ride was $10, and the bus was twenty-five cents and comes every 10 minutes.7. Service was excellent all around. Of course, tipping well is always greatly appreciated, and the people at the Caribe work very hard and appreciate the recognition.Finally, I want to say a few things about Puerto Rico itself. This was one of the best vacations I have taken to the Caribean. The restaurants in Old San Juan were wonderful. We at at Barrachina'a and Aguaviva and both were excellent. Aguaviva's was what I would describe as Latin Fusion, while Barrachina's was more traditional Latin. The shopping was also great- beautiful arts and crafts, a Coach Outlet (where I did some major damage), and a great mix of high end stores with funky, inexpensive places as well. Old San Juan was as beautiful a city as I have been to, and reminded me of some of the places that I visited in Europe. The people of Puerto Rico were friendly, and almost everyone spoke English. There were many New Yorkers, who chose to go back to PR for a more relaxing lifestyle, and we had fun talking to them about New York (since that is where we are from). We felt totally safe at all times and would not hestitate to go back.  I know this was long, but I hope that some of you who are planning to visit will find it as helpful as I found the reviews that I read posted before I took my trip! Have fun!  
<Date>Nov 17, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great resort We had an excellent get away to the Caribe, the Home of the Pina Colada. My husband and I were looking for a quick get away. We chose Puerto Rico because we could use dividend miles for the flight and we chose the Caribe because we could use Hilton Points for the room. Once we arrived on the island we were wisked away in a pre-cost taxi, no surcharge and check right into our room from their open air lobby. We were upgraded to the newly renovated tower and had a great ocean view. This resort is located near Old San Juan which is in walking distance. The cost of the taxi ranged each time from $8-$12. It is best to pick you own price and stick with it. There were fine restaurants to choose from from plus for less then a mile walk you could go to casinos, mainland chain restaurants and local fair. We loved our room because of the plush bed linens, upgraded cooling system and awsome shower. There was no tub, there was a huge walk-in shower that could of held 5 people. There was an over head shower head to fall like rain or you could sit on the bench under a traditional shower. If you are going to the Caribe, ask for the renovated tower to get this luxury. They are still working on the older parts of the hotel. There was a convention, a wedding, and a graduation party all going on at this hotel at the same time but they still looked after all our cares. We highly recommend the off-resort activity of moonlight kayaking and swimming with the bio-luminesent plankton. There are no tropical fish on this side of the island as it the Atlantic ocean, to go snorkeling you have to be on the Caribbean side, keep that in mind!  
<Date>Oct 25, 2005

<Author>Holger
<Content>Well Run Hotel I just returned from a stay at the Caribe Hilton for a Conference. This is the second time I stayed there and I found it even more comfortable. Had a room in the old building on the ninth floor. This is one of the executive floors and the room was very comfortable. Great bed, although the bottom sheet did not quite fit the length of the oversized pillow top mattress. Room was kept very clean and there was turn down service at night. Room was large with two easy chairs. Bathroom and bedroom both well lit so reading or working at night was easy. Small balcony. On the Executive floor there is a lounge for expanded continental breakfast and other small snacks and a separate concierge. This is very convenient when there is a conference as you can eat quickly.Staff is well trained and accommodating.i did not use the pool or beach this trip as I was busy with the conference but they are attractive and well kept.Restaurants in hotel are good although they are expensive but a short taxi ride takes you to Old San Juan or to Condado.Would stay at Hilton again.  
<Date>Oct 18, 2005

<Author>sjmcjm
<Content>Great weekend get-a-way It's not often that we get to take a vacation, so when we decided to leave our 9 month old twins to go away for the long weekend, we wanted somewhere warm and welcoming. We were delighted with the Caribe Hilton! The Caribe had extremely friendly staff who always smiled and said hello. We had a room in the old building on the ninth floor. The bed and temp was very comfortable. The room was very clean and well maintained. The lounge was fully staffed and fully stocked no matter when we indulged. There is no denying that meals are pricey everywhere you go on the island but that should be expected in such a touristy area. We wouldn't hesitate to bring the kids next time. The beach is child friendly because it's more of a lagoon, plus they have a wading pool. A vacation is what you make of it. Don't hesitate to make the Caribe Hilton part of your vacation.
