<Author>TR_2004
<Content>Great time, great location We stayed at the Caribe Hilton in San Juan for a week in October of 2004 and had a wonderful time. I read the many mixed reviews about this hotel and others before making our reservation. There were positive and negative reviews for almost all the hotels we considered. Based on the negative reviews of some of the older rooms at the Hilton, I called the hotel directly and reserved a renovated room in the Tower. We were thrilled with the room....ocean and lagoon view, fabulous walk-in glass enclosed shower, king size bed). Our package included the daily breakfast buffet (fantastic), plus free access to their nice fitness center.We rented a car and thought the location was great (it's the closest resort style hotel to Old San Juan) and also has easy access to Condado. The Hilton has beautiful grounds, a wonderful resort type pool and private beach....but don't go to San Juan expecting fabulous Caribbean beaches...you would need to go to resorts in other parts of Puerto Rico for those beaches. The meals at the hotel were good but pricey. We had dinner twice at Aqua Viva, a seafood restaurant in Old San Juan, and loved it! We also found the hotel staff to be friendly and helpful.The original part of the Caribe Hilton was built around 1950 and has a nice history...one of the first major resorts in the Caribbean....and hosted stars like Frank Sinatra....they also invented the Pina Colada here. Although extensively renovated over the years...from some of the other reviews...it sounds like some of the older physical infrastruture is showing its age. Evidently Hilton originally leased the land under the hotel from Puerto Rico....and finalized an agreement a few years ago to actually purchase the land. They are building new condo's on the hotel grounds which will be part of the Hilton. Next to that....as you look toward downtown...will be an upscale urban mall/shopping area, a casino....and eventually a river walk along the lagoon leading downtown and to the new Convention Center.We loved our stay at the Hilton and would definitely go back. A friend of ours always stays at the Ritz Carlton (near the airport) which seems (by the reveiws) to be the nicest hotel in San Juan. However, we wanted to be closer in town.  
<Date>Oct 3, 2005

<Author>1Kitty
<Content>Enjoyed our trip The joy to see all my parents and players happy and to thank me for this wonderful hotel was remarkable. Our team is from Los Angeles, CA. and we were in a baseball tournament in Puerto Rico. Our stay at the hotel was wonderful having 10 families I needed to have a nice place for them for 10 days. I highly recommend the Caribe. The rooms we had were beautiful we stayed at the Newer tower some people have posted pictures here and that helped me to know before we checked in. In some cases it may be an extra fee but well worth it, I offered the plan to the parents and some took it and others didnt but they were all pleased. The showers are beautiful and roomy. The rooms are clean and well worth it to get the ocean view. If you plan to vacation you should always either work overtime or save those bonuses so you can enjoy your trip we sure did. The pools are big and beautiful they also have a hammock area which I wasn't able to get too but geesh there are plenty of them to enjoy. Peacocks are beautiful and walk up to the pool area not bothering just looking. The secluded beach is great and take those water glasses so you can see and swim with the fish. The food is great in the restaurants and sure its pricey but well worth it. Drinks are also expensive but hey your on vacation what the heck! We rented cars and vans since we were playing baseball but the taxis were expensive so we either took the cars or walked or rode the bus once. It was worth renting the car but not too many parking places. Old San Juan was fun to shop and the prices are great for souvenirs. Across the street from the hotel is a Subway if you like sandwiches all the time which the kids did. Not far is a Sizzler but you would have to drive or take a taxiOur hotel stay at the Caribe was wonderful and I thank the TripAdvisor for letting others post reviews and pictures so we know what to expect. It helped me so much and I was not dissapointed with my stay at all and neither were the other families. The greatest joy was to see my 14 year old so excited about how our room was beautiful and the lobby had parrots and the pool was so much fun for him it was all worth it. My boys all hugged and thanked me for the wonderful time they had at the Caribe.The staff ALL THE STAFF was wonderful and so helpful.If you plan to visit the Caribe remember enjoy and be ready to spend its worth it! Will I visit again? Puerto Rico no because we will not play up there again but if I was to win a free stay at the Caribe I would be there in a instant.Thank you Hilton Caribe and GERARDO

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>No Problem Here Don't quite understand what all the fuss is about? The hotel was great. The staff went out of their way to make sure our stay was perfect. I read reviews before going and must say that I was nervous. The staff upgraded our room to the newely renovated tower with an ocean view since it was our honeymoon. The only down part about the stay was having to take taxi cabs everywhere. There wasn't a whole lot around the hotel but the other hotels and casinos were only a 5-10 minute walk.It gets me that people complain so much about the prices of food. The food is always overpriced at hotels. But not only were the hotel restaurants overpriced, it seemed that all the restaurants in the San Juan were a little pricey. The private beach was nice and the pool area was great. I read a review where the person was displeased about the beach. Not sure what he was expecting but it was to be on a private beach that accomidated the guests. I was told that this was the only private beach of all the hotels in the tourist area. Overall the trip was great and I would defintely stay at the Caribe Hilton again. Highly Recommended!

<Author>dknj30
<Content>Depends what you're looking for! Went to PR for Labor Day weekend. We were celebrating my friend's upcoming nuptuals (aka Bachelorette Party!).ROOMS: They put us on the 8th floor in the Tower building. The room we stayed in wasn't very attractive. The room looked a little run down. The bathroom had a tub in the main area, with a shower stall and a toilet stall. Both stalls were cramped! FACILITIES: The pool  lobby areas were beautiful. The hotel restaurants all range $20+. The poolside grill has munchies for $5+. The beach is NOT a beach. It's a lagoon.CONDADO: There's a casino across a bridge (fairly long walk; $7 by cab) about 10 minutes away. It's not packed - which I prefer!! Definitely eat at ROPA VIEJA! Great PR food!OLD SAN JUAN: Is about 15 minutes away ($12 by cab). It's quaint.SAN JUAN: Is about 10 minutes away ($10 by cab). There's a casino at the El San Juan which gets packed! There's also a club called Babylon/Brava which plays a GREAT mix of music! House, Club, Hip-Hop, Rap, Reggae, Reggaeton - everything!!Condado is a retreat from the busy streets of San Juan. If you're looking for a nice peaceful, relaxing vacation - Condado is great. If you're looking to pick up young people and hang out all night - stay in San Juan!!  
<Date>Sep 6, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Disappointment abounds I stayed at El Caribe Hilton from 8-16-05 to 8-21-05, as a member of a convention. I agree with another post here that said the pool area is very nice. It really is. That is the only outstanding thing about this hotel.This was my first trip ever to Puerto Rico and I was really looking forward to getting out and experiencing the culture of the island. Not possible at this hotel. There is nearly nothing within walking distance except a Subway sandwich shop. The sky-high prices of the food in the hotel ($18.95 for breakfast buffett), made the fact that there was nothing else around even worse. A taxi to Old San Juan runs about $15 from the hotel. You can catch the bus though, for a quarter.The beach was a joke, in my opinion. Any beach in Florida would have been better. It's nothing more than a small lagoon, separated from the sea with a wall of stones. And they rent snorkeling equipment! For what?? The lobby is nice - I loved how it was open, from the main desk all the way through the bar and out to the pool  sea. Speaking of the bar...can you say outrageous? $8 for a drink (every drink) and $6.75 for an imported beer. My room was run down, but clean. The balconies are a weird wedge-shape and since I was on the 4th floor, I had a lovely view of the rooftop of the 2nd floor lobby below me. The drone from the rooftop air conditioners drowned out any hope I'd had of listening to the sea. And air conditioning! My room was like a freezer the entire week. I slept with my head under the covers, shivering, for the first couple of nights. I kept turning the air down, down, down, but the room would not warm up. I finally had to turn the thermostat to off to get comfortable. I had the air set as low as 80 and it still would not stop running. Of course, within an hour of shutting off the AC all together, every mirror and window in the room immediately fogged up. The reservation process was a nightmare. I had to call 4 separate times to get my reservation right, and when I got there, it STILL was wrong. There were four of us in my group who travelled together, and it took the desk clerk an HOUR to get all 4 of us checked in. He assured me that my reservation really was for 5 nights instead of 1 (that was the problem I had called 4 times about to try to fix) but the morning after my first night, I had the express checkout papers slid under my door.There is a mandatory $4 bellman charge added to every reservation, as well as a .50/day maid charge. They tried to tack on an additional dollar a day for an in kind donation to Puerto Rican KIDS (some charitable thing), but we were able to get those charges taken off. Not that I wouldn't have donated a dollar day to a kids' organization, but I really did not like it being added automatically to my bill. I was lying in the bathtub one morning (at about 8:00) and all of the sudden this horrible racket started. I wasn't sure if it was from the room next to me, or the room above me, but they were obviously working on the plumbing somewhere. They were banging and clanging, and then I'd hear plaster falling down the wall. It scared the you-know-what out of me. It sounded as though they were going to come right through my wall. This happened 2-3 more times during the week. They were painting the hallways, and the exterior walls. The hot tub was closed due to renovation. The convention facilities were outstanding. If you're looking for somewhere to hold a convention, this place might work for you.Ok, so this hotel might be good if you're taking your kids. The walled-off beach would be great for little ones, and since there are little to no waves, you could let them play worry-free. And like I said, the pool is really awesome. But for an adult vacation, look elsewhere. I know I will. I would love to go back to Puerto Rico someday, and I most definitely will NOT stay at El Caribe Hilton.  
<Date>Aug 22, 2005

<Author>Lovinbabe
<Content>Great fun. This was a lovely hotel with large swimming pools and a beach area, lots of restaurants and a good view from the rooms. Exotic garden surrounds the hotel and lobby area has a beautiful caribbean feel. Just down the road from bus stops and local shops. Taxis easily available in the hotel. Activities available every day including spanish lessons and salsa lessons. Two places to visit- Plaza las Americas (largest shopping mall in the whole of the caribbean) and Old San Juan (lots of souvenir shops and sites).

<Author>TVI
<Content>Good location close to San Juan The beach and pool are very nice and the room, as long as you get one above the 14th floor, is OK. The rooms do need some remodeling and the folks in the lobby agreed that they were plans in the works to remodel the rooms in the tower where I stayed. I liked that it was really close to San Juan with only an 8 dollar taxi ride each way to anywhere in San Juan or Condado. There is not much going on in the lobby in the evening for entertainment so going elsewhere is usually the plan.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Hope this isn't a typical Hilton This was my first stay at a Hilton and my third trip to San Juan. Lets start with the good. The pool area was very nice. The beach was nice. The whole lobby being very open to the elements vs an enclosed lobby...had a carribean feel to it. My first room was a handicapped accessible room in the garden wing. I knew I was in trouble when they appologized for putting my in the room and said I could switch out the next day. They were booked. Carpet in the room had stains all over it. The garden area was blocked off with tape. They were doing construction.Next day they put me in one of the towers. I did get a balcony...with paint chipping away. The walls were scuffed up. The mini bar kept making noises. I called and asked them to fix it. The next day the problem occurred again. I gave up on them fixing it so I unplugged the mini bar instead. I was ignored at the bar in the lobby. Overall, I was very disappointed. This was my first and last stay at the Hilton Caribe.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Hilton Family should tend to their Hotels!! The place was horrible. The furnishings were worn - the lobby had a horrible odor of a septic tank. The rooms were small and old. The bathrooms were in much need of repair. There was a Q-tip on the floor in our hallway for our entire stay. We tried four rooms one worse than the next - stayed two nights and moved over to a competitor for the rest of our vacation. The beach was not groomed lots of garbage - cigarette butts. The pool had mold on the stairs and floating garbage - cups, etc. The staff, however, were very friendly but seemed oblivious or used to the surroundings.This will definitely affect what hotel I will stay in the next time I travel and Hilton will not be first on my list.

<Author>caribvirg
<Content>Great place for before a cruise My boyfriend and I (both 26) stayed at this hotel for one night on July 31 before a cruise. When we booked the hotel in April we were worried because of reviews we saw here but we opted to stay here anyway and we were very happy we did. We arrived around 5pm and our room was not ready yet but we were able to check our bags and explore the grounds a bit and were given free drink coupons so we were not too bothered by our delay getting into our room. When the room was ready I was pleasently surprised that our particular room looked exactly like the pictures on the website and I honestly could not find one thing to complain about. The room and bathroom were clean, the AC worked great, the bed was very comfy, and we experienced no bad odors at all. We went to Old San Juan for dinner which was great but I cannot really comment on the quality/price of food at the hotel itself (I would highly recommend Buru though for great tapas in old san juan) The grounds were perfect. We quite enjoyed laying on a hammock on the beach late at night listening to the ocean while drinking mojitos! On Saturday we got up early and grabed coffee and a bite to eat at Starbucks which was in the lobby and then spent the morning on the beach which again was clean and perfect for getting some sun and having fun in the ocean. There are a few convienience type stores around the hotel as well as a Subway about a 3 minute walk away (a safe walk as well) Overall we were very impressed with this hotel and would have no problem recommending it to others to stay at before/after a cruise. However, I probably would not recommed it to business travelers who may not be taking in the outdoor ammenites that this hotel has to offer. The hotel did not really seem to have it's act together in terms of check-in but it didn't really bother us too much as we were on vacation and were not about to let a delay in getting to our room get us down. Also, families may want to beware because of the lack of affordable food near by.  
<Date>Aug 9, 2005

<Author>hbsprite
<Content>lovely grounds I booked an executive floor room (the most expensive room type available) and was promised an ocean-front view. I was on the 7th (out of 10) floor and did have an ocean view, but it definitely wasn't ocean front. I was towards the back of the tower (away from the ocean). I expected the best and was slightly disappointed as far as my view was concerned.The room itself was in excellent condition. The furnishings were brand new and the bathroom was done in marble. There were a few minor maintenance issues with some of the wood trim looking like it had water damage. One thing I did not like was that the hotel automatically added on a $1 per day charge to your account for a donation to a children's charity. Not that I mind donating to a good cause, but I don't like the principle of it. I felt like it was forced upon me and in my rush to check out I didn't want to take the time to get the charges removed.Another similar issue occurred when I ordered room service. On the room service menu it stated that there was a $2.75 delivery fee and that the suggested gratuity was 15%. It clearly said suggested and never mentioned that the 15% would be automatically added on. When the food was delivered I signed the receipt and handed the delivery person a $10 cash tip (which was 20%) of the total bill. When I later examined the bill I noticed that they had already added a 15% gratuity to the bill. I was upset. I called room service and told them I felt they needed to convey that a 15% gratuity would be automatically added. I told them that the service was excellent, but not worth 35%. They offered to deliver breakfast to the room the next morning for free, but I declined as I wasn't looking for a freebie.The grounds, restaurants and pools were all top notch. There was an excellent swimming beach right outside the pool with umbrellas and beach chairs, and the grounds were beautiful. Everyone I spoke with was extremely friendly.A quick word of advice for fellow travelers.... Make sure you have a room in the tower (not one of the garden wings) and pay attention to the small print...there is some misinformation about certain charges!  
<Date>Jul 31, 2005

<Author>roadwarrior30
<Content>Nothing here folks, move on ALMOST NOT RECOMMENDED. Stayed July 28th  29th, clearly they have a sewer problem as the trucks (2 huge tanker trucks) came this evening again and the foul smell was evident. I'm on the verge of giving up on Hilton (just reviewed the Prague one 2 weeks ago - obviously I get around). At checkin room not available until 3:15, staff friendly (no big deal). This is a destination hotel and attracts US, South American and European tourists generally with family or friends. Room was adequate size and walls thick to mask sound. Furnishings in good condition but the general state of repair (particularly the bathroom) was fair. Hotels close to the ocean ALL struggle to keep humidity at bay, hence air conditioning runs freezer like to keep wetness in check. I noted the staff always cleaning, but the hotel appear dirty, I attribute this to the heavy guest load this property sees. Several restaurants all fairly pricey (I note that all food in the Island chain is often horribly overpriced). The hotel has a nice walking areas. The beach while not huge, is certainly a plus. Pool area has some features, but it's not a water park or place you'll swim laps. The hotel is situated a fair walk (about 15 minutes to the tourist area), however, the area is generally safe (according to my local associates) and well patroled by police. I stayed in the Tower portion which several have attributed as being the best location. All-in-all, it's simply OK

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>A Big Disappointment Our vacation began on June 28th thru July3, 2005 with my husband and 3 teenage daughters. I would have to say that I am not one to complain and I did however check all the reviews written before we set out on our vacation. I ignored the less favorable reviews knowing that there are some people out there that you will never be able to please. I SHOULD HAVE PAID ATTENTION! The hotel was not at all what you see in the pictures on the internet. This hotel was very run down and neglected. Let me say that there was a foul odor the whole time we were there. It did not take us long to figure out that there was 2 sewer waste disposal trucks outside of our tower that emptied out our waste from the hotel. They were there 24 hrs and the whole time we were there. If you would walk on that side of the hotel (garden tower) there was literaly feces on the ground where it had accidently fallen out of the hoses of the trucks. When it would rain there were buckets cathing the water from the ceilings in the lobbies. The first morning we were there the bellman was running after a mouse that was in the lobby and because he could not catch him with the bucket he was using, the bellmen decided to pound him to death in front of everyone with this bucket. There was a problem with the pool. The hotel was not a place for a family. The resturants were to expensive there and because of the hotel's location there were no places you could walk to and eat. The hallways were never vacummed the whole time we were there. Everytime we would walk out of the elevator on our floor the ashtray that had fallen over with trash remained on the floor for several days before anyone did anything about it. Someone left their food on a tray outside of their hotel room and it stayed there until the next day. We had (2) rooms. They were very neglected. The a/c did not work at all in one and then the other it was too cold and stayed that way. It was soo cold that there was condensation the whole time on the windows. The other room it was clammy and hot. Some of the electrical outlets did not work and the one in the bathroom was very loose. The one time I did try to use the hair dryer it blew a fuse and shut down the air conditioning system, TV. We would lose electricals off/on our floor/room the whole time we were there. The beach was a lot smaller than it appeared in the pictures. What you don't see in the photos is all the construction going on around the streets as well as in the hotel. I could go on, and on however I cannot believe a hotel that has suffered so much neglect could still be in business. The hotel's walls were filthy. To think that this was a Hilton. I wonder when was the last time anyone from the Hilton Corporation has inspected this hotel. I can understand how it would have been a beautiful hotel in it's day but not anymore.  
<Date>Jul 27, 2005

<Author>Baisers
<Content>Loved the Caribe Hilton, will return My husband and 6  10 yr old sons arrived at the Caribe Hilton, had a quick and smooth check-in and went straight to the Atlantico Bar and Grill - very friendly and attentive staff, I left great tips everytime. Pool had a swim up bar w/jacuzzi, and music. Las Palmeras restaurant had great buffet breakfast (free w/my package), lunch and dinner (39.99 for seafood buffet and 50% off kids meals). The beach water was clear and calm, the staff was very accomodating. Nightime we spent walking on the beach, feeding the tropical fish at the dock, laying in the pool or hammock under the moonlight. The location of the hotel was perfect for sightseeing in Old San Juan, only 5 mins away by car. Obtaining directions to different cities was easy, with the Concierge desk's help, we traveled to Ponce (to visit family), Luquillo (El Yunque rainforest) and Fajardo (beach). We will definitely return to El Caribe next year, but this time, with my entire family.  
<Date>Jul 21, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great Location, Fabulous Pool Area Unlike some folks, I found the location to be great. Quite a few good restaurants were only a very short walk away as well conveniences like a drug store. We had an ocean-front room that admittedly was a bit musky, but so are most ocean-front hotels with carpet. Nevermind the room, we stayed at the pool and (small) beach. There were some tucked-away little private areas by the waterfront, and the pool was fabulous. There was even a waterslide that some of us big kids enjoyed, not to mention a swim-up bar. During our stay there was some noisy renovations ongoing which are certainly completed by now.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Loved the Caribe Hilton I am a few months late writing as I stayed at the Caribe Hilton the first week of February 2005. My sister accompanied me on a business trip, I usually stay at the Embassy Suites in Isla Verde when I travel to the island alone but I wanted her to get a feel of the area including the beach. I had not stayed at the Caribe Hilton for 10 years and they have made some nice improvements to the building and grounds. The open air lobby area leading the bar and beach is beautiful. The staff is friendly and will do their best to help you with whatever it is you need. The bar is overpriced but treat yourself to a drink at least once and enjoy the view and music. The hotel restaurants are very expensive. However, you can take public transportation or walk to Old San Juan where there are lots of places to eat at a more reasonable price. If you go into Old San Juan, try La Bombonera Restaurant at 259 San Francisco Street, it's an old luncheonette. Sit at the counter and order fresh squeezed orange juice and expresso. The prices are very reasonable and you can try some local food. The Condado bridge was being worked on when I was there but when it is open, it's a quick walk from the Hilton and is pedestrian friendly. There are many good restaurants on the Condado and on the streets behind it. Explore during the day.Back to the hotel, if you pay an additional small fee to upgrade to the Executive level, you get a continental breakfast until 10:30 am along with snacks and drinks at 5:30 pm and cordials and dessert from 8 to 10pm. It's located on the 9th floor in the old section of the hotel. My room in the old section was comfortable and had been uggraded recently with new good quality mattresses, comforters and curtains. The only complaint was the air vent in the bathroom needed cleaning. The housekeeping staff was good. It helps to tip the maids. When I stay again, I will request a room in the tower as they are a little nicer. The work out area is clean and there is a small cafe next to it with a selection of healthy lunches and juice drinks more reasonably priced than the other places to eat at the hotel. The hotel beach area offers lounge chairs and hammocks and the pool is nice with a great view of the ocean.Hotel parking is $20 per day. If you are staying for a few days,rent a car as it is very easy to drive around and there is so much to see on this beautiful island.  
<Date>Jun 14, 2005

<Author>TravellerChicago
<Content>Good hotel, bad location Just got back from 5 days at the Caribe Hilton. First the good news -- 7 great restaurants, nice lobby and pools, a small beach behind a breakwall, so no waves and little kids can play in the ocean, very comfortable and clean standard rooms. The biggest problem with the Caribe Hilton is location. Getting around in San Juan is a huge headache and costly. The Hilton is neither in Old San Juan nor in Condado. It's in the middle, and there's nothing there but the Hilton and the Normandie hotel. It's a 30 minute walk (hot sun) to Condado and 45 minutes to Old San Juan. Tried to rent a bike ($7 an hour and a hassle). Tried to rent a scooter for all 5 days, but only option was $60 a day for 9 am to 6 pm (yes must be returned every evening!). Renting a Harley was $150 a day (but at least you could keep it for the whole stay)! Taxis won't use meters and gouge tourists $10-$20 no matter how close you go (that's $20-$40 if you return). Buses (fare: 25 cents)? Both times I tried the bus: stood at bus stops minimum of 45 minutes (including in front of Hilton). Forget it. So conceirge desk pushed renting a car ($30 a day -- bring your proof of insurance from home or you'll have to add $10 a day). Hilton adds $15 a night to park your car. But why get a car? There's not really anyplace to park in Condado and Old San Juan anyway, so having a car is a hassle not a help unless you're going outside San Juan entirely. And the traffic jams up incredibly in Old San Juan and Condado. So here's what I did: took a taxi to Walmart ($20), bought a simple, fully assembled bicycle and lock ($60), and used it for 5 days (total cost $16/day including taxi to Walmart). Then I gave it away to a stunned kid on my last day (with a note to his mom assuring her it was not stolen). Biking to Condado took 8 minutes; to Old San Juan 12 minutes. Nothing worse than getting to a place and not being able to get around at a reasonable cost. Next time I'll stay in Condado (though Hilton itself was nice -- just horrible location).  
<Date>Jun 9, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Very nice Hotel - Definitely will return Having read many of the reviews about the Caribe Hilton, I was a bit concerned; I wasn't sure what to expect. What I found when I got there was very refresing and definitely worth the money.First, the pros and cons:Pros:1. Very reasonable rate ($150 per night, business class, June)2. Fantastic beach 3. Wonderfully refresing and relaxing pool4. 4-star quality room (with a couple very minor caveats)5. Very helpful and friendly staff6. Wonderful overall setting and experienceCons:1. Restaurants were quite expensive (figure $50 per meal for a nice dinner)2. Distance from business districts required $20 (each way) cab rides3. Few close restaurants 4. $15 per day charge for internet access (standard Hilton complaint - give me a break; I've spent $350 per night at some Doubletrees, and still had them charge me extra for internet access)The room I had was a standard business-class hotel room: kingsize bed, a balcony with amazing view of the ocean, and a decent sized TV. I stayed in the 'old' tower (i.e. the original building). The room was clean, the bed ws confortable. There was a small standard safe located in the closet. There were a couple very small issues; the bathroom vent screen had quite a it of dust in it; looked like it hadn't been cleaned in a while, and there was a mtal panel in the main room that displayed corrosion from the sea air. Nothing serious or nasty tho (altho I would clean that grille, it was quite noticeable). Also, I had to have security lt me in my room twice; the key had a problem with the electronic lock. Overall, the room is comparable to other 4-star hotel rooms I have stayed in, especially given its age, and the effects of the humidity and sea air.I felt quite safe the entire trip. Security was noticeable, there were cameras that were obvious, and I felt quite secure roaming the grounds day or night. The restaurants are quite expensive. However there is a wonderful local sandwich shop on the avenue leading to the hotel, literally less than a 2 minute walk from the lobby. Great (and quite inexpensive) sandwiches, especially Cubanos...however they close at 3 PM, so it is a better option for breakfast and luch. Also there is a Subway sandwich shop near there as well, which is open for dinner. Adequate, if uninspiring.The beach is spectacular. It is more a 'lagoon' than a front to the actual ocean. There is a breakwate aout 50 meters from the beach, which allows water (and fish) into the area; the water is clean, as is the beach area. very comfortable water. Actually decent for light snorkling, given the fact that it's mostly sandy.The pool was clean, and very refreshing. Multiple levels, large, and with a children's pool. Plenty of play areas for the kids.The staff was helpful and friendly; I didn't feel like they had their hands out all the time (as another reviewer felt). Most spoke reasonable English (much better than my pathetic Spanish), and did what it tok to help me get my needs met. Overall, I will certainly stay there again when I return to San Juan. It was quite the pleasurable experience, andf I had no issues that even approached 'moderate' in severity. I can highly recommend the Caribe Hilton for both business and pleasure.  
<Date>Jun 6, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>I liked it!! My husband and I stayed for 2 nights, I thought the room was very nice clean and a great view of the ocean. The people are very friendly and they all speak english which was great for my husband who doesnt speak spanish. They have the best pina colada and the food was good, just dont eat outside of the restaurant unless you like the birds and lizards eating with you or next to you. They have a nice pool with a bar and their own little private beach. I would stay here again, but I think there a little over priced. If you have a car rental be prepared to pay about $15.00 a day and good luck finding a parking spot. Overall I thought it was nice, just nice!

<Content>Great Stay It wasn't till after I had already booked my stay at the Hilton that I found this web site and read a few reviews on this hotel. I was thinking that my stay there was going to be a nightmare. Well, it was anything but! I had a wonderfull time at the Hilton. The cushened lounge chairs  umbrellas on the private beach were also available at no extra charge. The use of the executive lounge was a highlite of our stay. At 5:30 to 8:00pm in the lounge, cocktails, wine, beer and finger food was served and 8:30 to 10:00pm they served cordials. The executive lounge crew were nothing but professional. All in all, it was the best 5 days I spent in a hotel in a long time. Dates stayed were 5/16 to 5/21/05

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Relaxing Stay at the Caribe Hilton My daughter and I just returned from a three day stay at the Caribe. The hotel and grounds are beautiful. The grounds are very well maintained. There is a lot of tropical foliage and great scenery. There is an outdoor bar/grill called the Atlantico, that overlooks the ocean, and serves light food such as hamburgers, hot dogs, sandwiches, drinks,etc. There is continuous recorded salsa music playing, adding to the atmosphere..We were entertained by a beautiful, wild, rather tame blue peacock during lunch. He strutted around hoping to find food from the guests. This was quite a novelty.Included in our package was a free breakfast buffet in the Palmeras restaurant. The food and variety were excellent.Our ocean-front room was neat and clean. However, I would consider that the room was somewhat average.We had a magnificent dinner at Morton's Steakhouse, which is part of the Caribe Hilton. The dinner was very pricey but excellent.Directly off the hotel grounds, there is a great deal of construction going on in the area. We took taxis to Old San Juan and Plaza de Americas (the biggest mall in the caribbean). It is well worth a visit. There is also a casino not too far way.We found it all very relaxing. We had just missed several days of constant rain. So we were very fortunate.There is a concierge that answers all your questions regarding food, shopping, tours, etc. They were very friendly and helpful.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Caribe is great for relaxation A friend and I just returned from a 7 day stay at the Hilton Caribe. We are two single girls who just completed our master's degrees and wanted a week of complete relaxation. We were very impressed with the hotel. Our room (in the new tower) overlooked the harbor and was clean and comfortable. We had great service and enjoyed all aspects of the hotel.Compared to other hotels in San Juan, this is a great option. It is afordable, conveniently located to many great areas, and beautiful. There are several restaurants in the hotel--we enjoyed the swim-up pool bar, the Italian restaurant, and Palmerra's for brunch and breakfast. Room service was also great. They delivered each order with complimentary warm cookies. Skip Morton's. We've been to other Morton's and this was awful. Way overpriced and children everywhere. It was comparable to Chucky Cheese. Terrible.The beach was great. Small, but fine. The water is so warm and clear--fish everywhere. There were definitely enough chairs and the chairs all included padding. Be careful with rafts--you can rent them by the day, but they are about $15 each! It rained for four of the seven days we visited San Juan. There is a great tanning salon around the corner, as well as a liquor store and 7-11 type place which are very convenient and more afordable than the hotel facilities. In case of rain, bring an umbrella and tour Old San Juan and the rain forest. Also, while you are there, visit other hotel properties. We went to the Wyndam and the Marriot and were amazed by how much more we enjoyed the Hilton Caribe. If you do anything in San Juan, definitely have dinner at Tangerine at the Water Club. It is AMAZING!!! So cute and so delicious. Isla Verde is a cute area as well.Old San Juan is cute, but very kitschy. Also, we were amazed by how many homeless people were there. We did not feel very safe, especially after dark. Much better to tour during the day and then stay in the resort for the evening.It was fun to visit the cruise ship docks. Bring cards, games, and books to entertain yourselves in case it rains. Puerto Rico is very commercial and San Juan is expensive and Americanized. If you are looking for a pure beach vacation, look elsewhere. If you are searching for a fun vacation with 'American' food and lots of activities, where you can use American dollars and speak English, as long as you don't care about rain, San Juan is great. We spent lots of time at the beach, read lots of books, and watched lots of pay-per-view movies. We loved the pina coladas and the swim-up bar. I returned with a great tan and am very relaxed. Just wish the weather would have been better.  
<Date>May 24, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Satisfied I went with a couple of family members May 12th through May 16th. The hotel is beautiful. The room was average: small imperfections that could be looked over. We were surprised to find that housekeeping does not come to clean your room until well in the afternoon. We finally figured out that it is probably due to hotel guests desire to sleep in and enjoy their holiday without interruptions. The day we were to check out, housekeeping was knocking on the door around 830am. In addition, this may be the reason why guests have to wait on their rooms to be ready when you check in. I didn't mind, it gives you the opportunity to explore the hotel. Make sure that you request face towels, because they were rarely provided without requesting them. They provided hand towels and bath towels though. Make sure you place all of your towels on the floor each morning, otherwise they may not provide new ones. Recommend you go to a local grocer or store in San Juan, because (of course) the hotel charges outrageous prices for water and soda. My cousin bought a 6 pack of soda (which werent full 12 ounce cans) for $6!!!!! I bought a large bottle of water for $3!!! Food is also on the high side, so dont be afraid to ask the concierge for a local eatery. They suggested La Bombonera in Old San Juan for breakfast. My breakfast was less than $6. A Subway and Sizzler is within walking distance to hotel. Pools are okay for just wading considering the fact that not one of them is over 4 ft deep. However, the swim up pool bar was my favorite spot and we stayed there until they shut down everyday of our vacation. By the way, the pool bar closes WAY too early (6pm). There is also the private beach which I loved and an area with about 4 or 5 hammocks. GREAT place to relax and enjoy the wonderful ocean breeze. Anywhere you order a drink expect it to be a REAL drink. They dont believe in watering your drinks down nor are they cheap. Expect to pay about no less than $7 for a drink. The taxi drivers were all very helpful, however, they drive like madmen. Taxi prices vary: Old San Juan was $8-$10, Plaza las Americas was $12-$16, Wyndham El San Juan (Babylon-club) was $16-$18. Overall, it was a good hotel stay.  
<Date>May 19, 2005

<Author>blucy22
<Content>Relaxing stay at the Caribe Hilton The Caribe Hilton has a wonderful private beach that is very relaxing and beautiful. The public beaches in San Juan are very crowded so this was a nice option to have. The pools and grounds are very well kept. The room is just average. We had the buffet breakfast every morning which was excellent! The only con was that the spa/jacuzzi was not part of your fee at the hotel and you have to pay extra for it. All in All, it is a nice place to relax, enjoy privacy, and it is family friendly.  
<Date>May 19, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Never Again This hotel is beautiful on the outside but terrible in the inside as far as my room is concern. First, I couldn't find my room, I had a garden view you would think wow, it was a garden view under construction, the bathroom had a shower with a drain that I was afraid to use in case of a flooding in the entire room, carpet was stained, the room service food was cold and they automatic charge (not a option) you money for the children services plus room service fee. I had problems with the phone not working, all three phones, i had to yell so the person could hear me, I let the hotel know they still charged me - I requested an upgrade and they said they had no vacancies and i said i saw a several people checking out , no no vacancies. This hotel is more for business meetings and conference there was nothing there to do when the weather was not good. The only time i enjoyed there was a woman who worked in a clothing store, she was wonderful and friendly and kind to me, other than that it was the worst time i ever had and i suggest to pick another place to stay. Never Again. Lucy in Manhattan, New York City

<Author>tani
<Content>Expected More Being a Hilton Hotel, I expected much more for the cost of the room. But it was close to the bus lines, although you had to dodge traffic to get there. The first couple nights the room was fairly nice, then I checked out to go to Vieques and when I came back they must have put me in the old part of the hotel because the quality of the rooms were remarkably different for the same cost.

<Author>ispin
<Content>Very nice w/a few exceptions Recently returned from a vacation in Puerto Rico and it was lovely. We split our time between the Caribe Hilton and Rincon Beach Resort on the West Coast. My wife and I went with a single mom and her three children, 14, 10, and 8 (they never complained about being bored). I had read many of the reviews of the Caribe and like others, I was somewhat nervous. In the end I relied on a friend's review of her 2004 stay.Upon arriving, I was awed by the view from the open air lobby, whereas you could see the pools, and ocean. Like many others who commented, our rooms would not be ready until after 3:00 P.M. It wasn't that big of a problem because we were able to change and head to the pool/beach area. This area was very beautiful and busy (we were there over Easter weekend). Even though it was packed, we were able to find some free chairs and enjoy the pool and the surroundings. Staff was able to accomdate our request of having rooms close to each other. We were actually next door, rooms 752  753. The view was excellent. We could see the garden and the ocean. Even though we were on the 7th floor, you could hear the ocean water, always very relaxing. Rooms themselves were very nice and large. There were some signgs of wear but overall I was impressed. Water pressure was good, the only problem was the cold water never got cold, so we couldn't get any cold water for drinking.Hotel and area seemed very safe. If you are looking for the safety of an all-inclusive that caters to only Americans and European's this may not be for you. There were a lot of locals at the hotel and in the surrounding area, which my wife and I loved. I personally don't like the captive feel of an all-inclusive hotel. We went running several days into the Old San Juan area. It is very beautiful and old world. Regardless if you stay at the Caribe, if you are in the area you must go to Old San Juan and visit one of the forts and go to some of shops. Regarding food, we didn't eat at the restraunts at the hotel because there were so many others around the area. The family that we were with ate there a couple of times and said the food they had was pretty good. The three that stand out are the La Dorado and Ikako(?), and El Hamburger for the best burger in Puerto Rico. Get there early because they get packed minutes after they open the door.Downsides:Except the concierges, the staff was somewhat nonchalont about answering questions and tending to issues. The family we went with had a leak that was not really taken care of in a timely manner. I do agree with others who have said that they could use some work in this area, especially for the price of the rooms. There were a couple of times when there was a sewer type smell in the lobby. Not sure what that was about but we didn't spend much time there so it didn't really bother us. Location could be a bother for some people. Cab rides are $10 for either Old San Juan or Conado, where all the action is. My wife and I walked several times and you're looking at about 35 minutes to either which wasn't a problem for us. It is dark in both directions at night but it seemed pretty safe and I didn't hear about any issues while we were there.Overall a great experience and would defintely return to Puerto Rico and stay at the Caribe again.  
<Date>Apr 4, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Room Broken Into I stayed at the Hilton Caribe in Puerto Rico from March 25 - March 27, 2005. I had a very disturbing experience, and I question the safety of the guests at this hotel, and thought you should know.On Saturday, March 26 at 6:45pm, someone walked into my room, having used a key. I was changing, and I was faced away from the door. As soon as I said Hello - who's there (I did not turn around immediately as I was finishing getting dressed), the person walked out of the room. I then walked into the hallway, no one was there. When I turned the corner, a bellman was there. I asked him if he had walked into my room mistakenly, he said no.I immediately went to the front desk, and alerted them of the situation. Ricardo, the desk manager on duty did not believe me. I requested the general manager, who then came over. Genero (the general manager), assured me that he would have security at my door immediately, to download the information from the lock as to what keys had been used in my lock. I then went to dinner. When I went back to my room, an hour and a half later, no one had been there. Security finally came at 10pm - 3 hours after I had talked to the manager. The manager left a voice mail at 10:30 saying the only other keys used in the lock besides keys issued to the room were housekeeping, and that I should be safe. Housekeeping was not on my floor when the break in occurred, there was no knock prior to the person entering my room, thus I do not believe it was housekeeping. I truly believe someone - not housekeeping - got a hold of a key to my room, and used it, and only turned away when they found someone in the room. Thus, I question the safety of the guests in the hotel.I also think the manner in which management responded to my complaint was extremely poor. To wait 3 hours to get security to my room is abominable. To assume that it must have been housekeeping and consider the case closed is extremely lax security. I stay at hotels approximately 200 nights a year, and have done so for many years. I have only recently started staying at Hilton brand hotels, and if this is the kind of security that Hilton offers, I do not think I - or anyone - should go back.  
<Date>Mar 31, 2005

<Author>CamiOhio
<Content>Not up to Hilton Strandards! My Husband and I stayed at the Caribe Hilton (March 5) one night before departing for a cruise. The Hotel lobby and pool are very nice and have recently been remodeled. The lagoon and beach are also beautiful. The fitness center was okay. The equipment was in need of replacement, although the view of the ocean made it pleasant to exercise. I would not stay here again. The rooms are very old, with the exception of the rooms in the tower. The service at the desk was not what we expected. Our flight got in late and we were very tired, needless to say at 6pm our room was still not available. They said that there was nothing that could be done b/c the previous guests had checked out late. They would not let us have another room. I felt that $400 a night was too expensive for this hotel. Anybody wishing to stay here should request a room in the tower, otherwise you may be disappointed.

<Author>HAFSTBS
<Content>March 05 at the Caribe Hilton The grounds of this hotel are amazing. The pool is beautiful and very clean ( a little cold but refreshing!). There seemed to be ample chair space by the pool and beach (which is like a lagoon/lake but with ocean water... great for kids). Our room was amazing on the 19th floor of the New Tower We had a great view of the lagoon and the fort in Old San Juan in the distance. We faced west and had great sunset views. Our room had a big bed, was clean and the bathroom was amazing. A big shower for two! I think from reviews I have read and from trip advisor reviews posted, if you stay here, ask for a room in the new tower, its worth it!My only complaint about this place was the service. The service from the hotel staff was pretty slow. We ate at Palmeras for breakfast and lunch once each and the service was very slow. BUT at lunch the waiter realized our frustration and comped us dessert from the buffet, which was much appreciated. But for $11 you can get an omlet and toast and for $3 more a cup of coffee you would expect better service! At the pool I saw the slowest moving drink server I have ever encountered! But the $5.50 Medilla Light (local Beers) were reasonably priced for a resort like this. I dont think they actually put alcohol in the daquiris and pina coladas, so stick to beer!Overall, the grounds and nice room was worth it! Yes, we did spend money in cabs to go to Isla Verde to the beach and to go to dinner each night in Old San Juan or Condado, (walk to subway for lunch... its cheaper and the service is better) but thats the price you pay for a resort in a city. The restaurants we went to were Parrot Club (Old San Juan), Aliji Mojili and Zabo (Both in Condado) and I highly recommend each of them!  
<Date>Mar 28, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>A little shabby and no casino Hi, we stayed for 4 nights at the Caribe Hilton in San Juan. We paid 350 a night and found out on our way out about the 28 dollar resort fee and of course the 17 percent tax rate. What is the room rate for we wondered. We found out after we got there that there was no longer a Casino... someone said something abour irregularities and they lost license. Maybe will add one in 2007. The hotel beaches and pools look nice and they have plenty of chairs etc. The restaurants are uninspiring but the breakfast buffet was very good buy at 18 dollars incl champagne. The room had an ocean view but the room itself was sort of worn looking. We got the triple A rate after we arrived because it was 3:30 and I mentioned we could still cancel by 4. The hotel clerk where I made the reservation had insisted that the orig rate was the lowest and did not suggest AAA. It was a holiday weekend and we had to take something, we were in PR for a funeral. Without a Casion in PR I am not sure what the resort fee is for over and above the room fee. I am guessing they do not make as much money without the Casino and so added on this fee for more income. Don't have the bottle of water they leave out in the room or it will cost you 7 dollars.  
<Date>Mar 28, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Not to Hilton standards I now understand the mixed reviews for at the Caribe Hilton. We stayed there pre-cruise and post-cruise recently - and what a difference 7 days made! The first night was fair - room was not ready well after check-in time but we were compensated with a drink on the house for our inconvenience. The bar service was very slow and what surprised me the most was that the servers at the bar were not allowed to handle cash and make change -- they had to take money to a cashier station to log their transaction before providing change - this made the process very tedious and slow -- this also designates that they have a trust issue with the bar staff - not good. The room was adequate - in the renovated tower, with sliding glass door and balcony with ocean view. Bed was very comfortable but leaking toilet kept us awake much of the night. Noticed peeling paint that was in need of repair. The service in the Palmeras restaurant that night was very good. Had an excellent cruise on Celebrity Constellation - topnotch service, all the way! What a downer to return to the Caribe Hilton post-cruise and experience an entirely different experience. The room was not ready (again) and this time no drink coupons (consistency?). We were in the old tower this time. The view was spectacular once again, however, what's with the old wooden rotted door from the 1950's leading our to the balcony? - and the rust stains on the carpet? - and more peeling paint? - (at least the toilet didn't leak this time) - but the bath was missing soap dish and more peeling paint in the bath area. In the hallway, there are housekeepers sitting on the floor. Dinner again at the Palmeras, but this time the service was awful. Server was rude and unattentive, but manager ended up comping our meal when we brought it to her attention. But the worst was yet to come: Upon returning to the room after an evening out in Old San Juan, went out on the balcony for a nightcap and a last look at the beautiful view. The old rotted wooden door closes behind us and LOCKS! - We are locked out on the 8th floor balcony at 4:00 am! - very scary, no one around, no security down below. We end up having to remove the old rotted panel at the bottom of the door to let ourselves back in. We call resident manager and ask to be moved to another room. They said they would patch up the door for the night instead. But after we explained all the other issues with our stay, we were moved to another room (in the new tower). I'll never forget the stay at Caribe Hilton and would never stay there again. (We paid $280/night for this) -- True, the view is beautiful and the landscaping was impressive - but isn't it what's inside that counts sometimes? and the staff? and the management? - that's what's lacking at Caribe Hilton.  
<Date>Mar 27, 2005

<Author>cw0904
<Content>Great experience at the Hilton We stayed at the Caribe Hilton from March 18-22, 2005. After reading reviews on the Hilton I was a bit skeptical but we got a good deal for a last minute trip to Puerto Rico. We stayed in the Main building on the fourth floor. We had a view of the lobby ceiling below us but straight ahead we had a view of the Normandie and the beach. I think for the price (probably the resource we used) and the last minute booking, for the exception of the ceiling below us we had a wonderful view. Being able to wake up hearing the ocean and seeing the waves every morning was perfect. Our shower was not draining properly and it was fixed right away. The services was great. We have no complaints. It is in a perfect location between OSJ and the Condado, Isla Verde area. If we are to go back to Puerto Rico we will return to Caribe Hilton.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Beautiful Grounds! I read many reviews about hotels in San Juan before choosing one. After reading all the reviews, I still had a hard time choosing one. Even the ones that got good reviews still got many really bad reviews and they were quite pricey as well. I ended up going with the pricey one, because I thought perhaps I would at least not end up in a Cockroach palace or something. Well, I was quite pleased with the Caribe Hilton. I stayed there 3 days in February 2005 pre-cruise. I paid $1,120 for the 3 nights which included the breakfast buffet. The room was very nice and very clean. There was no mold anywhere in the room (as other reviews I read said they had terrible mold in the room). I thought the hotel was pretty...lobby and all. The grounds were just wonderful - just like a mini paradise. The only thing I was bummed about is that there was no heated Jacuzzi which I think should have been there considering the prices! We had a 4th floor room in the tower. Like a dummy, I left the sliding glass door open all night thinking that mosquitoes don't fly up that high...wrong! I was eaten alive. I had the biggest bites I have ever got in my life! Funny, I never saw one mosquito or bug! They do automatically add a $1 donation per person and per night to some charity, but I just had them take it off my bill when checking out (when I checked in, they did tell me I could have it taken off). As far as the food goes, I thought it was very good and prices were average for the beautiful and yummy breakfast buffet and for the lovely dinners. Room service was very reasonably priced and served quickly and set up very elegantly! All in all, I definitely recommend the Caribe Hilton if you don't mind paying top dollar. Just one more thing I should mention, I have stayed at just as nice (if not a little nicer) hotels in Orlando and Tampa, FL for less than $100/night. I guess San Juan is just pricey for hotels! If you have any questions, please feel free to e-mail me.  
<Date>Mar 16, 2005

<Author>stockarb
<Content>Viva the Caribe Hilton We had a great time at the Caribe Hilton. THere is no casino but with two kids (6 and 11 mo.) we didn't go away to gamble. The beach and pool are great for families. The staff was wonderful..the key to this hotel is the location between Old San Juan and the Condado. We did Old San Juan in the morning before the heat and the Condando at night.The hotel is a secluded hideaway next to the Condada and Old S.J. Perfect for families and those looking for a low key spot with activities moments away.For those reviewers who bemoan taking a $8-10 taxi ride ..this hotel isn't for them. If you want action all the time go to the Condado or Isla Verde. Peace and relaxation at the El Caribe..a trademark of this hotel since 1945.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Beware--Security is an issue! Stayed there from 2/19-2/25.....nice room in the tower building but had quite a few incidents where i did not feel safe. First off, the tower building is very far away from the lobby and there is NO security there, anyone can walk in off the street and have access to the floors above. There is an eye in the sky type device in the lobby. Opened my door one evening to find a couple milling about, they saw me and hurried away towards the stairs , not the elevators. The beach is nice, as well as the pool, until you realize that a fairly large amount of the people there are locals who have no business being there. An older boy approached my 7 year old son ( he was 14-15) and said he was there with his mother and was staying at the hotel next door. He asked him if he wanted to leave the property if he wanted to go see the pool over there When my son asked permission, I approached the mother and they hurriedly took off. I had read in the paper where there is an epidemic of kidnappings in Latin American countries, with children being sold into slavery, and heres my kid about to leave the property (lured?) When I complained to the manager, they ignored me and said that there is a private club that the local people can belong to and that there are members there who are locals. When I persisted and told him that i would notify the police, he dared me to go ahead, this is a private matter the police wont get involved in Other incidents occurred and they are too numerous to mention. And this is only in one week! The bottom line is that for this amount of money ( 385 night, plus 20 percent taxes) they should take security a lot more seriously. Someone is going to get raped or kidnapped one of these days! THIS is not a place I would take children to nor would I feel comfortable as a single women being here alone. If you are a married couple and you stay together the whole time, than I guess its ok. But ,There are too many other nice places that take security seriously and do not treat you with an attitude that they do here!  
<Date>Feb 26, 2005

<Author>jhone
<Content>Wonderful vacation spot! We returned from a week's stay at the Caribe Hilton. We also stayed the first week in February last year . We were on the 4th floor in the main building with a wonderful view of the ocean. Last year we were in the same building on 6th floor. Room was large, very clean and comfortable. Maid service replaced used towels twice a day and did a superb job. Room service was always on time and meals were as ordered.   We ate at all 4 of the hotel's restaurants and enjoyed them. Morton's was our favorite but the Spanish one and Italian one were very good. The Palmeras was our least favorite for dinner but the buffet breakfast was a great treat with wonderful fruit and great cooked to order items. Thought the $18.50 price to be reasonable for the value received.  The grounds are especially beautiful with a great pool with swim-up bar and loads of grounds to stretch out for a wonderful tan. The Hilton has the only private beach in Puerto Rico and it is well protected from large waves by a man made barrier that is a about 200 feet out from the beach area. It is safe and clean; I noticed hotel employees making rounds daily and gathering up clumps of seaweed and other items to assure a clean and safe area. Anyone with little children would appreciate the beach area.  The common areas are well kept and attractive. While the first floor lobby area is open, I never saw a bug (flying or ground type) in there the entire week. In February, the hotel is not exactly inexpensive but for a winter retreat from the snow-belt, it was a bargain to us.   The location is good. It is between the congested Condado beach area and Old San Juan. Both are a $8 cab ride or, probably, a 30 minute walk. For access to some of the wonderful Old San Juan restaurants, I found the location very convenient, safe and desireable. We'll probably return next February.   
<Date>Feb 12, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>So So My Husband and I just returned from spending 5 nights at the Caribe Hilton. Our trip was part business, a trade show and part vacation. The location of the hotel is good, not far from Old San Juan and not far from Condado. However, the rooms exhibited wear and tear. It's time for a major renovation to the sleeping rooms. The public areas , the pool, lobby and the health club were very nice. The pool is beautiful and the restaurants are very nice. I would consider staying there again if they renovate, otherwise, next year I will look for a new hotel.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>It was better than I had expected...but still not the greatest Okay, I visited the Caribe Hotel and after reading the reviews I was a bit terrified at what to expect. I actually took some of the reviews with me to show the front desk if they tried to pull some of the stuff some of the other reviewers said. Sure enough, right when we got there the man at the front desk said that our room wasn't ready and if we would stay in a side room and sleep on a sofa bed for that night then the next night our deluxe room with a queen size bed would be ready. Needless to say I waived the reviews in his face and told him that I had read that the Caribe did this (not having people's rooms ready) He promised the room would be ready and that they would even move our stuff. The next morning we went down and the room wasn't ready...one more night he said. The next day we got our room. Third day there though. Also yes it is off the road and we had to take taxis to everywhere. Also there was a big storm our last night and we got in a taxi and they shut down all the roads practically...we drove around for at least 45 mins. had to pay this woman something for taking us right back to our hotel. We ate at the Madrid Tapas restaurant and the food was good. Recommend Ajili Mojili which is across the bridge by all the other resorts. The concierge was somewhat helpful in finding restaurants and clubs to go to. Overall, it was okay. Grounds are beautiful though...if you like laying outside and relaxing...private beach is great for that.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>2nd time just as good This was our second time at the Caribe Hilton. We use Hilton Honors points for our stay, and when we checked in didn't get the room we had requested. I talked with the manager and we had to stay first night in the room they had. Only when I went to the Hilton Honors desk, did we get confirmation that they would move us to the requested room. (The rooms in the tower are much nicer.)Now the good part. Delta lost my 5 year olds bag. Sonya at the concerige worked night and day to get it back. The room we had in the tower was fantastic. The pools were clean and fun. The Hilton Honors breakfast bar and happy hour bar were a nice treat. The activities were fun. Especially for the children. They had a big arcade for rainy weather, taxi's available 24/7. Old San Juan was only $8 ride in a taxi. The travel excursions were a bit pricey, and we stayed at the pool most of the time anyways. The spa/excercise facility was state of the art. The restaurant in the spa was really good for healthy lunch. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Donna West Hartford, CT

<Author>cgd284
<Content>Its a good hotel in an OK island Stayed at the Caribe Hilton for a week from 1/31/05 to 2/4/05 and found it to be a good hotel but VERY overpriced. Then again overpriced is the theme in San Juan Puerto Rico.They just spent $60 million renovating the hotel but some sections of the hotel are still not quite up to date. The hotel has a nice beach and pool area but is not within walking distance of anything. Thats where the overpriced taxis come into play.If you must go to Puerto Rico, then this is a good choice among the hotels in San Juan (if you can get past the $18.50 breakfat buffet and $7 bottle of water from the mini bar). If you have an option go to the Dominican Republic or Mexico and spend 1/2 of the money on eveything.

<Author>SarahBelle
<Content>Average Hotel I just returned from the Carbie Hilton, from a 6 night stay, after reading the mixed reviews from this website, i took mostly potivite things from it. The hotel is somewhat set back from the road, with very nice landscaping, the lobby has no doors, so the breeze was enjoyable while waiting on the long line. When you get the chance to check in, it was fast, but there was a reasonable line. We stayed in a Garden view room, which i am not sure if it was the oldest section, but it seemed that way. It was a decent size, two double beds, but we had some complaints. Our phone was broken, and after a couple of calls to the front desk it still wasn't fixed. The lighting in the bathroom was horrible, the closet door didn't close, both the toilet paper holder and the soap holder (in the shower) were broken. Around all the edges of the entire room and bathroom looked like it hadn't been cleaned in a long time. The air conditioning vent was clogged with dust, it only made me think of what we were breathing in, not sanitary. There were stains on the rug, dirty windows and occasionally the TV would flicker. All along the halls, they have a molding that comes halfway up the wall, the molding was falling off and we saw a sworm of tiny ants, right in front of our door. The view was nice if you kept your head straight up, but if you looked down there was construction. If you are a light sleeper, you would have been woken up by the drills and the machines, and also the Peacocks. Most of these things aren't horrible and i hate to sound picky, but when you pay $400 a night for a room, the little things should be fixed. The grounds were very nice and clean, tons of staff, if it is possibly they should clean the lagoon, there was tons of garbage floating around. Everything there is way overpriced, breakfast buffet is $18.50 a morning. Your waitor comes to the table, asks if you want coffee and you don't see them again. When the bill comes, there is a little saying on the paper to tip your waitor the suggested 15%. Im sorry but i am not paying someone any extra for saying 5 words, and that is it. If you don't tip them, they don't seem very happy either. The same thing goes for all the bartenders, the taxi boys, valet and everyone there that is wearing a shirt. Not to mention when we recieved our bill at the end of our stay, the hilton charged us a dollar a day to donate to their foundation, without permission, so be aware.We never had a problem finding a taxi, yet again overpriced, my problem with this hotel, is the location. You have to take a taxi everywhere, and there is nothing around the hotel. A taxi is at least $10 for about 5 minutes, it is a drive everywhere, we walked near the marriot one night and it took 45 minutes. If i could suggest to stay anywhere it would be the Wyndam Condado Plaza, or the Marriot, it is ideal if you don't want to spend every waking moment at the hotel. There are restauraunts and clubs accross the street from the Wyndam and the Marriot, more ideal location. We went horseback riding through the hotel, overpriced, but had so much fun, we went snorkling at the hotel, and there isn't anything to see except cloudy water, we ate at the italian restauraunt in the hotel, and spent $84 on two people, not including drinks, wayy over priced but the food was excellent. The outdoor eatery is all fried food, we had Mortons one night for desert and it took 30 minutes, and it was average. All in all, this hotel has no night life, but a lot to offer during the day, when you have a hotel so secluded a larger nightlife should be necessary, the rooms were below average and the grounds were above average. Like I said, if you are comming here to stay in the hotel to whole time, it is nice, but if you are looking for something to do, not the best place. Hope i helped.  
<Date>Jan 27, 2005

<Author>kleef
<Content>Nice, clean hotel We saw mixed reviews here and decided to stay at the Caribe Hilton anyway. We were not dissapointed. We stayed in the tower, which has refurbished rooms that were nicely appointed. The bathroom is incredible: large, with dual sinks, marble, and rainforest shower that will easily fit two people. Pool area is lush and nice. Pool was completely clean and clear while we were there. There is no outdoor hottub however which was disappointing. We ate at Madrid's Tapas and had a wonderful meal and great service. The hotel is on it's own little penisula, not far from both Condado and Old San Juan areas. Very walkable area, although not especially close to eateries and stores. Would stay here again.

<Author>wheelspw
<Content>Great Time We stayed for 6 nights at the Caribe and had a good experience. I'm a Diamond member and the benefits paid off. The Executive lounge was well staffed, had a good breakfast and a great cocktail selection and hours. We only ate dinner at one of the restaurants onsite, the Tapas Room and the food was excellent. We had lunch at the Olas Spa. Its a great option for the healthy eater. The lunches there were very well and the service was great. The location was ideal as you could go 5 minutes in one direction and go to a number of great restaurants in Old City and 5 minutes in the other direction to Condado. The gym in the health spa was great, even better than most gyms you would pay for. The lagoon area/beach was very nice and well kept. The room was well appointed and nicely furnished. The balcony was tiny, we didn't bother trying to sit out on it at all and it overlooked the top of the lower section of the building with a huge air vent..not too appealing but could be easily overlooked.All in all.. a really nice option for downtown San Juan area..we would definitely go back..  
<Date>Jan 2, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Wonderful Hotel! My husband and I just returned from a 7-day cruise on the Celebrity Constellation - that's a complete review for another time (Celebrity is the BEST!). We decided to stay overnight prior to the cruise which sailed from San Juan. We are fairly loyal to the Hilton, and the Caribe did not disappoint us at all. We chose a junior king suite on the executive floor, and were quite shocked that the executive lounge included complimentary drinks for happy hour (that is unusual for the Hilton), including Champagne and all top shelf brands. The room was very spacious and clean. The restaurant in the lobby (more of a lobby bar) was quite good with the best Pina Coladas we ever tasted. This Hilton is the birth place of the Pina Colada and is currently celebrating it's (the drink's) 50th anniversary! The location is superb, right on the beach, and every room has a balcony overlooking some part of the ocean. If there was anything that was a disappointment, our view from room #801 was a little of the ocean, and a lot of roof... I would strongly suggest that you visit the Caribe Hilton. It is upscale, and a little higher priced, but well worth the money!

<Author>Mickeytoo
<Content>Rooms were nice but the noise was out of control Went to San Juan in March of 04 stayed there for an extended weekend. The staff was very friendly and the rooms were pretty nice. However our room overlooked the garden area and the peacocks kept us up most of the night. I believe it was a white male that was the culprit.They made so much noise at times it was just unbelieveable. Also they were doing construction on part of the hotel so usually we were up all night with the peacocks and then up very early in the morning with the construction workers. Not sure if they are finished their renovations by now but beware!Also we ate breakfast at the resturant there near the pool ONCE and it was in my opinion very expensive, also there were bugs flying around and in the pastries. We soon discovered a little resturant right across the street from the hotel where we ate breakfast for a third of the cost of the breakfast at the hotel. I was also disappointed in the beaches or lack there of but I'm sure that's just mother nature and has nothing to do with the hotel.

<Author>kelfly
<Content>Beautiful Resort My husband and I stayed at the Caribe for three nights early December, pre-cruise. We booked direct through Hilton, not a Price-line, etc. We paid $195/night for Executive level and were in the main building on the 10th (top) floor. The executive lounge was on the 9th floor. We had an ocean view with a small balcony.The check-in was easy; we were able to check in on the 9th floor executive lounge. The room was plenty spacious and clean. The grounds were incredible! We did not use the pool, but there were always plenty of loungers at it. We preferred the beach area and never had a problem getting a nice quiet spot.The staff were all quite friendly. The staff in the executive lounge were superb. Free continental breakfast; free happy hour with cocktails, wine, and appetizers from 5:30 - 8:00; and cordials and desserts (cookies, etc) from 8:00 - 10:00.Hotel has a nice workout facility (a short walk down the beach in a different building). There is also a spa facility in this building. Tennis courts are also available. Water sports rental (mats, etc) available. We brought our own snorkeling gear and snorkelled out near the rock barrier; saw quite a few fish.Within walking distance to OSJ (about 35 minutes) and Condado (about 35 minutes). As mentioned, very limited in restaurants nearby. We did find a local Puerto Rican diner about 2 blocks away that had tasty local dishes. No shopping close by. We really enjoyed our hikes into OSJ and Condado (different days!).I would have no probelm staying at this resort again. It would also be a nice place to stay for a longer land based vacation as opposed to precruise.  
<Date>Dec 22, 2004

<Author>Digest
<Content>Hilton? Stayed at the Hilton with caution after viewing the mixed reviews. The lobby and landscaping at this location is beautiful, the pool is a bit dated looking. The first room assigned on the 11 th floor with Ocean view in the back building was HORRIBLE. Rust stains on the carpet, stains in the ceiling and the bathroom was terrible. Hilton hotels in general are on the down swing. At this property the hotel has decided to renovate certain floors. Stay on the 18th floor, this is where we moved. The room was much better but still not up to Hiltons old standards. The staff was somewhat helpful but many were rude, usually a sign of bad management and/or a bad corporate culture. The location is not as good as the Marriott. The towels were also like paper towels. I would rate the rooms a 1 star and the lobby and pool a two star. The carpet in the halls and most rooms needs to be changed. The breakfast buffet is excellent.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great Experience We stayed here pre-cruise for one night, Sunday October 24, 2004, myself, my spouse and my parents. The rooms and the hotel far exceeded my expectations, especially considering the mixed reviews I have read here. The arrangements were made through Celebrity. Both rooms were overlooking the beach and the pool, on the Executive Level, they were spacious, bright, clean and overall were great! The Executive Level included a lounge with Continental Breakfast, Complimentary Coffees, Afternoon Hors D'oeuvres, Cocktail Hour, and Evening Coffee with cordials, all complimentary.  We had dinner at Morton's Steak house, it was great, expensive, but in line with every other Morton's Steak House. The breakfast buffet was very good, wine, champagne all out, so you could help yourself to mimosas, the food in the buffet was very good as well. The grounds were meticulously maintained, the pool and beach were great. The staff was professional and very friendly, really wished we could have stayed longer than a day, will definitely go back for a vacation there in the near future.
