<Author>kokochenille
<Content>Pleased with the Caribe After seeing the mixed reviews about the Hilton Caribe, we went with our gut feeling and decided to try it anyway. I must say that my boyfriend and I were very pleased with our choice. The property itself was spacious, clean and well maintained. Also the benefit of having our own private beach was phenomenal. The staff, as a whole was also courteous. As previous reviews had stated, the island is very humid, which may have potentially lead to the level of mildew content our oriinal room contained. (rm 1669)We asked to switch rooms and it was done so immediately. The mildew scent was at a minimum and the view was fantastic. (roon 1863 to be exact) The breakfast was great. (A little pricey, but very goood.) All in all, after actually going to San Juan and visiting the other hotels to see what we had passed up to stay at the Caribe, I must say that we were pleased with our choice and will definitely be returning.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Caribe was Great! Spent 10 days in SJ in early September. Was a little apprehensive about staying at Caribe Hilton after seeing so many mixed reviews. However, at great rate of $74 per night via Priceline, we couldn't resist. Room was perfect---clean and in very good condition. Balcony overlooked beautiful pools and the beach. The ongoing construction is on the other side of the hotel. Staff very efficient and courteous, especially Sandy at the front desk. Only complaints would be about the restaurants: food just fair and overpriced. Much more enjoyable to visit local restaurants to sample the PR specialities and atmosphere instead of a chain restaurant, such as Morton's at the hotel. Location is perfect---short drive to Old San Juan and the Condado strip. On next trip to PR, will stay at the Caribe again. Even during the Tues night and Wed when Hurricane Jeanne hit, there were no problems. During the worst of the storm, the free coffee bar in the lobby was a busy meeting spot for many guests talking about their first hurricane experience. When we left on Thursday, grounds were cleaned up and again in perfect condition.  
<Date>Oct 5, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Caribe convenience can't be beat I love this resort. It is conveniently located between Old San Juan and other parts of the city. The private beach cannot be beat. I got a great rate on the executive floor that made it all worth it. This is my third time at the Caribe and I have been to almost all of the better hotels in Puerto Rico. While the restaurants are expensive, each of them has their own style and the food and service is good. On the weekends, the beach services are perfect for the kids.On the downside, there is always a funny smell in the hallways. The housekeeping staff is only average. I had a room that overlooked the construction site, but I only heard noise when out on the balcony.I spent 4 nights by myself and never felt lonely. I would recommend this hotel to business travelers, families or couples going for a quick weekend away.  
<Date>Sep 7, 2004

<Author>willbegone
<Content>Not up to Hilton Standards I stayed at this hotel while on a business trip. Overall, my comment is that for the price, this hotel is not a great value. Ie itemized the pluses and minues at the bottom of this review. The price you pay will greatly influence your satisfaction rating. My corporate rate is $145/night which is similar to the rate you can get directly from Hilton if you are willing to prepay your stay at time of reservation without refund. I would not recommend that so as to allow you to checkout if you are disappointed after the first night. You will definitely be happy with this hotel should you be able to snag a room for $100/night (a rate I've never seen). However, I checked many places and the average rate is above $200 which is too much for this property unless the rooms undergo a major renovation (none scheduled that I know of).First of all, arriving at night in a rental car, the signage for the hotel is poor. Gold lettering on a brown stone wall is partially obscured by a tree for the small alley-width road leading to the hotel. The best direction is to head straight for the Normandie hotel which is clearly visible in front of you, and the Hilton is to your right. Check-in is conveniently located just off a circular driveway where you can park temporarily without a hassle. Valet parking is also readily available with plenty of personnel to shuttle the cars. No bell hop offered to get my bag or look after it. So, after check-in, I drove around the driveway and down the alley to their parking garage, a facility with in/out privileges at $10/day ($20/day valet). I ordered room service at 10:45pm which arrived within 45 minutes as they stated.The biggest nice surprise of the whole visit was that night when I had trouble enabling the in-room broadband, the hotel operator came up to personally fix it within five minutes. That five-star service.2/3 of the bottom level of the six-story garage is enclosed in a really tacky exhibition center where cheapo conferences take place. The days I was here, I saw temporary card tables set up with various wares such as cosmetics and crafts - dunno exactly what was going on. I mention this because the garage is small, so taking 2/3 of the first level for this purpose is questionable. After parking, I wheeled my luggage the medium far distance back to the hotel where my room was in the main building. The main building is a non-descript rectangular box aligned roughly perpendicular to the ocean. This allows most rooms on each side to have ocean views. Back in the 50's, when this box was constructed, the space on either side was not built up. Now, however, the fort side of the building, where my room was located, contains a large two-story ballroom building that extends a couple hundred feet out from the building. This means that all rooms on this side of the building overlook the roof of the ballroom area. In addition, as previously mentioned, the condo building construction continues which obscures yet more precious beachfront.My room was a plain, non-suite, which is typical of Hiltons all over the world. Nothing inside eludes of five-star luxury, nor does it have Motel 6 plainness. The AC unit is the old style wall mount with an updated digital thermostat. It chilled OK but did a so-so job of dehumidification that is typical of low-end AC units that do not have a separate dehumidify mode. The grill shows rust and corrosion, as does the door closer to the hallway. The bathroom has mold on the caulk line of the tub. The bathroom phone did not have dialtone, and the toilet does not shut off completely.I used the health club one afternoon. Machines include 6 treadmills (one down for service), one elliptical, one or two star steppers, a dozen or so resistance machines, and two or three free-weight positions. The club is part of the spa complex that includes the spa facility and a small cafe with tennis courts behind. The club is a simple, beautiful design with a roof sloping upward to the ocean side that is a wall of windows with the $1M view. The opposite and side walls have mirrors reflecting theocean view. TV's are placed too high to be viewable from the treadmills, but I found the ocean view to be preferable to watching CNN. The attendant provides towel service, and there are small lockers you can use (no locker room or showers that I could see, though). Resistance machines show wear on the fabric that needs to be replaced.I swam in the pool one morning at 7am (didn't realize the pool actually opens at 8am). Security saw me but didn't bother me. The main pool is 4ft deep and suitable for swimming laps only if you arrive in the very early a.m. Otherwise, as in all hotel pools everywhere, screaming kids rule until the pool closes in the evening. Additional pools ofvarying depths are interconnected, and there's a swim-up bar in the uppermost pool. The adjoining area provides plenty of choices for relaxing. Lounges with freshly cleaned cushions were already in place at 7am, as were the beach towels. You can choose from shady spots in the palm tree area or sunny spots along the beach. As the sun sets, the sand beach area is shaded. Speaking of the beach, many reviewers complainabout it but the bottom line for me is that for this area of San Juan, it's of pretty decent size and and well maintained (in comparison to the Normandie or Wyndham for example which are nearby and I also checked out).I checked out but did not use the beach locker room area which is conveniently located off the beach area on the bottom level of the hotel. The ceiling height is low here. The facility was clean but I didn't get a good feeling about leaving items in a locker there (you can padlock it). I'd recommend keeping your personal items with you or with a friend while you're in the pool.You won't see many young adults or beautiful people sunbathing here. In general, the guests I saw were late 30's to senior citizens, of medium to overweight but not obese build. Most women are conservative with their swimwear here which probably also goes along with the older clientele.I asked for some advice from the concierge and the travel desk, both of which are located off the open-air lobby.The travel desk was not helpful when I wanted to go on a tour Monday at 9:30am. I asked about the rain forest and was told I missed the only tour for the day, and that the cave tours only occur Wednesday-Sunday (maybe through their pre-arranged hotel pickup that's probably true but it's really external companies who do the tours and she could have called around or asked). She gave me incorrect directions to the rain forest (the road to the rain forest did NOT intersect the main highway). She did not offer any suggestions to explore this beautiful country and was not a person with the right attitude to be working in that position at the hotel.From the concierge, I asked for a recommendation for an off-site restaurant such as a pancake house that is breakfast-oriented. She said there are no pancake houses in Puerto Rico, and recommended the hotel restaurant that I said I'd been to but was tired of. I did end up eating there again for their $20 breakfast buffet which costs approximately the same as if you order pancakes, sausage, and eggs ala carte (drink not included). I went back to the concierge another morning and the guy was reading the paper and engaged in a conversation with another hotel employee who was sitting there. He did notice me and gave me the map I requested. A rack of literature was located next to this desk, all of which were the standard fare that tour companies and shopping centers give to the hotels for free).I ate in the main restaurant several times (breakfast x2, dinner x1, sunday brunch). The dining room is pleasant with windows facing the pool and ocean; you can also eat outside. Sunday brunch was the biggest rip-off at $30. It's similar to the breakfast buffet but offers carved meats (which were gone and not replenished during my meal), and some seafood. During the brunch, ordering off the menu is not offered. Many kids were running around free in the restaurant area (just like at Old Country Buffet in the states if anyone has ever been there). Young kids eat free, and older ones get a discount. At the breakfast brunch one morning, I walked up to the cook and asked for a freshly made omelet to order that he made no problem. However, I don't know if this was a protocol violation as this was the place where waiters placed their orders with the cooks. Steam table eggs were readily available as were a good variety of all the normal breakfast items.Checkout was speedy. I did ask about the $8.75/day resort fee that was added to my bill, and they told me it was part of the room fee.Pluses- nice health club, nice view with wall of windows overlooking the ocean. This is such a pleasantchange from the average hotel club which is located in the basement or another room without windows- beautiful pool area, clean, inviting- pretty beachfront (for the area). Hotels and condos swallow up most of the land here and this one has one of the nicer maintained private beach areas - not huge, though- Louisa the hotel operator, who at 11pm my first nights stay diagnosed a problem with the hotel broadband and personally brought and installed an Ethernet cable within five minutes of me talking with her - Brava!- late-night room service- convenient distance to airportMinuses- $15/night for in-room broadband, free at most business-class hotels these days- $5/15 minutes for wireless broadband in the lobby area, free at most business-class hotels these days- no mini-fridge, standard at most business class hotels these days. They will deliver one subjectto availability if you ask, though.- business lounge is tiny (3-4 tables), and free continental breakfast is just pastries no hot items- no restaurants within walking distance- bell hops where are you? Front desk didn't ask if I needed baggage assistance at check-in.- parking garage is too small (and will get worse as the condos next door start getting occupants)- breakfast buffet is approximately $20, pancakes with meat $10, $18 if you want eggs, too. drink notincluded.- hotel signage difficult to see from the road - hotel entrance road is tiny. banning parking on itwould be a good idea to make two-way passage easier- as in many tired, aging Hiltons worldwide, minor room issues: rusty grill on AC unit and door closer, mold along tub line, bathroom phone no dial tone, leaky toilet, mold/cleaning fluid smell from carpet- no HBO on room TV, just basic cable channels- beware of the bottle of water in your room. Hhonors members will think this is the free bottle you get at most Hiltons. However, this bottle costs you $7 charged to your room- sunday lunch buffet costs $30. Same basic buffet sans carved meats costs $15 nightly. Drink not included.- $8.75/day resort fee added to room charge. I inquired about this and they said it's part of the hotel fee and can't be deleted. This wasn't advertised when I reserved my room.- $1/day kids charity fee added to room charge (can be deleted)- 2/3 of the bottom story of the parking garage converted to an enclosed exhibition center where low-budget functions take place (indivduals renting booths setting up their card tables to hawk their goods and services). Tacky not Hilton caliber.- karaoke lady singing almost every night in the open lounge bar area, often until 3am or more (party went to 5am one night I was there). She is OK quality, but ofa caliber you'd expect to hear in a Holiday Inn off the interstate not in a five-star Carribbean resort.A small live band with island music would be nice.- expensive restaurants, and too many of them (seven). Most of the restaurants have extremely low occupancy (spa cafe, spanish restaurant, Italian? restaurant). Converting one to an enclosed SportsBar might be nice.- beware of the bottle of water in your room. Hhonors members will think this is the free bottle you get at most Hiltons. However, this bottle costs you $7 charged to your room- sunday lunch buffet costs $30. Same basic buffet sans carved meats costs $15 nightly. Drink not included.Speaking of that condo project Paseo Caribe next door...- Part of the site was owned by the Navy, and another was an outdoor parking lot owned by the Hilton(shame on the Navy for selling it vs. leaving it as a national park with the historic 1500's fort whichof course they are leaving intact)- It's not just a condo project; they anticipate a whole shopping complex with movie theaters, casino, etc.- The condos will invite more transient residents. Owners are not anticipated to live there- Guess who will be managing the timeshare condo arrangements? The HILTON.- So in fact, rich investors are using the condo as an investment and revenue source vs. as a residence and the Hilton is using the property as a hotel within a hotel (their words). They get a nice, new property to manage without spending all the capital (wonder if they will pump some of that back into renovating the 1950's main hotel building)?- Scheduled for completion in August, 2004, as of this writing, the building is still aconcrete shell, and they now anticipate a phased approach stretching out fully into 2005.  
<Date>Sep 7, 2004

(normandie):1	5863(passage):1	5947(caulk):1	6857(ban):1	6977(preferable):1	7310(fluid):1	10903(two-story):1	12516(non-suite):1	
153	2(night):1	3(clean):1	4(nice):3	6(breakfast):1	7(walk):1	17(view):1	28(close):1	29(minute):1	30(beach):5	32(check):1	33(trip):1	34(feel):1	36(desk):1	38(lot):1	43(leave):3	45(beautiful):1	46(free):1	49(shop):2	54(door):2	56(morning):1	66(park):4	73(etc):1	84(locate):3	89(offer):1	101(center):1	121(car):1	127(speak):1	130(standard):2	133(huge):1	134(available):1	135(build):1	142(bring):1	147(business):1	158(plenty):1	166(own):2	167(choose):1	181(tour):1	183(wall):3	192(site):1	193(person):1	206(live):1	211(facility):1	230(road):1	234(set):1	244(mention):2	286(check-in):1	293(course):1	306(level):2	317(spot):2	321(shuttle):1	326(style):1	342(island):1	371(talk):1	398(music):1	420(sun):1	457(valet):1	477(hilton):2	484(cable):1	492(private):1	519(item):1	522(sand):1	530(country):1	538(casino):1	550(cook):1	562(maintain):1	580(hallway):1	583(construction):1	594(explore):1	606(sell):1	629(grill):1	635(theater):1	725(update):1	760(company):1	783(opposite):1	795(shade):1	821(attitude):1	828(tree):2	850(bottom):1	901(outdoor):1	918(addition):1	921(suggestion):1	922(lead):1	936(garage):1	956(ac):1	980(unit):1	987(palm):1	989(movie):1	1052(personally):1	1070(conveniently):2	1074(complex):1	1093(position):1	1096(continue):1	1112(fare):1	1122(previously):1	1129(mirror):1	1130(caribe):1	1193(hassle):1	1210(invite):1	1274(historic):1	1292(shame):1	1335(band):1	1346(land):1	1394(stone):1	1428(purpose):1	1457(personnel):1	1571(gold):1	1667(brown):1	1700(sunny):1	1775(freshly):1	1912(circular):1	1916(rack):1	1972(letter):1	1988(resident):1	2079(convert):1	2167(operator):1	2250(reflect):1	2305(anticipate):1	2340(national):1	2384(brunch):1	2543(shady):1	2547(thermostat):1	2572(beachfront):1	2655(vs):1	2691(install):1	2715(readily):1	2758(enclose):1	2794(mount):1	2811(condo):3	2825(broadband):1	3047(fort):1	3218(rust):1	3257(omelet):1	3326(project):2	3391(questionable):1	3416(digital):1	3446(locker):2	3500(partially):1	3697(ethernet):1	3767(driveway):1	4074(condos):2	4871(precious): <Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Not what you expect from Hilton We stayed at the Caribe Hilton on July 24, 2004 for one night prior to our cruise. We got in rather late and were given a room that smelled moldy and had wet carpet. I called to complain about the situation and was not offered any alternative. The next morning we tried to eat breakfast but the restaurant had a horde of people in a big line waiting to eat. The view off our balcony was mainly a construction site. Other members of my family stayed there also and were put in rooms on the concierge floor for less money than I spent and had a decent stay. The management has given me a 50% refund on our room. I would try somewhere else next time.  
<Date>Sep 2, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Enjoyed the Caribe We stayed at the Caribe Hilton for six nights in May, 2003 and were very satisfied with the property. The hotel itself is ideally located adjacent to the Condado Lagoon, half way between Old and New San Juan. Hilton promotes the fact that there is an old Spanish fort on the San Geronimo grounds. This was somwhat misleading as the fort, at that time, was fenced off and appears dangerously located on the rocks and coral. That being said, Caribe Hilton had several benefits. The staff were friendly and the rooms clean. Our view overlooking the San Juan coastline was absolutely breathtaking. It was very relaxing and beautiful. There are approximately 4-5 restaurants on-site including Morton's of Chicago where my wife and I had one of our best meals ever. While the exterior facade appeared somewhat dated, the management spent considerble time and money renovating the lobby/atrium. It looks really nice when you enter the building. Having visited both the Wyndham Condado and the Marriott Stellaris, I am glad we chose the Caribe Hilton in that both Marriott and Wyndham have casinos attracting a noisier, more eccentric crowd. Another nice aspect of Caribe is a private, man-made beach with a large pool with swim-up bars. All in all, this is a four-star property. Unlike other resort stays, you will probably spend a great deal of time away from the property. Old and New San Juan have many fabulous restaurants, bars, and shops to explore. There is a car rental agency across the street with affordable rates so that you can explore the rest of the island. Puerto Rico is beautfiful. We had a great time at Caribe and would definitely stay there again the next time we visit San Juan.  
<Date>Aug 30, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great for the kids! How was it? Really! Overall, it's wasn't as bad as some of the previous reviews mentioned. Some of the issues are true and can be a nuisance, but what did you expect? The Ritz? The hotel is great if you have little kids. The pool area was well laid out for adults and kids. The sheltered beach area was even better for little one. There were no waves to knock them over.Our room was recently renovated and was fairly clean. The bathroom was pretty nice and had a large shower. It had a good size TV with movies and games for a fee.As I mentioned, overall it wasn't that bad. But, there were some issues that were annoying. Yes, they are renovating portions of the hotel. So, the work is done during the day and there is some noise. This is a definite problem if you are trying to take an afternoon nap. Some of the elevators did not work at times, so we had to use the service ones. It was better that the stairs from the 15th floor. The hotel does show some signs of its age, but they are making an effort to refurbish it. But, things are done a little slower in PR than the states. It's just a fact.We would stay there again, but I would try to get a better rate. It you want high service and cleanliness, go to the Ritz. That is what we did. Instead of having a disappointing vacation, we leveraged our time. We stayed at the Hilton for 3 days and the rest at the Ritz. Yes, it was a little more, but it worked out just fine.After all, it is pretty difficult to sift through all these reviews. Some are good and some are bad. We have plenty of new resort properties in Orlando and it's hard for some foreign locations to compete with the amenities and service levels we expect as Americans. Once you leave the US it's always a gamble. But, I try to be fair and honest to all involved. Your vacation time is very valuable and should be taken seriously.  
<Date>Aug 15, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Had a great time! My husband and I stayed at the Caribe Hilton to start our honeymoon before our cruise. We were a little apprehensive because of some of the other reviews on this site but we really enjoyed the hotel. First of all everyone at the hotel was very nice and we had no problems checking in three hours early either. The open air lobby is very unique and the grounds are just gorgeous! It is an older hotel but it is still nice. We also faced the fort where there was construction but we never heard a thing. We were a little unprepared for the food prices at the restaurants in the hotel, but the prices were comprable to other restaurants in the city. We had a good experience at this hotel and would definately stay there again!

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Caribe Hiton is the way to go Just got back from PR on July 17. We stayed at Caribe Hilton for 8 days and this is truly one of the best hotel in San Juan area, not only according to us but also according to the locals.The hotel room is around 3 star rating, and they are a bit slow is fixing things. But the view and the lanscape of the hotel really make it worth it. When you walk out to the pool area, you will have a 240 degree view of the atlantic ocean. And at night you can see huge fish under the hotel pier. The beach turned out to be the best beach in San Juan. Trust me, we look around town for a better beach and fail.The food in the hotel is expensive, but who cares, because we love to try the local eateries. There's a sandwich shop right infront of the hotel, that sale cheap and great cuban sanwiches.PR turns out to be the best vacation place I've ever visited. And I've been to Bali and Spain as a comparison. It's like having the European feeling, US convenience in the tropical setting. Don't leave PR without visiting one of the bioluminiscent lagoon. It will blow you away.Plus point, PR use US dollars, US stamps and our cel phone work as if we're in the continental US.Rent a car. The driving is not as bad as mexico city or europe. And the trafic is comparable to Houston, Texas. Try the Paella, and Mofongo (local dish made with mashed plantain filled with meat). And learn to salsa before you get there, so you can visit one of the salsa dance places.Old San Juan is only 5 minutes from the hotel. The traffic is bad to go there, but it's so worth it.  
<Date>Jul 21, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Not such a good hotel I just got back from seven days at the Caribe Hilton. The grounds are beautiful, the pools are nice and the service was good. We booked the vacation package through Liberty Travel and was surprised that when we got to the hotel that the buffet breakfast and one drink was free to us.Now for the not so nice things about the hotel. One day we were out for several hours sightseeing in Old San Juan. When we got back to our hotel room our door was open. It was not wide open, but open enough for anybody to walk it. I called the front desk and they said that the maid must have left it open and to check to see if anything was missing. Luckily nothing was missing. But that gave me an eerie feeling. Anybody could have just walked in and stolen everything. We did keep our valuables in the safe though.Another thing deals with the shower. We had a separate shower stall in the bathroom. The drain was really clogged to the point where none of the water was draining down. When my niece opened the shower door all the water came crashing out of the shower onto the floor as well as the carpet outside of the bathroom. We went to the front desk to report it and they said that they would have someone to look at it that night. Since we were going out that night we asked if someone could come the next day. The person at the front desk assured me that someone would be there first thing in the morning. When no one showed up by noon we called the front desk. Apparently someone put down that it was already fixed. They did send someone to fix it though. Someone from housekeeping was supposed to dry out the carpet, but the day we left the carpet was still wet. So much for that.The nightlife in the hotel stinks. There really is nothing for you to do and going to Old San Juan every evening gets stale after a while. The hotel had this woman singing at night in their bar. At first we thought it was Kareokee night her singing was that bad.If you want to do nothing at night I recommend this hotel. On the weekends it seems that local comes to the hotel to stay. It gets rather noisy in the pool area.Also, I might add, the sand on the beach is dirty with cigerette butts and other things that people just throw on the ground. It isn't very well kept up. If they spend less money on the grass outside of the hotel and more money on renovating the place it wouldn't be such a bad hotel to stay in. We were in the Tower section. The bodega to get the bottled water and other things is not too far from where we were staying.I doubt that I would ever go back to PR, but if I do I will not stay at the Hilton.One more thing. If you go to the Conserge to ask for places to eat or menus beware of a place called Bon Appetite. It is a service that will get you any kind of food you would like and deliver it to you. My niece and I wanted Chinese food. We ordered three things and the total was over $50. The beef with broccoli was over $17. Don't use this service if you can help it. We wound up ordering Domino's pizza instead.I hope this helps someone. If you have any questions you can email me at schills1@aol.com  
<Date>Jul 19, 2004
<Rating>2	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1

<Author>halcyonlondon
<Content>Suggestion for finding a Good Rate Suggestion: After much research and contemplation between the Caribe Hilton, Intercontinental, and Wyndham Condado hotels, I booked the Caribe Hilton on Hotwire.com for Labor Day weekend. Saved $175.00 per 3-night stay compared with rates found elsewhere. Secured a $102.00 nightly rate plus taxes. It's a good deal, however, a bit of a crap-shoot--there's a chance that you 'll end up in either the Hilton, Wyndham, or Intercontinental. If you'll be happy at any of the three, which we were, check out Hotwire. Just you do your homework, pick a place in a four- or five-star rating, and you can usually figure out where you'll be staying. Hotwire is a role of the dice, but not entirely surprising, for certain destinations. We were betting on the Caribe Hilton, and got it. Happy travels!  
<Date>Jul 18, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Nice..good for families. I enjoyed my stay at the Caribe Hilton. I was almost going to stay at the Wyndham in Condado because they offer their guaranteed best prices online but when I went to confirm the res. the next day the inexpensive price was then gone. In any case, I was also told Caribe Hilton guaranteed their best prices online so I went for it. The hotel is nice when you enter. The grounds, pool and beach area all open up one after the other and are well maintained. However, the pool after the week staying there was dirty (dirty suds of some sort??). At the play ground with my seven year old daughter I found a what seemed like a used condom at which point I immidiately called my daughter to get off of the playset. People, get a room, your at a hotel! The rooms were ok. The fact that there was a private beach was nice but I enjoyed other beaches much better (ie. Isabella Beach was beautiful, Condado Beach was also nice). You have to go to Old San Juan. I was discouraged not to because it was more happening in the Condado area but I found Old San Juan so charming. They have really good restaurants like the Parrott Club  Tantra and bars like Dragonfly. That whole strip was filled with nice places to eat and very romantic. Since I am a parent the best thing is that Caribe Hilton gives you free baby sitting service when you stay three nights or more. I am not absolutely sure if this was a special or if its something they contine to do all the time but it was GREAT. I got alone time with my husband and we went out for dinner and dancing in Old San Juan. They have activities all day for youngsters and adults. There is also day time feeding for the fish which was amazing. We held onto some of the bread they give you to feed the fish at night and it was great! You must go to Culebra!! This place is AMAZING!! Its an island off of the main island like Vieques is. The beach is unreal...it looked fake it was so beautiful! You can take a ferry or charter from Fajardo to either Island. Keep that on your itin for sure! The main islanders are just catching on to this island too (surprisingly) and its a gem for sure. Depending on a full moon you can do Bio tours in Vieques or in Fajardo and this beyond ANYTHING is something you must do. Besides that, the hotel itself was worth the money, I paid $140 a night and was overall happy with my stay. My husband, daughter and I still have fond memories. Mortan's Steak house was part of the hotel which was a BIG plus. Cabs and bus service are esaily accesable (as is the car rental service if you decide last min but you should do it online). Good luck, be safe and happy times always!  
<Date>Jul 16, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>You can do better for the $! I was surprised that a hotel with the Hilton name, and with these prices, was so lackluster. I definitely think you could do better elsewhere. There are two major concerns:1. OLD FACILTIES WITH POOR UPKEEP. The main building, which I stayed in, dates back to the 1950's-- and you can really tell. Everything in my room had some little problem with it: two of the lamps didn't work, the door couldn't be closed without slamming it, the toilet didn't flush all the time, my key kept not working, and one of the elevators (there were only 2, for hundreds of rooms) was out of service frequently. Overall, none of these were huge issues, but it meant lots of little hassles, that added up to not as pleasant of a vacation! I think poor housekeeping, as some other writers have suggested, was probably also part of this issue. For instance, the small red (dryclean-only-type) decorative pillows they thoughtfully placed on the bed had suspicious whitish stains on them. All I could think was, yuck! 2. There is noisy construction right next door! (as of June 2004). On whole side of the hotel (the side facing the historic small fort) now overlooks a concrete-and-iron, half-finished, condo building, with bright yellow porta-potties decoratively placed right on the beach waterline, where your eye is naturally drawn. I guess in the past this must have been an attractive water-and-greenery view, so people who stayed here in the past probably had a better experience. The construction noise wasn't really that loud, but it was constant--7 days a week including Sunday, and starting early in the morning. I really didn't end up using the balcony because of this issue. (of no view plus noise) Overall, again, this wasn't a huge issue but it did detract from the overall experience. Overall, the Frommer's guide makes this place sound much nicer than it is. I think I read there that it had one of the nicest beaches in the area--and while I didn't visit all the other beaches, I was really surprised that the Caribe beach was supposed to be a great beach. It was really very small and had lots of rocks once you got in the water. If you want to walk along an expansive beach you will just end up going out on the street to get to one of the public beaches (which, by the way, were perfectly nice!) Overall, my feeling is you could do better for the money. I would not stay at this hotel again.  
<Date>Jul 16, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>The important things. Our 5 day stay at the Caribe Hilton was overall great. The only complaint that we had was the housekeeping, they didn't pay much attention to details. The night we checked into the hotel, there was a dirty diaper in the bathroom, the toilet seat was 'wet', there was hair in the shower and the hallways could have used some vacuuming. We complained about this the following morning and the hotel manager offered us a garden suite. We went to see the suite but decided that our 13th floor room, which was newly renovated, was much better for us even though smaller. The manager offered us another room on the 16th floor, which was identical to ours, but still the trouble of moving three floors was not going to gain us anything especially having a small child with us. So the manager gave us a $75.00 credit at the Palmera's restaurant. That was very nice!There is one aspect of our visit at the Hilton that left a lasting impression and that was guest relations. The night we arrived one of our friends felt sick and was about to pass out (diet issues), and right away one of the hotel staff saw that we were having problems and called for security. The security personnel dressed in a suit arrived with a first aid kit and oxygen. They also phoned for a doctor (which by the way will charge $120.00) but we had them cancel the doctor after our friend was feeling better after drinking a soda. Two days later another friend of ours was swimming with me out at the reef barrier when he stepped on a sea urchin which stung him in nine different places on his foot. We swam back to shore and my wife approached one of the hotel staff members who was sweeping the sidewalk and told him that our friend had been stung by something in the water. He immediately dropped the broom and literally ran to get help from the lifeguard. The lifeguard arrived with a first aid kit and after examining the foot sting, he recommend that my friend go to the hospital and have the 'splinters' removed. The Hilton security gave us a ride to the local hospital. After we were done I phoned the hotel and they picked us up and drove us back to the hotel. One more incident happened, the in-room safe code had been re-programmed accidentally. Again I called security and they attend us in a very quick and professional manner.After the incidents we went through, the housekeeping problems became minor issues. I was very impressed with the guest relations and the security personnel. Again they were all well dressed and tended to us in a very professional and prompt manner. This gave me a good sense of well being for my family and me, which is far more important than 'cosmetic' issues. I would definitely recommend this hotel and I would consider staying there again.  
<Date>Jul 12, 2004

<Author>Justmyopinion76
<Content>Overall wonderful experience! Just returned from a great 5 day stay at the Caribe Hilton with a group of friends. The newly renovated (13/14th floor) ocean view rooms were lovely with great shower/bath, small balcony and wonderful beds. Via the Puerto Rico is Fun promotion, we had a wonderful buffet breakfast and one drink per day included in our room price, and 4th night free... a great and relaxing plus. Buffet was great, with huge fresh selection. The beach was clean, chairs plentiful and never excessively crowded- free umbrellas too. All the staff we encountered were very helpful and the concierge gave exceptional recommendations for dinner in old San Juan! The only drawbacks: some members of our party had to wait for their room on check-in, and one day our room was not made up (it was done later when we called to ask), and the view of the hotel being constructed next door from some of the rooms is disappointing (though not noisy at all from the upper tower floors); the on-site restaurants are convenient but seem overpriced and uninteresting compared to the similarly or lower-priced and more inventive food available in San Juan, just a short cab ride away. Great experience.  
<Date>Jun 30, 2004

<Author>JaneRussel
<Content>Not bad Spent a week there on business. The staff was friendly and responsive. Rooms reminded me of kinda upscale Holiday Inn (if that is possible) but in need of some sprucing up. Bed was comfortable and room was kept clean by housekeeping staff. The food at the restuarants was acceptable but nothing to rave about. The best thing about the place is the grounds whch are very well-kept and visually appealing. The pools and beach are inviting. All things considered, not a bad place to stay. A good palce for kids. Be sure to get out of the hotel. You can ride a bus downtown for 25 cents. They are safe and pretty quick. There is a pretty good but very informal restuarant within walking distance (about a block), behind the nearby soccer stadium, called Escambron, that does good things with plantains. PR is hot in June (and July, August, and September).

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great Experience My wife  I just returned from a 6 day stay at the Caribe Hilton  I can't say enough about the great service we had there. The front desk, maids, service personnel and the staff at the Hilton Honors room were fabulous. The young conceirge was very helpful in regards to recommendations for restaurants, geographic directions, events, etc. I was apprehensive about staying there due to several negative reviews on this web site but our experiences were fantastic. Also, we were staying on a complimentary basis due to our Hilton membership. The property is fabulous given the amount of prime beach front property that they have and numerous restaurants on site. We did not avail ourselves of the restaurants as they were expensive and too Americanized, i.e., Mortons. The best experiences that we had were the interaction with the people in San Juan. Without a doubt, the friendliest people my wife and I encountered on our numerous travels. We will return soon!!

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Best Trip Ever From the minute we arrived at the caribe hilton til the minute we left my girlfriend and I were treated like a king and queen. I was a little worried because of some bad reviews but when we saw our room we were very pleased. The people that write the horrible reviews are often stuck up and usually never happy anyway. The restaurants are pricey but good at the hotel. I would suggest getting out on the town and trying the local food. The hotel grounds were very clean and the private beach was so quiet and relaxing. The best part of the trip was the catamaran. That was so nice to be out on the water snorkeling and to see all the underwater life. If you go to the bar downstairs tell jose I said hi, what a great guy..

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>8 day stay at the Caribe Hilton 6/11/04 - 6/19/04 My wife and I just recently returned from the Caribe Hilton. We liked the private ocean front beach, that you can snorkle in (but buy snokle gear as the resort charges $10/hour). Cheap snokle gear costs about $10 at Walgreens or similar. The food at the hotel is fine, but overpriced. It's a resort afterall, and with their downtown location a little ways from other hotels and restaurants, they can afford to charge what they charge. For breakfast, go to the Normandie Hotel, which is about 50 yards from the Caribe Hilton. Their buffet breakfast is $12.95 vs. $18.95 at the Hilton. While the Caribe offers more food choices, the restaurant is fly infested and makes the food less than delectable (it's an open air/open door to the outside restaurant, but still flys are a problem.). For lunch, get a sandwich at the outdoor pool bar area. Burgers and sandwiches are still pricey, but not bad ($7 burger and fries). For dinner, take a taxi to the Marriott in Condado. It's $8 each way, but around the Marriott on Ashford St are many local restaurants and a few national chains (chili's, starbucks, dunkin doughnuts.). I recommend the restaurant Hermes (out the Marriott and take a right, about 75-100 yards down on the left. Excellent steak, fish and Mofongo (a local dish served with chicken or shrimp). Say hello to Alexandria, a beautiful young lady who works there as a server, but doesn't speaks decent English. The prices are great. $17 for Filet Mignon vs. $35 for the same steak at Mortons at the Caribe Hilton. The Marrriott also has a nice casino, if your into that. Afterwards, take a taxi from the Marriott back to the Caribe Hilton. Why not stay at the Marriott? Small pools, and public beach, which gets crowded with locals on the weekends. If you want to see the Rain Forest (El Yuque) or other very nice beaches in Puerto Rico, contact Jason in Guest Services at the hotel. He did a great job of getting us on a great tour to see Bacardi, El Yuque and the Bioluminescent Bay(which is really cool). Take a taxi to Old San Juan (El Moro) and take the tour, it's $5. Taxi $10. Then walk downtown. I wouldn't go out and about old San Juan at night, but that's me. During the day its fine, but stay on the roads with the shops (mostly around the Convento Hotel, where you would also need to get a return taxi from. ) Taxi's seem to be only available at Hotels, so it's not like NYC or Chicago where you just hail one on the street as it passes by.There is a general store across the street from the Caribe Hilton. Cokes are $.75 and they have chips, beer, rum, wine, etc. Our room was in the Tower and was recently updated. We saw other rooms that were recently updated. Overall, service in PR is not as fast as in the states, but you're on vacation, slow down and enjoy it. Beer and mix drinks are expensive at all hotels. E-mail me if you need any additional information. Hope this helps.  
<Date>Jun 23, 2004

<Author>TexasEvents
<Content>The worst service and attitude What an absolute disappointment. Not only was the food below standard but the rudeness on behalf of the hotel staff was unbelievable. If you're not a local expect to get blown off or at the very least expect your food to come last. It was very apparent that if you're from the area you will end up with the best service and the best room, if you're not, good luck you're on your own. They'll move quick when it comes to taking your gratuity but good luck in locating them after that.BTW, I love how they donate a $1 a day to a kids charity program for each guest that stays. I thought this was very kind until I found that I was charged each day on my bill for it. I certainly don't mind donating but for this hotel to act as though their the ones making the donation and then charging you is ridiculous. These people need to get off their --- and learn a few things about customer service - I will not be returning to this slime hotel.

<Author>Solange72
<Content>mixed bag A mixed review for this hotel:the free food for children under 5 is a bonus, although the cost of the food for adults somewhat mitigates this blessing. There is a good child vacation camp for kids 4-12. The pools and grounds are fantastic and there is a playground as well. The beach is ok if not fabulous. There are peacocks and swans in the gardens. Free internet access in the lobby. There is free bfast in the HH lounge on the 2nd floor and a happy hour everyday. On the minus side: rooms in main building are a little shabby (tolerable though); the staff frequently bristles when requests are made; the place lacks charm and the general impression is so-so.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Caribe Hilton....Great! Just returned from one week at the Caribe Hilton in San Juan, PR. I was concerned due to the reviews I had read at this site, but I didn't need to be. The staff was great, responsive, available. The rooms were clean (we stayed in the tower). There was some construction to the lagoon side, our view, but not annoying. The bathroom was not perfect, but a few little things could be overlooked. My bed was so comfortable, I didn't want to get out. The beach is private, nice. Great spa. All of our meals were out of the hotel, good to just eat the local food, The Puerto Rico Cafe off of Fortaleza St in Old San Juan is a good experience, as well as Aguaviva, near plaza Colon. Enjoy the people and the history.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Caribe Hilton was great! Like others here, when we read all of the reviews we were a little afraid of staying here. We used Hilton points to stay for free, so we assumed we would receive the lowest category room. When we were checking in, I mentioned that it was our 22nd Wedding Anniversary (and they had a corsage that I had ordered via 1-800-flowers which their Conceirge had recommended). They gave us a room in the main building (not tower). It had a great view, nice furnishings, red marble counter top in bath and comfortable bed and small balcony which had ocean view out the side.We also ate at Morton's steak house, which while expensive (and all Morton's are), was great for our Anniversary. The staff at the front desk were extremely friendly and nice, and so were the bellmen. We also stayed one day after our 7-day cruise so we had two stays. Again, staff was great and room in main tower was also fine. Don't be afraid to go there!

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Happy Honeymooners! I was very nervous about staying at the Caribe Hilton after reading many of the reviews posted on the web. Therefore, I sent an e-mail to Hilton telling them my concerns and letting them know that this would be the first night of our honeymoon prior to our cruise. My first e-mail went without a response, so after about a week or two I simply copied the e-mail, re-sent  asked for a reply. Within 24 hours I had a response from Reservations letting me know that the Front Desk assigned for us one of the recently renovated rooms in the tower which had an ocean view  that the bathrooms were completely redone. Still, I was nervous because of a previous review where the same was promised but the Front Desk gave their room to someone with a similar name. When we arrived at the Front Desk, they were very nice  even mentioned that they knew we were Honeymooners, so evidently my e-mail reached the Front Desk. Our room was awesome!!! It was totally remodeled with new furnishings, carpet, etc., the bathroom was gorgeous, the shower was excellent  the ocean view even better! We ate dinner in their Italian restaurant where the food  service was outstanding. When we got back to our room, they had a sent a bottle of champagne  a box of truffles up to our room! I would definitely go back! Since we were only staying one night, I was afraid that they really wouldn't be concerned with whether or not we liked our accommodations. I am pleased to say that the opposite occurred!  
<Date>May 20, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Had a great time! My friends and I had a great time at our stay at the Caribe Hilton. Minus the broken safe and vanity door hinge, the room was great - clean and comfortable. The grounds, where we spent most of our time, were great. It's rainy season now (May) so there were some scattered showers here and there, however our time there was still wonderful. We too experienced the taxi strike, leaving us stranded at the hotel in the evenings. There is a public bus that takes you to Old San Juan or to the Candado area, however we did not feel comfortable taking this at night; instead we took day trips to outside areas. There is enterainment on the weekends at the bar which was fun. The food at the hotel was decent. I read some previous recommendations about cheap food at the little bodega across from the hotel -- it is cheap, but not very good. The pool bar and grill was very good, as well as the smoothies at the Olas Sap. All in all, we had a great time -- great location, great beaches and friendly staff.  
<Date>May 11, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Good value if you use Priceline This hotel was built in 1950. So, the architecture is dated and the amenities are a bit tired. It is set up for business conventions, but has a huge outdoor pool facility with hot tubs. In addition, the dining facilities look out over the pool area to the ocean through 2-story high windows set in a panoramic semi-circle. Be warned: there is construction going on next door, which starts at 7 a.m. on weekdays. Noisy in the morning, but not as bad as Shanghai.The key for me was getting a price of $75 a night on priceline! At this price, I will suffer tired plumbing and carpets. When I arrived at the airport, we learned that there was a taxi strike. The hotel sent a van to pick us up. When I checked in, they searched for a room and upgraded me to a garden suite (huge living room in addition to king-sized bed). Downside: The large picture window in the living room looks directly into the new high-rise going up next door (50 ft away). I do not care, as I wake up at 6 a.m. and use the pool, which is on the other side of the hotel - away from the construction.There is no in-room high-speed internet, but there is a wireless service available in the lobby (I am using it now). I could not use my ATT dial-up in San Juan.Summary: I am paying $375 for 5 nights in an ancient, but acceptable, business/resort hotel, where the employees give it a good go. I get what I need, by asking around, and enjoy the sun-filled pool and beach area. Ignore the business conferences and eat in town...sheesh. I would not pay $150 a night to stay here, though, but at $75, I see this as a bit of an adventure in paradise.  
<Date>May 4, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Fantastic for kids! We just returned from the Caribe Hilton on 4/24. I was a bit apprehensive considering some of the other reviews but we were thrilled once we got there. The view from the pool and beach area is spectacular. The room was very clean and comfortable. The food was expensive but not out of line with other hotel restaurants that I've gone to. It was very good, especially the Italian restaurant on site. Our kids loved it. They have a nice kiddy pool, the beach is very safe for them, they have two playground areas and a game room for the occasional afternoon rain shower. They have lots of beach buckets and shovels for kids to use and also rent rafts, snorkel equipment, etc. The staff was very nice to the kids as well. It was very conveniently located as well, we took taxis everywhere instead of renting a car. The tour desk has outings to almost all of the places you'd want to go. I highly recommend taking a tour to the El Yunque rainforest. My 6 year old son refused to say good bye, because he wants to go back. We agree with him.  
<Date>Apr 26, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Enjoyed our stay Just returned last night from an 8 night stay at the Caribe. We were a littel nervous after reading some of the reviews, so we were prepared for the worst. Our room on the 4th floor of the tower building was nothing spectacular, but clean and comfortable. The view was terrible (construction site and parking garage) but we do not spend enough time in the room to care about the view. Room had a slight smoke smell although it was supposed to be non smoking. Bed and bathroom were clean and comfortable, though not at all fancy. However, what the room lacked was made up for with the grounds. The pool and beach area are well kept and there are plenty of chairs and clean towels. We found the staff to be friendly enough, though we did not purchase any meals or drinks there because they are quite expensive. Go to the little store across the street for a cheap, good breakfast. This hotel is very busy with lots of conferences and conventions. The lobby is always bustling with people checking in and out, as well as walking around the shops (pricey) and music at the bar. We did not have any problems at check in or check out, though we did not have any charges to our room to take care of. We did the El Yunque rainforest tour from the hotel which was worth the $45 per person.You can walk to Condado but Old San Juan is more easily accessed by bus for .25. Another nice thing about the Caribe is the garden/bird sanctuary and the parrots in the lobby (Koko and Pancho). We had a few rainy moments and it was nice to go watch the peacocks and swans when we were not out at the pool. Very pretty scenery at this hotel. We would stay there again. Email me if you want any more info.  
<Date>Apr 25, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>A Nice Surprise I read many of the reviews of the Caribe Hilton, and was worried that I had made the wrong decision. When we arrived on April 11, 2004 and saw how beautiful the open air lobby and lounge were, I knew that everything would be just fine. The hotel pool and beach area are well manicured and very clean. The staff is unbelievably friendly and accomodating. The room was neat and clean. The view from our balcony was wonderful. The bathroom could have been a little more modern and needed a facelift but when you go on vacation do you really want to spend all that much time in your room and bathroom? (Stay home if the answer is yes). The restaruants were terriffic, fast friendly service with delicious well presented fresh foods. I would stay at the Caribe Hilton again....

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Request a Tower Room We just returned from a wonderful stay ay the Caribe Hilton. We got in late on a Saturday night, so our first room was not exactly what we expected. Like everyone else, we requested an ocean view, but we were put into the Garden wing on the fifth floor.The room itself was clean and comfortable, and it overloooked a lush garden with peacocks and swans. The sound of the coquis was magical. However, it also was right next to the construction site of their expansion and new casino. The next day, after several conversations with the front desk staff, who were all very helpful and friendly, we were moved to the 16th floor of the tower. This is the newest section, so the room was immaculate, the bathroom had a corner shower with a rainfall showerhead and a handheld one. Our room was always clean and neat when we returned from the pool. The pool, beach and health club are clean and beautiful. We were there during a busy week, but we never felt crowded at the pool...lots of lounge chairs and towels. There was no entertainment except for kareoke which was pretty lame, but up the street there is a piano bar with a talented singer named Roger. Go around the corner to the little deli for cheap good food. We enjoyed our vacation.  
<Date>Apr 10, 2004

<Author>catlover01
<Content>Loved the Caribe Hilton We stayed at the Caribe Hilton March 8-14  were very pleased. We had a great room on the 7th floor overlooking the pools, beach  ocean. We have traveled in Europe  the US  found the Caribe to be on a par with Hilton Hotels elsewhere. We appreciated check in  out in the Diamond Honors Lounge on the 9th floor, no waiting. The continental breakfast there was good  the food plentiful. We ate several meals at Palmeras, both buffet  off the menu, enjoyed the food. My 5 year old granddaughter ate free at the buffet. The pool snack bar  bar were very convienient for meals while at the pool or beach. The turn down service ensured we had dry towels after showers after the beach  pool. We had dinner one night at Mortons, I have eaten at Mortons in Phoenix,  the Caribe Mortons was just as nice  the food comparable. Reading the negative comments make me wonder if we were in the same hotel. Has anyone who was unhappy contacted Hilton corporate to voice their dissatifcation?  
<Date>Apr 6, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Worst hotel I have ever visited The first thing to note about this hotel is that it is not a tourist hotel. I assume that it functions principally as a business hotel (though I doubt it functions effectively at all). The reason that I am pointing out the misrepresentation in the classification is because we relied on the hotel's characterization as a resort when we made our vacation plans. I think the first clues to the low level of service at this hotel were the phone calls that I made prior to my arrival to find out about services and amenities. I am convinced that the hotel staff members moonlight as prison guards in a maximum security facility. Their responses range between rude and hostile. When we checked in, the front desk personnel didn't inform us of any of the hotel's offerings. She started to put us into a room in a lower category than what we reserved. If my wife hadn't specifically inquired, that would have been something that we would have had to correct after we got to our room. Even when we got our room (after the correction), it looked out over a building top that led to a big construction project. It would seem that you would reserve the lousy rooms for those times when you're straining against capacity. Now, on to the next issue: the food. I think the food and beverage staff must go dumpster diving at the other hotels to make their menus. The food was horrible! the couple of things that we ordered we inedible, and we had to give up any prospect of having decent food here. We did eat breakfast at the buffet, because it was included in our package. The buffet was the least cared-for presentation of food that I have seen in a long time. The shoddy restocking of the food items made the entire thing look like last call at a soup kitchen. And, if the poor food presentation wasn't enough to engender your displeasure, they also made sure that they didn't clean the tables between diners. Next issue: the room. Our room had this weird wood paneling that gave the effect of a low budget porno set. There was nothing appealing about the room at all. You could find a more appealing room in practically any budget hotel anywhere. I could go on and on, but you get the point...Don't ever stay here!!!! We checked out early and went to a completely different part of PR.  
<Date>Apr 5, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>A very nice place to stay I have read many mixed reviews on the Caribe Hilton and every experience is individual and subjective but our experience was great. The hotel was beautiful and the staff friendly and attentive. We were in a rennovated room so we did not experience the complaints about old and musty rooms. We had a beautiful view and the room was always spotless. A nice touch is early evening towel service. After a day at the beach and everyone taking showers the bathroom was a mess with wet towels hanging everywhere. It was nice to come back from dinner and find fresh towels and the bathroom cleaned.We visited several hotels while we were in San Juan and we felt the Caribe Hilton had the friendliest atmosphere. The private beach and beautiful pools really make for a great fun-in-the-sun time. I would recommend the Caribe Hilton to any of my friends visiting San Juan.A lot has been written about the cost of food at the Caribe Hilton but I feel the problem is not with the cost of the food but with unrealistic expectations of visitors. The food is no more expensive that what you would pay if you ate at a Hilton in Chicago, Dallas, LA or NY. If you eat at a top-tier hotel anywhere in the world it is going to cost you more due to their overhead. That is just the facts. I have read several complaints about the cost of Mortons. I wonder if the people complaining have ever eaten at a Mortons. I have eaten at one in Dallas and in Chicago and the prices are just about the same. If you eat at a premium steak house it is going to be expensive. Room service is the best deal. They give you a lot of food and the quality is very good. Once again it is not cheap but not out of line. People have to remember that they are staying at a resort Hilton and not at a Motel 6.All-in-all I would highly recommend the Caribe Hilton and if we visit San Juan again it is where I will stay.  
<Date>Apr 4, 2004

<Author>aem1975
<Content>Really Enjoyed the Hilton! My boyfriend and I recently spent 4 nights at the Caribe Hilton and really enjoyed the resort. The grounds were beautiful and well kept and everyone who worked there was friendly. While the beach has some sort of reef (way off shore) that prevents waves from hitting the shore, the water is warm, clear and refreshing. The huge pool area with its swim-up bar was perfect, especially with the view of the Atlantic right behind it. Also, the outside restaurant, Atlantis, was great for lunch and snacks. The other restaurants were overpriced but we prefered to eat away from the hotel anyway. At night, the bar inside had entertainment and dancing; nice to relax before or after dinner in Old San Juan. OSJ is less then 10 minutes from the Hilton and is about a $7-8 cab fare. Lastly, our room was clean and good-sized, with a view of the ocean. We enjoyed the little patio off our room as well. All in all, given the hotel's proximity to OSJ, its beautiful landscape and its catering to ultimate relaxation, we would stay there again.  
<Date>Apr 2, 2004

<Author>awaintroob
<Content>Enjoyed the Caribe Hilton We stayed at the Caribe Hilton on March 19 and 20. It has a lot of pluses--nice little beach, lovely swimming pool and large comfortable rooms. My kids loved the game room. It's a healthy hike to Old San Juan, but it's a beautiful walk along the ocean. Some problems--one of the two tower elevators gave out while we were there and the water went off on our last day. But on the whole we enjoyed the stay and would recommend the Caribe Hilton to anyone who wants to stay in San Juan.

<Author>sara95
<Content>Terrible: The worst Hilton and definitely the worst hotel in this price range My husband and I were attending a professional conference in San Juan in March 15-19, 2004 and the conference was in Hilton. Before leaving, I had read the overwhelmingly negative reviews, but this was our first time in San Juan and we were not sure whether we would be comfortable commuting between Hilton and other hotels on the island, given the island's crime rate. That was a huge mistake, this hotel should'nt be a Hilton or be rated as a Deluxe or 4 star property. The rooms were moldy, with dirty carpets, dirty walls and an awful bathroom which ran the danger of overflowing anytime. Our room was in the garden wing, when at first we complained the guy at the front desk Dominic, told us very rudely that since we only paid $179 the deluxe rooms were not available to us. This was the conference rate and never said anything about inferior rooms, and we later found out that quite a few people attending the same conference and paying the same rate had rooms in the tower. After repeated complains, on our third day Greten at the front desk gave us another room with much better view in the main bldg but that was smaller and even more moldy. The front desk was extremelt rude and unfriendly and we got the worst behavior because we resembled the island look. My son has asthma and the moldy room was bothering him so much that we spent most of our time outdoors but repeated requests didnt get us a renovated room. It was nothing but an overpriced junk. I should have known better, from the reviews here, and also from my experience with other Hiltons, they are rude and noncooperative whereas others like Embassy suites in their group are so much better in trying to help you. I understand that sometimes it is not possible to switch you but two years back when we faced this king of situation in a Doubletree in Seattle with the carpet moldy and all, they shampood the carpet and sprayed the room, didnt solve the problem entirely but their effort was noteworthy. My recommendation will be to stay at Marriott in the condado area. Also that sandpit that they called a beach is disgraceful. I dont know how they can call themselves a resort....it's nothing like the Hilton Hawaiian Villages which are resorts, a few peacocks and swans sont make a n old unclean property a resort. My suggestion to the Managerment would be to take a trip to Riviera Maya and see some ot the true resorts.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great time!!! I stayed at Caribe Hilton from 03/22/04 to 03/37/04 it was my spring break trip with my boyfriend. I purchased the trip on Hotwire for $687 per person for flight and hotel from Chicago. I ended up spending about $1,100 per person because the food was so expensiveI thought it was a great deal and I didn't get treated worse or got a worse room then anyone else that payed full price. My room was 762 and it wasn't bad at all. The staff at the front desk, Mortons stake house, bar and grill place were very nice. The staff at the Ilatian and Spanish restaurant were ok not kind just seemed boring. The food is over priced. Do not go to Mortons steak house unless you are willing to spend about $90 for two people to eat dinner. Save money and go to the grill by the pool or to the Palmeras restaurant. This hotel loves to charge people for everything so be careful because I was charged for consuming drinks and food that are in the room when I didn't even touch the stuff. But when I told them about it they kindly took the charges off. Also if you want to buy something to drink or some chips to eat go to this little store that is right outside the hotel they sell suff for about half the price the hotel sells it for. The pool and the beach are very nice. The room was a little worn like other reviews said but I didn't care because I was never in the room and the only time I was I was sleeping. They offer snorkeling trips at the hotel I recomend going on the east wind which was $73pp and the cheapest one offered it was a lot of fun. They also have two parrets by the name of Koko and Pancho. Koko loves girls and is a sweaty, Pancho is a thief and will steal or break your watch if your wearing one. He broke mine and bit me. I had a great time and would go back someday.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Wouldn't Stay There Again I didn't believe the bad reviews until I stayed there. The hotel itself wasn't in bad shape. I would say it was pretty average. Our room wasn't ready when we arrived 3 hours after check-in time. The people who came along with us didn't even have a room even though we reserved our rooms at the same time. There was a view of the ocean, but also the neighboring construction. The hotel was secluded from the main strip by about a 20 minute walk. The staff at the front desk were unfriendly and unhelpful. The pool and beach area was beautiful however. And most restaurant staff we encountered were friendly and the food was good. We came in to a small lizard in our room one night. The balcony door was stuck. Overall, I was disappointed and would not stay there again.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member

<Author>L0veAruba
<Content>Not a Four Star Hotel If you go to the Caribe Hilton expecting a 4 star hotel, you are going to be dissapointed. We were there the night of 3/14/2004. We arrived early from our cruise, I understand that the room was not ready. We got our room slightly afternoon, OK, but we requested a king and got two doubles. The room was on the 4th floor of the main building. The view was questionalbe, but liveable, but the room was run down, shabby. The main door looked like it had been torn down and nailed back together, the bath...old and dated, the furniture looked old and used hard. I requested another room, was given a room in the garden building, 5th floor, same beds set up, and other than the view the same run down shabby room, with the exception this time the AC did not work the humidity in the room was 100%, the toilet did not flush correctly and even the coffee pot was broken. We were too tired to keep dragging all of our stuff around so we just took what we got. The staff kept on telling us that they were too full to make any changes. The Honors club looks like it is an afterthought. Tucked away on a second floor alcove. The one lady there had trouble keeping even the bare minimums stocked. Let alone keeping the three tables clear. It was poorly staffed and did not seem clean. I do give them credit for maintaining their grounds nicely. The food at the pool was overpriced, $5.50 for a coors!! I would rate this hotel as a 2 star at best. Hampton Inns put this Hilton to shame.  
<Date>Mar 16, 2004

<Author>Prodigal_Hoosier
<Content>Loved the Caribe Hilton Just returned from four great days at the Caribe Hilton. After reading some of the reviews here we were concerned, but all the trepidation was unwarranted. The facility is not brand new, but the pools and beach are fantastic. As are the on-site restaurants. There isn't much withing walking distance, but a taxi to Old San Juan is just $7 and well worth the trip--local flavor restaurants as well as Pizza Hut, Burger King, Subway, KFC, etc. If you are going to San Juan and want to sit on a clean, private beach (we had no trouble getting all the space we wanted on the Hilton's beach) or to relax in the sun by the pools, I can't imagine there is a better place in San Juan. The staff was very friendly and helpful, and our room was ready at 3:00. We will go back.  
<Date>Mar 16, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Disappointing We stayed at the Caribe Hilton for one night en route to the Virgin Islands for our honeymoon (June 2003). We redeemed Hilton HHonors points, so we got the room for free. It was my understanding that the normal rate was $200 per night, and I would have been very upset had I paid that much for the room. The view was great, but the room was run-down and dumpy, and kind of depressing. I am normally not very picky about hotels--the Hampton Inn is typically fine with me. But our room at the Caribe Hilton was very disappointing (and on the first night of our honeymoon, no less!) The hotel's redeeming quality is its pool and lobby. The pool and grounds are well-kept, and the beach is beautiful. There's a neat swim-up bar, and the lobby has big exotic birds. I guess I'm glad we went, but frankly San Juan was a disappointment as well. It is a poor, run down town. I've heard that the resorts and the Old Town area are nice, but from the airport to the Caribe Hilton, we didn't really see anything nice and were really glad to leave. Bottom line--don't pay more than $100 per night for this hotel, and if you do go, plan to spend most of your time at the pool.  
<Date>Mar 12, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Fantastic Stay My wife and I just returned from our weekend at the Caribe. Excellent place to stay. My wife is a Hilton Diamond Member and we stayed on the conceirge floor. I almost forgot, we were pleasantly surprised to receive a welcoming bottle of champagne and chocolates. I don't know where all these cry babies stayed, but for us....we'll definitely go back.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Never Again!!! This hotel was horrible. We stayed one night after we came back from a cruise. The hotel is in very poor condition. We got a room at what is supposed to be a bargain, $150/night. Where is others have paid up to $300. The room was old and dirty. The shower and bathroom area had rust, dirt and mildew (would not step in side with my bare feet). It looked like it was not cleaned for months. A basic Motel would be nicer and cleaner then this 4 star hotel. The walls and carpet had numerous stains. The closet door was broken. The view of the room was on constructions site and a huge crane. We took pics of all these and other problems on our digital camera and brought it down to the manager. He claimed to be shocked and asked This is taken in this hotel?. We were given another room, but it wasn't much better.The hotel services were not good as well. The service at the restaurants was not good/friendly, and the food was terrible. Show me another restaurant in US that does not have salad dressing for the salads on the menu. The room service food was better then the two restaurants we tried in the hotel. And even that was a problem. The room service took 1 hour and 15 min. to bring us food and after all that wait they brought us coffee and tea w/o sugar.Never Again!!!

<Author>Hotelcritique
<Content>We got what we paid for! We stayed at the Caribe Hilton pre cruise and friends of ours stayed both pre and post cruise. We both got the room on Priceline for $69.Having heard rumors of ill treatment with Priceline visitors, I wrote the Caribe a letter. They replied stating that we would have the very best room possible.When we arrived, we had a heck of a time registering (our friends had none). We gave our name to the check-in clerk and he kept insisting that we had ALEADY checked in the hotel. We argued, showed them our confirmation, my letter, etc. The clerk would just keep saying why are you checking in again, you already checked this morning? After about 20 minutes of this, we were finally given the key to our OCEAN FRONT room (our friends were to be just above us).Just upstairs from the lobby, we open the door to our beautiful room and...there are two adults in our bed! Boy, were we ever embarrassed and so were they!Back down to the lobby where we waited another 20 minutes to figure out the problem. No explaination, no apologies! We were then given a room in the tower (a Priceline room this time) near the construction. Our key would not work...back to the desk to get another...the second key doesn't work...a maintenance man let us in the room.We later found out that the couple in our original room had a similar last name to ours and they were given the wrong room. We checked our bill very carefully before we left. We were also afraid that the other couple might get some of our charges.Although the new room was nice and spacious, it was a little dated and miles apart from our friends as well as everything else. There was construction going on in the room above us that didn't stop until 7:30 that night.We did enjoy the grounds, beautiful view and pool area. Morton's Steakhouse was great but way over priced. The portions were also too big. My husband and I shared a small steak and got one side each. Along with the wonderful bread and a salad, we couldn't eat our entire dinner. Split your meal if you dine there.Not too crazy about the surrounding night life. We tried to find the store that has been mentioned for buying alcohol and it was a very scary adventure. We waited until Sunday morning to venture out again.Our friends had great difficulty when they tried to check back into the Caribe after the cruise. They were told the rooms were not ready. After 3:00, they were still not ready. Our friends said that dozens of people were waiting in the open air lobby (during a horrific thunderstorm) for their rooms as well. Finally, at 4:30 they were given a room. It was a horrible room, but they were too tired to argue.For the value of $69 a night, I guess we got what we paid for. I am not sure that I would try them again, however.  
<Date>Feb 19, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>excellent stay Excellent stay Feb. 1-11,2004, at the San Juan Caribe Hilton. Our meals at Morton's of Chicago at the Caribe were exquisite. We were in the garden wing - adjacent to constrution site, but were not disturbed at all - never awakened - I think you'd have to be a VERY light sleeper! Room fine - A/C excellent - we turned it down most often - was too cold! Desk service, poolside service, tour service (I went deep-sea fishing one day) - all up to par - no complaints at all. If you ever thought of going deep sea fishing, be sure to take an anti-motion sickness medication - Dramamine worked for me, thank God, and it was a very rough day (high seas) - anyhow, caught 3 Mahi-Mahi - a lot of fun. Yes, Hilton is expensive - but service and ambience well woth it - you get what you pay for - and you do have to pay a lot. That being said, absolutely no complaints - great time (and great tans!) had by all!  
<Date>Feb 15, 2004
