<Author>SueC0001
<Content>Not worth anything near rack rates We stayed at this hotel on January 22 pre-cruise. Got the room for $108 on Priceline. For that price, it was acceptable. The best rate I could find at the time for this hotel on non-auction discount booking websites was $300+. Man, would I have been livid had I paid anywhere near that. Our room, while adequate, was more suited to the lower-end Hilton brands than it was to a Hilton resort. Our room was dingy. Not dirty, just old and worn. Most disconcerting was the mold in the bathroom. Apparently there had been a leak in the wall which allowed mold to grow under the paint. The previous poster must have gotten an upgraded room at the Caribe Hilton, because I stayed at the Wyndham El San Juan several years ago, and that room was FAR superior to my room at the Caribe Hilton. Really the only thing the Hilton had going for it was the pool. It was beautiful. It rivaled the El San Juan's pool. Everything else about the Caribe Hilton was far inferior to the El San Juan-the location, the shops, the spa, the restaurants (which were comparably priced). The construction going on at the hotel was an inconvenience as well. Priceline includes this hotel in the same category as the El San Juan and Intercontinental, and it definitely is not in their league.  
<Date>Feb 3, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>We loved it... My husband and I stayed here after a cruise on the Destiny. Immediately leaving the port, we went to the hotel and were able to check in at about 10:30 am. I got this room on Hotwire for $103 and fortunately, we got a room on the 8th floor. Everyone was friendly and unlike other reviews, our room was great. We were at the Wyndham El San Juan, precruise, and this room was better hands down. The view was spectacular. My husband was in love with it. We also enjoyed the executive lounge on the 9th floor. The pool and beach area can't be beat. The main downfall from my point of view was location. The hotel offers a lot on its property, but if you want to venture out, it's going to be at least a $6 taxi ride to go shopping or out to eat. That is, unless you choose to walk across the highway and bridge...

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Just came back from a 4 night stay My husband and I just came back from a 4 night stay at teh Caribe Hilton. We stayed at the hotel as part of an air/hotel package. I would not choose to stay at the hotel again. The front desk was staff was friendly enough, and our check-in was prompt even though we arrived before 3:00 PM. However, the deluxe ocean view room we payed fro was neither deluxe nor did it have a great ocean view. We mostly overlooked construction. The room furnishings were blah, the bed sheets had holes, and the bathroom had several problems. For instance, the bath drain didn't work, the shower door creaked loudly, and the water ran extremely hot and cold while in use. If someone in the next room decides to flush while you are showering, beware!

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Not a good choice for Hilton HHonors Members As a frequent Hilton guest, I can attest to some of the negative reviews this property gets. I try to balance my stays at hotels with a comparison of good vs. bad. Unfortunately, Caribe Hilton always has come up in the bad range.Good: Great pool, nice beach, very nice fitness center (I am not sure if they charge extra for this, I uses it for free), very nice staff (in the VIP lounge and floors), adequate room service food, great room service staff, reasonable self parking fees for the area, very close to Old San Juan, located in a great area to jog around.Bad: Rooms are old, dated, musty, in need of renovation, bathrooms are in very bad shape, a/c units don t work properly, maintenance staff is non-responsive (I am still waiting for them to repair a non-functioning safe and too-cold a/c unit, maybe by my next trip) VIP lounge is usually crowded and low on food (since its open to everybody, including small children, staying in their executive level floors, not just to Hilton HHonors top tier members), parking garage is thigh for anything larger than a Toyota Camry and some times full so you have to park in a paved lot by the construction area (don't wash your car, its going to get dirty!), there is construction going on next door and you WILL be waken up at 7:00 am by their cacophony of sounds, restaurants are not very good (eat somewhere off property), downstairs reception staff are not very nice.Overall: Not too good. If you must stay in a Hilton property in San Juan, try the Hampton Inn or the Embassy Suites.  
<Date>Jan 17, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>What a DUMP!!  We spent 5 nights in the Caribe Hilton over the Christmas holiday after returning from a cruise. We had 4 rooms, and without exception they were disgusting. On the first night we were not allowed to check in to all of our rooms until after 6 pm . When we got in, they all smelled of mildew, all had mold, and 2 had plaster falling from the bathroom ceilings. In fact one room had a worker replastering the ceiling when we walked in. I too spoke with the manager who was COMPLETELY indifferent, not even polite. Our partial ocean view was also of a roof and AC units. Rooms routinely were not made up until after 5pm. {now I know why you cant check in at a reasonable hour} 2 of us actually upgraded to a renovated room on a higher floor for $25 {nothing is free at the Caribe} All renovated meant was the bathroom was redone {no plaster falling} same nasty moldy carpet etc. They say meals are free for kids under 5 and 50% 5-12, dont believe it. One day the waiter said only when Adults order buffet {$20 for breakfast} Next day they said only from the Childrens menu, next day when we asked for Childrens Menu, they said they dont have a childrens menu. One night our family of 10 went fo their Mexican Fajita Buffet, advertised on a big poster in the window $19 per person. When the bill came, it was at $25 per person. I went back to the poster, and they had actually taped over the $19 anded pasted a card over it that said $25!! Oh well, you get the idea...... STAY AWAY!

<Author>trexgreeley
<Content>Loved Peaceful Caribe Just got back from spending 5 nights during New Year's at the Caribe Hilton. A very nice hotel and not bad for the money. Great view of the ocean from the balconey even if the ballroom roof was under the balconey. You could see the waves beautifully breaking on the reefs. Pool and PRIVATE BEACH are excellent. Such a peaceful place to relax  wind down from life in the fast lane. It seems as if people writing reviews forget this is the Carribean  Puerto Rico were life is slow, sometimes slummy and definitely not like living in the USA. Restaurants are pricey. You can get the exact same food from room service for much less in price. Morton's of Chicago had the beat steak I think I have ever tasted. WHAT A WONDERFUL EXPERIENCE AT THE CARIBE HILTON!!!!!!!  
<Date>Jan 8, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Just Back The Caribe Hilton is a decent hotel. Although I would not pay the $350 per night room charge. I would pay under $200. The grounds are beautiful and the staff is great. The bartenders(William and Efrain) in the lobby bar a great. The hotel guests on the other hand are rude. A very snobby cliental come to this hotel(if you know what I mean). They are the type of people that are pushy and rude to the staff. They expect everyone to drop everything for them. The room is clean, but not a $350 a night room. We stayed at the Ritz last year and it was cheaper. They hit you with a resort fee at the end, plus tax. The resort fee is Hiltons tax. Check your bill, because they also charge you a dollar a day to donate to some kids charity(we told Hilton to take it off). Hilton should donate their own money to charity and stop hitting up their guests. Another problem was that it was crowded. I had to get up at 6:30am to get chairs by the pool. We ate a Morton s the first night which was great, but very expensive. The other restaurants at the hotel are just alright. Go out to eat instead. Free food in the lobby bar around 5:30pm. Executive level is ok, but not worth extra money. Save on buying drinks and food at the pool by going across the street to deli and liquor store. Good sandwiches and cheaper bottles of booze. All in all it was a great vacation. Would go back if I could find a low rate.  
<Date>Jan 5, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Wish I was still there I just came back from a wonderful stay at the Caribe Hilton in beautiful San Juan. The hotel was beautiful! Private beach, pool, swim-up bar...it had the works! The room was in great conditions and the sound of the ocean and coquis (the famous Puerto Rico frog) from the balcony, was just incredible and beautiful! For those of you who like to walk, it's just a 30 min. walk from the hotel to Old San Juan. If not, a cab charges you from $6 - $8. But you should definitely visit Old San Juan. There are many places to shop, eat and visit. There is even a Marshall's and Walgreen's, which was very convenient for us. Walgreen's has a One Hour Photo service, which was also very convenient for us:) The places I would suggest you visit is El Morro, which is only $3 to get in, La Fortaleza and Parque de las Palomas (Park of the Birds). There are a few more places, but I can't remember. Also, if you are looking for some traditional Puerto Rican food, I recommend El Jibarito restaurant. It's right in Old San Juan. I don't remember the street it is on, but all you have to do is ask someone and I'm pretty sure they will lead you to it. People in Puerto Rico are so friendly and helpful. The concierge at the Caribe Hilton was so helpful. We asked about places to go dancing or just hang out and have some drinks, and he gave us a list of places to go to for everyday of the week that we were there:) I can say that the most we waisted money on, was cab fare. But, there are to car rental places right on the premises. Other than that, we had a great time and we have plans of going there again next year:)  
<Date>Dec 30, 2003

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Very Disappointed After much searching for an inexpensive honeymoon due to job loss we picked the Caribe Hilton and much to our displeasure. We booked a non-smoking, king deluxe oceanview room and we got a smoking room over looking a constuction site, the roof of the building below with the ocean in the far distance. Instead of hearing oceanwaves we heard the crane every morning at 8. I complained to the front desk as soon as we checked in and was told there was nothing available until the next day. The next day we got nothing but the runaround and they showed us a room that was worse then the one we had. We showed them the paper worked that this was a honeymoon and got nothing. If you are not a businessman or coming with a group this is not the place to be. And judging from all the complaints we heard from other couples in the hotel I guess we were not the only ones that were treated this way. The breakfast buffet was the best thing about the whole package. The conceirge was extremely helpful in finding us local places to eat good spanish food and not sticking us with the hotel restaurants which we did try once and regretted it. The service was horrible and the minimal amount of food you got for the cost was ridiculous. The hotel itself was nice but the staff leaves alot to be desired.

<Author>CubbieBear
<Content>Enjoyable Stay in the Sun I stayed at the Caribe Hilton in Marsh 2003 with a few friends. We enjoyed our stay at the hotel and found the room and hotel to be clean. Make sure your rate includes the breakfast buffet as it was great and then you don't need to get an $8 burger at lunch. The beach area is small and man-made but clean and private, perfect for kids. We took advantage of the yoga class and the gym. The hotel is a short cab ride from Old San Juan. In terms of restaurants there is something to please everyone, though none are cheap. Check out luxurylink.com for good deals at this hotel. I would stay here again on another trip to the island, provided I found another internet deal.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great Deal thru Priceline I have never paid $65/night for a hotel before. Thanks to Priceline, I was able to book this hotel @ such a great price. Not only that, they had upgraded me to the club level. The hotel was empty at first but by the end of the week it filled up. The pools are great, but I happened to notice with the sunlight, that the pool was quite dirty. Another drawback is that there is no longer a casino, if you don't have a car, you have to hike 15 - 20 minutes each way to Condado or take a cab $10 each way. Very relaxing and suggest to book thru priceline, or Hotwire. Chances are it will be this hotel @ 4****stars, or a resort. Hilton HHonors members still get a continental breakfast for free on the second floor. The staff was great except for the Bell boys, and Valet. When I arrived, and I had seen they did not come up to take my luggage, I asked them to and they acted stupid, until I reported it to the front desk manager, which is nearby. Also, at 6:00 by the bar and the second floor, they both offer cocktails, and on the second floor drinks, and cocktails, all free. I reccomend this hotel if you do not want to spend $200 + on the Ritz, or El San Juan. I have stayed a the Ritz, before finding Hotwire or Priceline, and I feel that it is to stuffy for a young person. If you can get The Water Club, the Intercontinental, Ritz, or El San Juan at around the same price, stay at one of those, if not stay at the caribe.

<Author>nycvillage
<Content>Worth the Trip There is a certain charm to staying at a classic hotel witth so much history. Granted you can't see too much of it because of the renovations, but this is a fine hotel in an excellent location. Perfectly located for the beach, Old San Juan, and the Condado, it's probably the best placed hotel in the area. The rooms are well maintained and appropriately appointed. Service is what you would expect in a large Hilton. Don't expect personalized service like you would get in a boutique hotel, but that's not the Caribe Hilton. It you're looking for a beach/city vacation - it's a great choice.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Not an ideal pit stop If I had to stay again in Puerto Rico, I would not recommend this hotel. On the surface, it is nice, clean, and well-maintained. However, compared to other Hiltons I have stayed at (and there have been a lot, I travel frequently), the outside does not match the inside! The hotel staff is not overly friendly - we had an issue when I was checking in - the staff lost some paperwork and could not process my check in. The bartenders are okay, but don't look for strong drinks! The concierge was less than helpful for a woman traveling by herself on business. I will say that the waiters in the restaurants were by far the friendliest and most outgoing staff around.The rooms are okay - I had an ocean view as I was promised, but it was over the bulk of the hotel. Instead of hearing waves, I heard the nice hum of the air conditioner. The showers need to be majorly upgraded - barely any water pressure.If you are looking at a hotel for honeymooning or pleasure travel, keep going. Everything is a cab ride away, there is nothing within walking distance, and the hotel restaurants are too expensive for what they offer. The beach is nice, but there are other places to stay in Puerto Rico for beaches - this isn't one of them.Of all the hiltons I have stayed at, I will honestly say that this was the worst experience that I have had a hotel - there is no excuse for a desk staff to be as inept as they were, and by judging the amount of problems other visitors have faced, if you don't want a hassle, don't stay here.  
<Date>Nov 7, 2003

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>'Hilton' should get their name off of this one! Just returned from 5 nights @ the Caribe Hilton. Problems started upon check-in. After having made reservations six months in advance, we were told no King rooms were available because there weren't cleaned yet. (It was 4:00 pm). When asked how much longer it would be, the desk clerk told us he could not say. He sent us to look @ a Handicapped King room, but after lugging 4 suiitcases to preview the room, it was a Standard bed, not King. We then went back to the desk clerk-told him No and were then told a King room was now available in the Tower Bldg. The decor  paint in this room has not been touched since the early 80's. Lots of construction going on outside the hotel and rhey start @ 7:00 am sharp each morning! Out of 5 nights, I had to call for washcloths 4. (They brought 2 for 2 people bathing twice a day). The pool area is the best thing about his place. The restaurants @ the Caribe are expensive. This hotel offers little more than swimming during the day, (pools are closed @ night), and drinking. Yet their prices reflect a primo charge which should include alot more services and choices for their guests.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Buyer Beware The Caribe Hilton is a mixed bag, I have stayed there 3 times. I love the calm beach and the cafe for breakfast. I don't mind spending 20 bucks a day for a great breakfast, (it really is awsome!) when Im vacationing (if you cant afford to splurge a little stay home, you can pay 250- for the room then run around looking for a 3- bagle and coffee) The rooms are expensive for the condition they are in, if not a complete rip off. I first stayed there in 1987 and they were very nice then. The longer short building is the older one, rooms are like closets and light fixtures don't work, mattresses are very old like wood boards, I had back pain and couldnt sleep. The tacky paneling has to go!I was told the two beds were queen size and they turned out to be doubles. Bait and switch or bait and LieThe loction is ideal if you rent a car. The Spa looks nice new restaurants etc. The Front desk changed our room which was awful, the second one overlooked the air fan of the restaurant. I was planning to go back this November but It dosnt seem to have gotten any better from the reviews. Despie The construction, the sound of sawblades while trying to relax on the beach. I don't think so, especially at those prices.I wouldnt mind spending the money but the hotel needs alot of TLC to get to an acceptable level.

<Author>ny7chic
<Content>Both good and bad aspects of this hotel My boyfriend and I went to the Caribe Hilton for 4 nights this August. There were some good parts and bad parts about this hotel and the San Juan area that people planning a trip there should be aware of. The best part of the entire trip was that all of Team USA (NBA) was staying at this hotel as well as all of the other basketball teams from other countries. We met some players!  Our vacation started off by the front desk telling us there weren't any queen bed ocean view rooms available, despite our voucher stating that was the type of room we were guaranteed. They made us a deal that if we stayed in a Parlor Room (with a sofabed), we would have access to the Executive Suite for our entire stay. The Executive Suite was a room that served drinks and snacks during certain times. Trust me, the trade off wasn't worth it! Besides that incident, everything else was pretty good.  The hotel itself was nice, the pool area was pretty and so was the lobby/bar area. The beach area was just so- so. I've been to several other places in the Caribbean, Hawaii, and Mexico with nicer beaches. The sand was rough, and you couldn't swim too far in the ocean because of huge rocks. After seeing the beach area near other hotels, (El San Juan, Intercontinental) I was a bit upset at the condition of the Hilton's beach. If you are a big dancer, don't expect this hotel to cater to you. We went to a club at the El San Juan instead. Nightlife in San Juan wasn't the best!  The breakfast buffet was good, but that was the only meal we ate there. As far the the hotel's location, I wasn't too impressed. Every time we wanted to go to other hotels, it was a $16.00 cab ride each way! The proximity to Old San Juan was great though.  If you want to come to a hotel, hangout by the beach/pool, and eat all of your meals in once place, the Caribe Hilton would be a good choice. But if you want to be able to explore other areas and take advantage of the nightlife, be prepared to pay big in taxi fees.  
<Date>Oct 25, 2003

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>I loved it! We stayed for a long weekend last February and loved it. 1.) The room was not fancy, but it was just fine with us. It was roomy. We had a great water view, king bed  balcony. 2.) The buffet breakfast was great. It was a great spread, with lots of fresh fruit and other goodies. 3.) The messages at their spa were the best. I had two and both were done the same way. I could tell they trained thier staff well, unlike some other hotels. 4.) The beach was private, nice and clean. 5.) They had entertainment at night - a small combo band. We checked out some of the other hotels around and we were glad we stayed where we did. Some of the other places had littered beaches, freezing cold lobbies attached to smokey casinos, and loud airplane noise. Yes, it is a bit pricey, but we thought it was worth it for a long weekend. A good value overall.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Absoulutely the Best buy for the money! This was our first time to Puerto Rico, and really researched many travel books and articles. I also read many of the reviews about the Caribe Hilton, so I know that everyone has different expectations and opinions. I have lived in the Bahamas for years and am aware what humidity and caribbean weather and customs are like. We found the Caribe Hilton to be wonderful!!The check-in personnel was smiling and made us feel welcome after a long flight. We stayed in the tower and had a fabulous view. If there was an oversight of needing towels, we only had to pick up the phone, and it was brought immediately. The open atrium, with the ocean view was beautiful and inviting. The bar downstairs has the best bartenders, best drinks, live entertainment, and hospitality! The tour desk, set up tours and was very accurate and detail oriented about each tour. I suggest the Spread Eagle snorkel tour.....everything from the 51'FT. Catamaran (new) to the food, drinks,and crew were the best! Very proffessional! The concierge desk made some of the best suggestions..where to go, how to go, what their specialty was, who to ask for. He even called ahead for us too! 25 cents to take a bus (new and airconditioned) into Old San Juan, for shopping sightseeing. He gave us maps and circled places to visit. I find if you treat people with kindness and with a smile you just might get the same in return!! Try it in your travels, you may be surprised!!  
<Date>Oct 16, 2003

<Author>Chplhill
<Content>Great architecture...but check Priceline This is a very nice luxury hotel...what you would expect from Hilton...through Priceline, I got a room for $75 a night. Parking is another $10. If you stay, stay in the old section of the hotel. This is the portion right above the lobby and all of the rooms there have ocean views.If you love wacky late 40's early 50's modern architecture, you will love this place. Huge open air lobby, weird curves everywhere, and really interesting 50's modern looking furniture everywhere. Incredible.This place is a little far from Old San Juan. If you want to go to OSJ, it will cost you about $10 in cab fare. However, get the concierge to tell you where the bus stop is. It will cost you .50 in bus fare to get to Old San Juan.Also, this place is right across the bridge from Condado. While overall this is a safe area, I would not walk the bridge at night because it is a very long bridge and there is some construction going on.Next, the restaurants in here are EXPENSIVE. For breakfast, you will see a little corner restaurant right when you drive into the hotel property, about 100 yds. or less from the main lobby. Go over there. You can get a great $3 breakfast v. $22 in the hotel.If you are there, look at going over to the Hotel Normandie next door. Fantastic 30s art deco hotel that has been fully restored.Last note....one of the best pools I have been in at any hotel. Multi layered, fountains, waterfalls, etc. Normally not into lounging in pools, but made an exception here.THERE IS NO CASINO! Nearest casino is about 1/2 to 1 mile away.Lots of good places to eat nearby. E mail me if you have any questions. Put something like Caribe Hilton in the opening, so I know it isn't spam.JEH  
<Date>Oct 7, 2003

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>IS WORTH A STAY We stayed nine days and had a great time. The beach and pool are both top notch. The water in the beach was calm as it is protected from the high Atlantic surf. <Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Not worth the money My husband and I stayed at the Caribe Hilton for our honeymoon this summer. The only people that smiled at us were the housekeepers. The front desk was rude and not helpful. We also had a lot of additional things tacked onto our bill that we didn't use and were not told about. We ordered ice cream through room service one night and it took 1 hour to get it. I tried to talk to someone about how rude everyone was being and how poor the service was, but all the guy at the front desk said was oh. The rooms were also dated and we never had cold water. We had to brush our teeth with hot water. We plan on going back to Puerto Rico, but we will not stay at the Caribe Hilton or at any Hilton again. We were very disappointed.

<Author>AuthorHammond
<Content>Caribe Hilton Deluxe Room Not So Upon our arrival at the Caribe Hilton two hours after its 3:00 p.m. check-in time, we learned that our room would not be ready for at least another hour. We left our bags with the bellman, and, because the front desk has no safe in which to put our cash and travel docuemnts, we remained nearby, given the Condado area's justifiable criminal reputation.After we finally go our keys, we pick up our unattended bags, as anyone else could have, and went to our deluxe ocean view room. Its carpet was stained and burned; the walls were scuffed; adn the shower and vanity faucets needed repair.In addition, the safe was locked. It was finally opened after another two hours, but our chance to explore the area safely had been lost for the night. Despite a detailed note to the general manager the following morning, in the same and detail as this one, I got no response whatsoever (not even a We hope to serve you better in the future). The stains remained, and the plumbing malfunctioned throughout our stay.Future guests are well advised to check their bills carefully: Several unauthorized and incorrect charges appeared on ours.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Nice place, friendly staff Just came back on the 16th of August after 8 days in sunny Puerto Rico. We stayed at the Caribe Hilton in San Juan. The facilities and grounds were very nice, the family enjoyed the large pool and the small private beach area very much. Being a family of four on a budget, we found their restaurants there to be expensive though, and chose to venture out on our own for our meals. There are a couple small typical Puerto Rican cafes within a block walk that were good for breakfast ( bacon, eggs, toast and coffee for about $4), and most days we walked over the bridge to the Condado area for dinner. There is also a Sizzler steakhouse within walking distance that was excellent and very reasonable. The closest casino is at the Wyndham Condado Plaza, again a little walk over the Condado Lagoon bridge (about 20 minutes on foot). We found the Hilton staff to be very pleasant and helpful and had no problems whatsoever, other than about an hour or so wait for our room to get ready at check-in. The biggest downside to staying at the Hilton was the distance from any other hotels, restaurants, etc. if you don't mind walking or waiting for a bus or just want a quiet day at the pool its a great place to stay. We did rent a car from Charlie's for three days (highly recommend them, excellent service and prices) and explored the Island a little- drove to the rainforest, Luquillo beach (great place!) and even took a ride to the southern shore and swam in a deserted public beach near Arroyo ( Balneario Punta Guilarte)- we were the only ones there! Driving around San Juan is a real adventure, though- I think all one million people that live there have a car. Overall, a great place with friendly people and beautiful natural resources.  
<Date>Aug 19, 2003

<Content>I think I spent too much...? Stayed there in April in part because of some of the reviews I read on this website. Overall it's ok but DO NOT expect to get the Hilton that they portray in their website. It is not at all like it. The pictures are very decieving! <Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>a great place to relax My husband and I planned a trip to Puerto Rico. Didn't know where to stay, etc. Our travel Agency in Paramus recommended the Caribe Hilton just a short ride to Old San Juan.We left on Continental air lines on July 13 and arrived safely to the beautiful warm weather after all the cold and horrible weather in New Jersey since November last year. We took a cab (they don't pick you up like in the other Islands) $16.00 to go to hotel.when we arrived at Caribe, the hotel is completely open (no doors etc) and just went in to register when we were given the 20th floor looking out at Construction views while we were suppose to have an ocean view, we paid for. we finally moved to the 11th floor overlooking part of the ocean and much of the street below, very disappointing for us.Dinners at Hotel are expensive. Cabs to and from town cost $7.00 or 8.00 one way, very expensive to travel around and most of the cab drivers do not speak English, so this is very difficult to communicate there. The beach is beautiful, warm water, lounges, pool, pool bar and 2 pools really neat but not heated like other resorts. Temp was 80's and very windy.We did go over to Bicardi Rum factory, you need to take a taxi to the ferry, and then wait over 1 hr. while they go back and forth plus go out for gas.silly things they do. I highly recommend this tour it is a great place to see and so beautiful and serene.(they tell you about buses) but we could not find any or you wait for ever and its too hot in the sun to stand and wait. They do not have any schedules, they come whenever, so that's a time waste.We went to other hotels to see them and try our luck at gambling, the casino's are very small not large at all.We went to native Puerto Rico's restaurents and they were great, treated us exceptionally nice.Shuttles in town take forever, you can walk faster than wait for them. Town is fun, very narrow streets and traffic moves only on one way streets there. the horse and buggy ride is very expensive there so walk, use the money for shopping.Breakfast daily at the Caribe was delightful. place sand food was great. people are also very very pleasant. Yes I would go back for another trip but would like to stay closer to Old San Juan. too expensive to do taxi's every day back and forth and to restaurents at night that you would like to eat at Fine dining.I suggest that this hotel get with the times, have a shuttle for guests to designated areas (they can well afford it) and also pick up folks at airport.Also I think they should have a welcoming drink for the guests when they arrive just to be hospitable.I am going to write the hotel with these ideas. what do you think???  
<Date>Jul 14, 2003

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Hilton beach is great QUE PASO?!! I can't say anything bad about the Caribe Hilton. We arrived late at night and check-in was fine. The double double garden room was fine, balcony overlooking the garden. The room was clean and had a mini-bar, which was a good place to put my store bought beer. The beach is great, quiet, easy lagoon with the breakers out beyond the jetty. We even watched a couple get married right there on the beach! The Olas spa has great food, I had the steak and cheese wrap - yummy. We did have to pay 10.00 for parking though. But at check-out when I disputed a 10.00 beverage charge, they simply removed it. OH YEAH, Warning, I had walked down the street to one of those local food joints the morning of check-out: 30 minutes to get a fried egg sandwich!!! Mostly, the local service in San Juan is severely lacking! A great night out is Saturday night at the El San Juan Hotel and Casino, where all the gorgeous people mingle in the lobby bar. Old San Juan is not dangerous the way the fodor's books makes it out to be. There are local cops everywhere. Took a nice walk around El Morro. Went to Senor Frog's - there was a cruise ship in, so it felt like stupid long island, but the place is fun. Coqui?!  
<Date>Jun 29, 2003

<Author>lans98
<Content>Our Experience at the Caribe Hilton 6/19-24/2003 I made the choice to stay at the Caribe Hilton by reading reviews as well as thoroughly researching this property. It was a tough decision whether to stay at the Wyndom or the Caribe Hilton, however the reviews written by other travellers was the deciding factor. First let me encourage you to go on hotel sites and read the comments made by those who have stayed there. Those comments can be very helpful. I found the hotel to be very nice and well kept up. The staff was helpful, with the exception of two gentlemen who happened to work at the Concierge's Desk. Please know I will be sharing my comments about their attitude with the Caribe Hilton Management Staff along with a suggestion that those two individuals receive more training in providing customer service if they are to continue in that type of a position. The rooms were nicely decorated with adequate space. The restaurant prices were extremely high and the food wasn't exceptional, espcially for the price. Although the hotel was full the majority of our stay, we never experienced any loud sounds---that says a lot about the quality of the facility. Unless you desire to stay in the heart of Old San Juan or San Juan, the Caribe Hilton is the place to stay, especially if you want a comfortable but stylish facility with very professional and courteous staff (with the exception of two gentlemen at the Concierge's Desk) The Health Spa-Fitness Center was excellent. The pool area was lovely and the grounds were very nice. My only two recommendations would be -Eat somewhere else so that you can enjoy more activities with your money, and wait for the shift to change if you find the staff (Eric and Jose) at the Concierge's desk unfriendly and not very helpful - believe me there are other staff who are excellent.  
<Date>Jun 25, 2003

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Agreed, OK But Not Great I got our room for $65 (priceline) a night and that was about what it was worth. Compared to the Hilton Resort on the Big Island of Hawaii this resort is second rate. I can't imagine anyone paying $200-$1000 a night to stay here. I travel a lot and am a Hilton Goldcard holder. Their complimentary Hilton Honors member's lounge with continental breakfast and afternoon snacks is a joke. I usually see better at a Hampton Inn. The rooms were just standard rooms but with mold, missing paint, burnt out light bulbs, clock not set, broken sink plugs, ants in bathroom, fridge didn't work, pool was dirty, and the directions for the room safe were so worn you couldn't read them. I expect much better from a Hilton, although I was told that this was a nice hotel for the carribean area. Having said all that, the staff was, courteous and helpful, the food was excellent, but pricey, and Puerto Rico was fabulous. Rent a car from Charlie car rental about $30 a day, take a catarmaran snorkeling trip ($55) and visit the rain forest (awesome.) Old San Juan is typical tourist shops and some good restuarants. If I was to go back I would stay in the Embassy Suites or near Condado area, a nice place to walk, shop, and eat. If you want nice beaches get away from San Juan, visit Culebra or one of the other smaller islands. Great place, overpriced hotel.  
<Date>Jun 14, 2003

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Everything butt the... I stayed at the Caribe for a week this past spring and absolutely loved it. The Concierge, Eric, is fabulous, friendly and knowledgeable. He sent my travelling companinon and I to some off the beaten path local restaurants that were wonderful. My only criticism of the hotel is the omnipresence of cigarette butts in the sand, both in the coconut grove, and on the beach. There are NO outdoor ashtrays or spent-butt-buckets anywhere at the resort, which is a disappointment. At high tide, the butts are loosed from the sand and float in the water everywhere. Surely a hotel of this caliber could arrange for either ashtrays, or at the very least, sift the sand regularly. If you don't mind the filter fish, it's a perfect vacation selection.  
<Date>Jun 13, 2003

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>OK, not great Having read most of the reviews, my wife and I were really expecting a very beautiful hotel. The hotel property was beautiful (although they are doing construction right next to the hotel) and was not too disappointing. The restaurants at the hotel are very good (but definitely overpriced). The bar was pretty fun--This hotel is the place where the Pina Colada first was made, so that was pretty cool. Our hotel room, however, was fairly dirty (especially the bathroom) and just quite average. The pool is ok, the small beach was ok. The dock overlooking the ocean and tropical fish was really neat (there are shark and baracuda at night--really cool). Rent a car (although the traffic is horrible) or expect to pay for taxis. Walking from this area is pretty spooky, especially at night! We wouldn't go back to Puerto Rico or Caribe Hilton until we visit the other 100 places we would like to see.  
<Date>Jun 12, 2003

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>I loved the hotel I had a super time this spring break. Puerto Rico is gorgeous and the people are great. I think that Puerto Rico is one of the most romantic places to be if you are traveling with someone special. If you are traveling alone it is still awesome. The clubs are also fun. The Caribe Hilton is an excellent hotel to stay at. The hammocks are cool and the pool and view of the ocean are great. When I go back to San Juan (Condado), the Caribe Hilton is where I will stay. The hotel is a little out of the way of downtown San Juan, but it only takes 5 to 7 minutes to get downtown by cab depending on the traffic. Personally, I prefer it that way.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Grand time at a bargain rate Stayed from May 17th thru 23rd and had a great time. Basically, we got the room for under $100 so in my opinion this place is a downright luxury bargain. The room basically looked like every other Hilton room -- nice, clean but corperate. Our room had a view of the inlet (and part of the parking garage). The staff was exceptionally friendly. The spa was expensive but wonderful. The beach was private, a little rocky, but nice(fantastic snokeling right off the shore -- thousands of fish). The grounds and pool area are extraordinary and well maintained. The food and drinks were overpriced and mediocre, but considering it's hotel food, we expected that. The location near Old San Juan was wonderful, you're better off just taking the bus (25c) or taxi ($8) and enjoying the amazing restaurants there. The giftshop (again) is overpriced but we just went to the Walgreens in Old San Juan to stocked up on water and supplies for 1/3 of the price. Travel desk was staffed by an insane (but very friendly  helpful) woman. Highly recommend the Spread Eagle Catamaran trip and the Rainforest tour. Basically I stay here before I'd stay anywhere in the Condado, though the Intercontinental and Wyndham in Isle Verde are nicer (but far from Old San Juan which is the gem of the city).  
<Date>Jun 11, 2003

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Loved Puerto Rico We arrived at Caribe Hilton and we loved the open lobby, parrot and live music playing. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Our room was ready after 20 minutes during which time they told us where we could change and place our bags if we wanted to go to the pool. The hotel has been remodeled recently and the lobby, outdoor pools, restaurants, and shops show it. We felt this was the best grounds possible with many pools, palm trees, hammocks, swim to bars it was a dream! We only had seven days and we did many day trips but had a hard time because it was so beautiful at the Caribe Hilton. You can easily walk the 3 miles to Old San Juan, it is a beautiful walk all along the ocean. You can find amazing food in Condado area a 1/2 mile walk. The tour through the hotel to Culebra snorkeling was the best. Lonely Planet tour book is very helpful. LOVED IT!

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Nightmare When we arrived in at the Caribe Hilton on 5/18/2003, we were pleasantly suprised at the landscape and grounds, but horribly dissappointed with the room. First of all, it had wood panel walls, the bathrrom sink nobs wouldn't turn unless you are Hulk Hogan, and the balcony door didn't open until my 250lb boyfriend literally threw himself on it. The room itself had the look of a cabin in the mountains rather than a tropical paradise. We aren't cpmlainers, so we sucked it up and decided to make the best of the resort without asking to switch rooms.the staff were generally pleasant, but I was very embarrassed one night when I went to take a walk on the pier very late and one of the lobby men came out to see if I was alright, thinking that maybe I was going to jump or something. It was nice he was concerned but I was very uncomfortable with the situation. Everything else was okay throughout the week, but then again we didn't spend much time at the hotel. The real kicker was at the end of the week when we had to leave and called for a wake-up call for 5:00am. We didn't recieve the call, or at least we thought we didn't when we woke up at 8:00 am and realized we missed our flight! My boyfriend went to the front desk immediately and talked to a man named Lewis who informed us that the hotel made a mistake and they were very sorry. When we checked for the next flight, the next one we could get was 4 days away! So we had to spend 4 more nights and lots more money not to mention missed work. The hotel refused to help compensate us at all including giving us a room for any of those four nights. Then another desk clerk had the gull to say that we had recieved the wake-up call, but we must have slept through it. After lots of investigating it was determined that our phone malfunctioned. After all of this, we didn't get so much as an I'm sorry from this 5 star hotel. Absolutely ridiculous! We would never stay there again and we don't recommend that anyone else does either. Thedham which are priced the same and much more elegant.  
<Date>Jun 1, 2003
